finding: The SNP rs429358 related to the APOE4 allele was found to be significant in distinguishing between cognitive-normal APOE4 carriers and noncarriers. Carriers showed a greater anticipatory increase and greater decrease in MCAv during orthostasis. As the disease progressed to mild cognitive impairment (MCI) and Alzheimer's disease (AD), the MCAv and MAP responses in APOE4 carriers became delayed and attenuated.
title: APOE4 carriers display loss of anticipatory cerebral vascular regulation over AD progression

finding: The SNP rs7412 associated with the APOE allele classification also demonstrated its relevance in the study. Although specifically not highlighted in detailed findings separately, it was necessary for classifying individuals as APOE4 carriers or noncarriers. The differences in hemodynamic responses during orthostasis were primarily evident in those with the APOE4 allele from the analysis conducted.
title: APOE4 carriers display loss of anticipatory cerebral vascular regulation over AD progression

finding: The SNP rs1808382, which maps to the ACTN4 gene, demonstrated a significant association with retinal vessel tortuosity, contributing to the understanding of vascular and connective tissue stability in disease contexts. This finding was particularly notable as it related to coronary artery disease, indicating its probable role as a biomarker for cardiovascular conditions.
title: GWAS of Retinal Vessel Tortuosity Identifies 173 Novel Loci Revealing Genes and Pathways Associated with Vascular Pathomechanics and Diseases

finding: The rs429358 variant within the APOE ε4 locus was strongly associated with Alzheimer's disease. It exhibited shared genetic influences with functional connectivity traits in both resting and task fMRI, specifically in the secondary visual and default mode networks. The risk allele ('C') correlated with decreased functional connectivity in the visual cortex, highlighted as a significant factor in visual deficits observed in Alzheimer's patients.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: It was found to be associated with expression of TIMM44 in cis and regulation of IFNB1 during Mtb infection, showing an important role in host immune responses.
title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis-dependent Monocyte Expression Quantitative Trait Loci and Tuberculosis Pathogenesis

finding: On chromosome 19, rs10713223 was identified as a vital SNP during trans-ancestry GWAS linked to vestibulocochlear disorders with a P-value of 3.11 × 10−08. It showed replication in other cohorts indicating reliability and significance in chronic dizziness.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: rs17473980 showed a significant difference in allele frequencies between two studies during the case-case GWAS analysis, with a notable P-value of 1.52 × 10−23. It was linked with distinct phenotypes that contributed to chronic dizziness.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: The sentinel variant rs10421326 was associated with increased varenicline effectiveness and showed connections to various blood cell measurements, projecting a link between genetics and treatment response.
title: Genome-wide association study of varenicline-aided smoking cessation

finding: The lead SNP rs4802269 at locus 19q13.32 was identified as an eQTL for nearby genes in tissue types related to depression and weight, representing a novel finding in the genetic analysis of depression associated with obesity traits.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and schizophrenia in East Asians

finding: The SNP rs3810291 in the ZC3H4 gene was found to have significant associations with type 2 diabetes in the liability method, which were absent in the binary method. The result corroborated findings in existing literature regarding the genetic factors influencing type 2 diabetes.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs146660284 was identified in the African ancestry cohort at a P-value of 2.5 x 10^-8 and a beta of 0.67, indicating a significant association with telomere length that was not detected in non-Finnish European (NFE) analyses. This finding highlighted the importance of including diverse ancestries in gene discovery for TL.
title: Genetic architecture of telomere length in 462,675 UK Biobank whole-genome sequences

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD) pathology in relation to APOE genotype. Specifically, the finding indicated that among APOE ε4 carriers, the typical association between African ancestry (AFR) proportion and Clinical Dementia Rating sum of boxes (CDR-SOB) disappeared. This suggested a modification of the risk linked to the APOE ε4 allele based on ancestry, whereby the APOE ε4 risk was attenuated in individuals of African descent compared to those of European descent. Additionally, the study highlighted that APOE ε4 genotype was tied to worse AD neuropathological burden exclusively in individuals with a European APOE background.
title: Global and local ancestry modulate APOE association with Alzheimer’s neuropathology and cognitive outcomes in an admixed sample

finding: The SNP rs429358, part of the APOE genotype, was associated with an increased risk of Alzheimer's Disease (AD) in carriers of the APOE4 allele. This finding was essential in understanding genetic susceptibility to AD, especially as it was analyzed in the context of socioeconomic factors and cognitive performance.
title: Sex differences in the associations of socioeconomic factors and cognitive performance with family history of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7412, also part of the APOE genotype, was similarly linked to Alzheimer's Disease (AD) risk, particularly among APOE4 carriers. The study's insights into this SNP provided context for how genetic predispositions interacted with the effects of higher socioeconomic factors and cognitive performance on family history of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Sex differences in the associations of socioeconomic factors and cognitive performance with family history of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the numerous alleles of the APOE gene, particularly for the epsilon 3 and epsilon 4 alleles. This association was relevant to the study as these alleles are known to influence the risk for Alzheimer's disease. The genetic dosage of these alleles, particularly epsilon 4, showed a significant correlation with increased dementia risk.
title: Analysis of 470,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank participants identifies genes containing rare variants which confer dementia risk

finding: The SNP rs7412 was implicated in determining the alleles of the APOE gene, specifically contributing to the identification of the epsilon 3 and epsilon 4 variant status. This SNP also demonstrated its importance in assessing the risk for Alzheimer's disease, as it played a key role in evaluating the overall genetic predisposition towards dementia.
title: Analysis of 470,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank participants identifies genes containing rare variants which confer dementia risk

finding: The SNP rs492602 was identified at the FUT2 gene locus and was colocalized with VTE risk in the context of SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs10402468 was found to be significantly associated with DME, located within intron 3 of the gene BABAM1. The A allele was linked to an odds ratio of 1.55 and a p-value of 4.62×10^-13 in the meta-analysis. Replication in similar cohorts showed robust findings, supporting its role in DME risk.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS analysis identifies two novel loci associated with diabetic eye disease and highlights APOL1 as a high risk locus in patients with diabetic macular edema

finding: The rs429358 missense variant in APOE was associated with a decrease in both BMI and weight over time, independent of baseline obesity. Each minor C allele was linked to a 0.060 SD decrease in expected BMI slope and a 0.063 SD decrease in expected weight slope, establishing a robust connection with weight loss across various ancestral groups.
title: The genetic architecture of changes in adiposity during adulthood

finding: The rs429358 SNP was found to be associated with the downregulation of four proteins (TBCA, ARL2, S100A13, and IRF6) due to the presence of the C allele, which reflects a genetic predisposition related to LOAD. This finding indicated that the proteins not only exhibited changes in expression due to APOE genotype but also highlighted their significance as biomarkers potentially involved in the molecular processes of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Serum proteomics reveals APOE dependent and independent protein signatures in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs769449 variant on the APOE locus was significantly associated with all three CSF biomarkers (Aβ, p-tau, and t-tau), supporting its role as a genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of CSF biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease cohorts

finding: The variant rs601338, located in the RASIP1 gene, was associated with antibodies against Norwalk virus. This association was significant, showing a strong statistical correlation (P = 2.3 × 10^-9). The variant was found to be in partial linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the FUT2 stop mutation, which is known to determine secretor status, a recognized risk factor for Norovirus infection causing winter vomiting disease. This finding emphasized the role of genetic factors, particularly at the FUT2 locus, in mediating immune responses to viral infections.
title: A systematic investigation into the non-genetic and genetic factors affecting the human anti-viral antibody repertoire

finding: The rs7246865 variant was identified as a key SMC dynamic caQTL and a V2E2G link. Its role was validated through ChIP-seq that indicated its involvement in enhancing MYO9B and HAUS8 expression, suggesting its influence in the molecular pathways contributing to CAD.
title: Single cell variant to enhancer to gene map for coronary artery disease

finding: The variant rs732310, associated with the AMH gene, was confirmed as a novel signal for PCOS. Although it did not show a direct association with AMH levels, it was linked to crucial ovarian functions, suggesting its role in the pathology of PCOS despite the complex hormonal landscape in affected women.
title: Genomic and proteomic evidence for hormonal and metabolic foundations of polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The SNP rs429358 was involved in determining genotypes for APOE E2/E3/E4 alleles, contributing to the understanding of genetic predisposition to lipid profiles.
title: Genetic Architecture And Clinical Outcomes Of The Fredrickson-Levy-Lees Dyslipoproteinemias

finding: Similar to rs429358, rs7412 was used to determine APOE genotypes, adding valuable data regarding its association with lipid levels and related disorders.
title: Genetic Architecture And Clinical Outcomes Of The Fredrickson-Levy-Lees Dyslipoproteinemias

finding: The variant rs17632542, linked to KLK3 at 19q13.33, exhibited extremely high significance (P = 3.2 x 10^-638), highlighting its role in PSA variation and cancer susceptibility, reaffirming its critical importance in prostate cancer research.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs2735837 in KLK3 was associated with significant effects on PSA, underpinning its critical role in prostate cancer risk studies.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Found in KLK3, the variant rs374546878 was highlighted for its significant association with PSA, reinforcing its importance in the genetic landscape of prostate cancer.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs1054713 linked with KLK1 demonstrated a significant association with PSA, contributing to the understanding of its genetic determinants.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs76765083, which was previously associated with KLK3, showcased significant results in the context of PSA studies, contributing to understanding key genetic factors in prostate cancer.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The rs429358 SNP was associated with the APOE gene isoforms. Specifically, the presence of the C allele indicated the APOE4 allele (Arg130Arg158), which was linked to an increased risk of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) in the cohort studied, as highlighted by the reported associations with K. pneumoniae infection.
title: Klebsiella pneumoniae infection increases risk of Alzheimer’s Disease in the UK Biobank cohort

finding: The rs7412 SNP was also linked to the APOE gene isoforms. Its presence allowed differentiation of the APOE alleles, specifically indicating an individual’s APOE4 status (if the C allele was present) and thereby contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors for Alzheimer’s disease in relation to K. pneumoniae infections.
title: Klebsiella pneumoniae infection increases risk of Alzheimer’s Disease in the UK Biobank cohort

finding: As an important autosomal dominant variant, rs201118034 was associated with a risk difference (RD) of about 6%, reaching 10% in older populations (ages 60-80), specifically in relation to CADASIL.
title: Deleterious Variants Contribute Minimal Excess Risk in Large-Scale Testing

finding: The research determined that the PLIN4 variant rs8887 was associated with obesity-related phenotypes, specifically impacting weight outcomes. This finding was established through the observation that the methylation profiles of the gene PLIN4 in cord blood correlated with conditional weight gain, body mass index, and weight-for-length ratio in infants.
title: Methylation profiles at birth linked to early childhood obesity

finding: The SNP rs190712692, located near APOC1, was positively associated with lower body fat percentage (BFP) and also linked to lower high-density lipoprotein (HDL) and lower triglycerides (TG), while being associated with an increased risk of coronary artery disease (CAD). This finding was significant with p values of 3.4E-72 for HDL and 4.70E-338 for TG.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs7412, associated with the APOE locus, showed significant relationships with lower BFP as well as lower HDL and TG levels, and conferred an increased risk of CAD.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: Variant rs12459249 was linked to nicotine metabolite ratio in a study of approximately 1000 African American participants, highlighting its role in nicotine metabolism.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: The variant rs111645190 was identified as associated with nicotine metabolite ratio (NMR) in African Americans, suggesting genetic influences on nicotine processing.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: Variant rs185430475 was similarly associated with nicotine metabolite ratio (NMR), indicating its significance in nicotine metabolism among African Americans.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: The study examined the association of the rs7412 SNP with the ε4 genotype of the APOE gene. It found that carriers of the ε4 allele (including those with the genotypes ε2/ε4, ε3/ε4, and ε4/ε4) exhibited a modified risk pattern for dementia, indicating a significant connection between high levels of GFAP and NfL and increased dementia risk, particularly in the presence of hypercholesterolemia.
title: JOINT CONTRIBUTION OF MARKERS OF NEURODEGENERATION AND HYPERCHOLESTEROLEMIA TO DEMENTIA RISK

finding: The rs429358 SNP was also analyzed in the context of the APOE ε4 genotype, revealing that individuals possessing this allele showed a heightened association with dementia risk. The data suggested that the interaction between high levels of GFAP and NfL and the presence of the ε4 genotype, alongside total cholesterol levels, was crucial in predicting the likelihood of dementia.
title: JOINT CONTRIBUTION OF MARKERS OF NEURODEGENERATION AND HYPERCHOLESTEROLEMIA TO DEMENTIA RISK

finding: The SNP rs429358 was found to be associated with increased odds of developing hallucinations and cognitive decline. The study indicated that APOE E4 dosage, which includes the effects of this SNP, played a significant role in assessing the risk for these symptoms in participants.
title: Monogenic Parkinson’s Disease and the Impact of APOE E4: A Case-Control Study

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also associated with APOE E4 dosage and risk of cognitive decline and hallucinations. This SNP contributed to the assessment of genetic risk factors related to neurodegeneration in Parkinson's disease.
title: Monogenic Parkinson’s Disease and the Impact of APOE E4: A Case-Control Study

finding: This SNP showed significant association with CACNA1A and was part of the findings for cannabis use disorder.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The most significant association near the FUT2 gene (p=3.47e-19) highlights its potential role in substance use disorders.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: In the European male-specific analysis, rs1035064, linked to ZNF682, revealed interaction with STST for SBP, achieving a significant P-value of 4.8×10^-9, adding to the understanding of sex-specific influences on hypertension.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs10406644, identified previously for its interaction with STST for pulse pressure (PP), reaffirmed its significance with a P-value of 2.0×10^-4, contributing to hypertension risk factors.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The rs429358 variant in the APOE gene was significantly associated with longevity and showed that carriers had lower odds of longevity as compared to AD-risk.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: The rs7412 variant in the APOE gene was significantly associated with longevity, similar to the findings for rs429358, demonstrating the association between increased AD-risk and lower odds of longevity.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: The top SNP for nicotine metabolism, rs56113850, was found to be associated with genetically determined faster nicotine metabolism. This SNP was linked to higher levels of cholesterol, triglycerides, and LDL, indicating poorer cardiovascular health. Furthermore, it was also associated with cessation outcomes, where each additional allele C increased the odds of quitting smoking.
title: A Phenome-wide association study of genetically determined nicotine metabolism reveals novel links with health-related outcomes

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with an increased odds of hyperlipidemia with an odds ratio of 1.15 (P=1.8x10^-129) and with dementia, including Alzheimer's disease, with an odds ratio of 1.55 (P=5x10^-19). This SNP is one part of the National Institutes of Health (NIH)-supported data and serves as a critical specific locus influencing lipid metabolism and linked conditions.
title: Phenome-Wide Association of APOE Alleles in the All of Us Research Program

finding: The SNP rs7412 was implicated in reducing the odds of fatty liver disease (OR 0.93; P=1.6x10^-9) and chronic liver disease. It was also recognized as part of the analysis concerning Alzheimer's disease risk hierarchy, which informed findings on disease susceptibility and metabolic conditions, making it essential for understanding the phenotype associations related to APOE alleles.
title: Phenome-Wide Association of APOE Alleles in the All of Us Research Program

finding: The SNP rs429358 was part of an epistatic SNP combination identified by NeEDL in the APOE gene, which is a well-recognized factor in Alzheimer’s disease risk. This combination was previously noted as significant, supporting the involvement of epistasis in improving predictive models for the disease.
title: Network medicine-based epistasis detection in complex diseases: ready for quantum computing

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also included in the epistatic SNP combination identified in the APOE gene by NeEDL. This combination has been acknowledged in existing literature for its potential implications in understanding Alzheimer’s disease risk, thereby corroborating the importance of examining EIs among SNPs.
title: Network medicine-based epistasis detection in complex diseases: ready for quantum computing

finding: The index SNP rs77149320, mapping to the intronic region of FCAR, was significantly associated with an increased risk of nephritis and nephropathy with pathological lesions in IgAV cases. It was demonstrated to co-localize with enhancers and disrupted a PRDM1 binding motif.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: rs4806602 was reported to disrupt the PRDM1 binding motif in FCAR, suggesting its role in the regulation of immune responses and cell signaling pathways relevant to IgAV pathogenesis.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: Similar to rs4806602, rs73065472 also disrupted the PRDM1 binding motif, indicating a shared mechanism by which these linked alleles influence the functionality of FCAR in myeloid cells.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: The deep intronic variant rs1865097 was associated with a reduced exclusion rate for a specific region of FCAR, thereby influencing splicing and function of the transmembrane domain, providing insights into IgAN pathogenesis.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: The SNP rs7412 was utilized to determine the apolipoprotein E (APOE) epsilon alleles. This analysis was part of the genetic assessment in both the ESTHER cohort and the UK Biobank participants, where the resulting genotypes were classified into six common APOE genotypes that are known to be associated with varying risks for Alzheimer's disease (AD).
title: Long-term low-dose acetylsalicylic use shows protective potential for the development of both vascular dementia and Alzheimer’s disease in patients with coronary heart disease but not in other individuals from the general population: results from two large cohort studies

finding: Similar to rs7412, the SNP rs429358 was also analyzed to determine the apolipoprotein E (APOE) epsilon alleles, contributing crucial genotyping data in the ESTHER and UK Biobank studies. This specific SNP was instrumental in classifying participants into APOE genotypes that are relevant for understanding genetic predisposition to Alzheimer's disease (AD) and potentially other forms of dementia.
title: Long-term low-dose acetylsalicylic use shows protective potential for the development of both vascular dementia and Alzheimer’s disease in patients with coronary heart disease but not in other individuals from the general population: results from two large cohort studies

finding: The SNP was linked to the INSR gene, which was associated with both thyroid function and erectile dysfunction, indicating a plausible genetic overlap in these conditions.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The variant rs429358, tagging APOE4, was identified to have significant interactions with age on both apolipoprotein B (ApoB) and triglycerides (TG). It had a P-interaction of 9.0e-14 for ApoB and 5.4e-16 for TG, demonstrating that its effects were strongest in younger age groups but attenuated with increasing age. This finding was replicated in both the Estonian Biobank and the Copenhagen General Population Study.
title: Large-scale genome-wide interaction analyses on multiple cardiometabolic risk factors to identify age-specific genetic risk factors

finding: The variant rs17248720, found near the LDL receptor (LDLR), exhibited a significant age interaction effect on ApoB, with a P-interaction of 2.0e-09. Its impact lessened with age, highlighting a relationship between genetic predisposition and age-related changes in ApoB levels.
title: Large-scale genome-wide interaction analyses on multiple cardiometabolic risk factors to identify age-specific genetic risk factors

finding: The variant rs76151346 in the KLK3 gene showed a strong association in the African cohort with a beta of 0.0821 (p=4.6e-11), highlighting its importance in influencing PSA levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: The variant rs145428838 also in KLK3 was reported with a beta of 0.224 (p=1.4e-13) in the African cohort, marking it as a significant contributor to PSA levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: Variant rs182464120 in KLK2 gene demonstrated a negative association with a beta of -0.213 (p=2.0e-10) in African ancestry indicating its relevance to PSA levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: The variant rs17632542 showed significant association with KLK3 abundance in the meta-analysis, contributing to understanding PSA level correlations.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: The rs61752561 variant also had a significant association with KLK3 levels in the analyses conducted.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: The rs7412 SNP, as part of the APOE epsilon genotype, was associated with cognitive performance in terms of processing speed and executive function. Carriers of the APOE epsilon4 genotype showed reduced cognitive performance in a dose-dependent manner, supporting previous findings related to cognitive decline in older aged females.
title: Female-specific factors are associated with cognition in the UK Biobank cohort

finding: Similar to rs7412, rs429358 SNP was implicated in determining the APOE epsilon genotype and exhibited a dose-dependent effect on reduced processing speed and executive function among carriers of the APOE epsilon4 allele. This finding reiterated the significance of APOE genotype in cognitive decline, particularly related to age and female-specific health factors.
title: Female-specific factors are associated with cognition in the UK Biobank cohort

finding: The missense mutation in CFD (rs35186399, p.Glu69Lys) showed a decreased risk for AMD with an odds ratio of 0.73 and led to lower complement C8 levels, highlighting its protective role.
title: Distinctive cross-ancestry genetic architecture for age-related macular degeneration

finding: The missense mutation in RRAS (rs61760904, p.Asp133Asn) had an odds ratio of 0.75 and was associated with increased blood pressure, indicating a novel protective function against AMD.
title: Distinctive cross-ancestry genetic architecture for age-related macular degeneration

finding: The rs7246865 variant was related to the MYO9B gene associated with CAD and prioritized based on significant genomic and expression data.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The SNP rs429358, corresponding to the <italic>APOE</italic> gene, exhibited a highly significant association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) with an effect size comparable to the previously identified TREM2.pR47H. This finding was established based on the analysis of the polygenic risk scores (PRS), which indicated that variants in the <italic>APOE</italic> locus contributed to AD risk, underscoring the genetic implications of innate immunity in the disease.
title: Polygenic risk score analysis identifies deleterious protein-coding variants in novel immune pathway genes ATP8B4, FCGR1A, and LILRB1 that associate with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs429358, mapped to the gene APOE, was identified as the top variant in the cluster 'Increased inflammation' with a cluster weight of 4.6. This variant was more frequent in participants of inferred European ancestry (EUR), highlighting its significant association with inflammation related traits.
title: A clustering approach to improve our understanding of the genetic and phenotypic complexity of chronic kidney disease

finding: The SNP rs429358 was part of the APOE gene variation known to significantly influence the risk of Alzheimer’s disease. Individuals carrying the ε4 allele, defined by the combinations of rs429358 CC and rs7412 genotypes, were identified as having a heightened risk for developing Alzheimer's disease, thus demonstrating a critical link between APOE genotypes and dementia-related phenotypes.
title: Multi-organ imaging-derived polygenic indexes for brain and body health

finding: The SNP rs7412, in conjunction with rs429358, was used to classify APOE genotypes which helped stratify participants into different risk categories for Alzheimer’s disease. The presence of rs7412 in certain combinations with rs429358 indicated varying degrees of risk, especially for individuals who were classified as ε4 carriers (those with either ε4δ or ε3δ alleles), further substantiating the role of APOE in neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Multi-organ imaging-derived polygenic indexes for brain and body health

finding: SNP rs79668907, associated with SPC24, was linked to LDL cholesterol levels and showcased significant heterogeneity in effect sizes between different ancestry groups in the studies conducted.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The LDLR p.G137S variant (rs730882082) was found to be associated with significantly elevated levels of LDL cholesterol, total cholesterol, and apolipoprotein B among the Greenlandic population. Approximately 29.5% of participants carried at least one copy of the risk allele, with 25.4% of heterozygous carriers and 54.7% of homozygous carriers exhibiting high levels of LDL cholesterol, indicating an association with familial hypercholesterolemia (FH). Additionally, the variant correlated with an increased risk of ischaemic heart disease (HR 1.51), peripheral artery disease (HR 1.69), and coronary operations (HR 1.78), highlighting its potential as a marker for cardiovascular disease risk in Arctic populations.
title: An LDLR missense variant poses high risk of familial hypercholesterolemia in 30% of Greenlanders and offers potential for early cardiovascular disease intervention

finding: This SNP was characterized as the lead cis-meQTL for cg17944885 located at chr19p13.2. It was notably replicated in the general population data from GoDMC, establishing its significance in relation to methylation levels.
title: Blood methylation biomarkers are associated with diabetic kidney disease progression in type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as the single lead variant associated with Lewy body dementia and is part of a cluster linking it to the APOE gene. This variant was connected to nine age-related traits including age-related macular degeneration, Alzheimer's disease, atherosclerosis, longevity, stroke, obesity, osteoarthritis, type 2 diabetes, and lipid measurement, showcasing significant overlaps with healthspan.
title: Integrative analysis of GWAS and co-localisation data suggests novel genes associated with age-related multimorbidity

finding: The rs7412 SNP was one of the markers used to genotype the APOE e4 allele, which was established as a risk factor for cognitive decline and dementia. In the analyzed cohort, the presence of the APOE e4 allele increased the risk of dementia and worse cognitive functions, but again, there were no observed interactions with KL genotype.
title: Lack of evidence for interactions between APOE and Klotho genotypes on cognitive, dementia and brain imaging metrics in UK Biobank

finding: The rs429358 SNP was implicated in identifying the presence of the APOE e4 genotype. The study confirmed that individuals with the APOE e4 allele experienced worse cognitive abilities and increased dementia risk. However, as with the other SNPs, no significant interactions were found between APOE e4 and KL genotype in affecting cognitive outcomes.
title: Lack of evidence for interactions between APOE and Klotho genotypes on cognitive, dementia and brain imaging metrics in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as being associated with cerebral infarction in the study population, specifically in the southern Chinese Hakka population, indicating its significance in impacting cognitive health and potential relevance to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Seed-based morphometry of nodes in the default mode network among patients with Alzheimer’s disease in Klang Valley, Malaysia

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also found to be associated with cerebral infarction in the same population. This finding highlights its potential implications in neurodegenerative conditions such as Alzheimer's disease.
title: Seed-based morphometry of nodes in the default mode network among patients with Alzheimer’s disease in Klang Valley, Malaysia

finding: The SNP rs10420798, which was identified as critical in the Pain Questionnaire cohort, was replicated in the fibromyalgia cohort analysis, demonstrating a strong association with fibromyalgia.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for ME/CFS Identified using Combinatorial Analysis

finding: The variant rs548960608 was located on chromosome 19 and associated with the gene CEBPA. This was a positive original finding in the study, indicating its upregulation in excitatory neurons, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors in AD.
title: Identification of 16 novel Alzheimer’s disease susceptibility loci using multi-ancestry meta-analyses of clinical Alzheimer’s disease and AD-by-proxy cases from four whole genome sequencing datasets

finding: The SNP rs429358 replicated the protective effect of APOE ε4 allele against PSP (OR[95%CI]=0.72[0.53–0.96]; p=0.02), showcasing its relevance in this context.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: The SNP rs3752246 in the ABCA7 gene demonstrated a strong association with levels of lactosylceramides (LacCer) related to Alzheimer's disease (AD), with a Pearson correlation coefficient of -0.53 and a significance level of <0.0001. This association indicated that variations in the ABCA7 gene affected LacCer levels, which were linked to cognitive performance in humans and potentially causal factors of AD. Furthermore, the study established that the deletion of the Abca7 gene in mice altered sphingolipid metabolism, thus substantiating the role of ABCA7 in AD risk through metabolic pathways.
title: Metabolome-wide association study on ABCA7 demonstrates a role for ceramide metabolism in impaired cognitive performance and Alzheimer’s disease

finding: This SNP was the top SNP identified in the case-control neuropathologically-confirmed Alzheimer's Disease (ncAD) GWAS, with a significant association (p-value=5.8×10⁻⁵⁵, Z=-9.55), indicating its relevance in the context of Alzheimer's susceptibility.
title: Neuropathology-based GWAS for Alzheimer’s disease reveals novel susceptibility loci and highlights sex-specific pathways

finding: This SNP was identified as the top SNP for the Braak stage GWAS, displaying strong association (p-value=9.85×10⁻⁵³, Z=15.28), linking it to AD neuropathology.
title: Neuropathology-based GWAS for Alzheimer’s disease reveals novel susceptibility loci and highlights sex-specific pathways

finding: This SNP was identified as the top SNP in the NP score GWAS, showing a significant association (p-value=3.91×10⁻³⁴, Z=12.18) in relation to Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: Neuropathology-based GWAS for Alzheimer’s disease reveals novel susceptibility loci and highlights sex-specific pathways

finding: The SNP rs201680145, which corresponds to the NOTCH3 variant NM_000435.3:c.3691C>T (p.Arg1231Cys), was found to be significantly associated with subcortical hemorrhagic stroke (odds ratio [OR] 3.39, 95% confidence interval [CI] [2.26, 5.10], p value 3.87×10^-9) and also with all strokes combined (OR 2.30, 95% CI [1.77, 3.01], p value 7.79×10^-10) in a South Asian population. This variant was enriched in South Asians with an alternate allele frequency of 0.58% compared to only 0.019% in Western Europeans. It was attributed to approximately 2.0% of hemorrhagic strokes and 1.1% of all strokes in this population.
title: NOTCH3 p.Arg1231Cys is Markedly Enriched in South Asians and Associated with Stroke

finding: The SNP rs1260634 in the LSM14A gene was significantly associated with DKD, influencing DNA methylation at a CpG site and showing associations with kidney function, underscoring its role in disease mechanisms (p=2.1×10^-28).
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis and omics integration identifies novel genes associated with diabetic kidney disease

finding: An association with the rare variant rs532051930 in the promoter of EEF2 was highlighted for its potential link to COVID-19 hospitalization. This variant was observed in 2,085 hospitalized COVID-19 cases compared to 534,965 controls, and it showed a high odds ratio (OR=93.9), indicating a strong association despite not reaching genome-wide significance. Notably, this finding was supported by two independent studies, and multiple additional rare variants in the same promoter region displayed directionally-consistent associations with the hospitalization phenotype. Furthermore, the variant was predicted to disrupt transcription factor binding, which could affect EEF2 gene expression, and its presence correlated with high EEF2 expression levels in one individual carrying the variant. However, subsequent analyses of 4,341 COVID-19 cases failed to find any carriers of this variant, raising uncertainty about the strength and replicability of the association.
title: A catalog of associations between rare coding variants and COVID-19 outcomes

finding: This SNP was most strongly associated with BD in the East Asian ancestry meta-analysis, indicating its significant role within that specific population.
title: Genomics yields biological and phenotypic insights into bipolar disorder

finding: SNP rs4806665 was found to colocalise with an eQTL for TMEM190, which is enriched in testes, suggesting its role in male reproductive processes.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: SNP rs429358 was identified as the famous known APOE E4 risk allele for Alzheimer’s disease (AD) with a Bayesian CPP of 0.144 and a p-value of 7.72 x 10^-13. It showed significant association across all five AD-related phenotypes.
title: Scalable Bayesian functional GWAS method accounting for multivariate quantitative functional annotations with applications to studying Alzheimer’s disease

finding: SNP rs10414043 was found to be upstream of the known risk gene APOC1 associated with Alzheimer’s disease, with a Bayesian CPP of 0.111 and a p-value of 2.71 x 10^-12.
title: Scalable Bayesian functional GWAS method accounting for multivariate quantitative functional annotations with applications to studying Alzheimer’s disease

finding: SNP rs7256200, identified upstream of the APOC1 gene, was associated with Alzheimer’s disease and blood protein traits, showing a Bayesian CPP of 0.315 and p-value of 2.71 x 10^-12.
title: Scalable Bayesian functional GWAS method accounting for multivariate quantitative functional annotations with applications to studying Alzheimer’s disease

finding: SNP rs1065853 was identified upstream of APOC1 and is known to be a GWAS signal for global AD pathology, particularly linked to blood protein traits such as low-density lipoprotein.
title: Scalable Bayesian functional GWAS method accounting for multivariate quantitative functional annotations with applications to studying Alzheimer’s disease

finding: This SNP, associated with coffee consumption, was reported in prior studies and highlights its genetic influence on coffee habits.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: This novel SNP (HCN2) was identified in the context of coffee consumption, suggesting it plays a significant role in this phenotype.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The minor allele of rs34536443, a known partial loss-of-function variant in TYK2, was associated with an increased risk of lung cancer and non-Hodgkin lymphoma. Specifically, each copy of the minor allele was linked to a 15% increased risk of lung cancer (OR 1.15, 95% CI 1.07-1.24, P = 1.72 × 10^-4) and an 18% increased risk of non-Hodgkin lymphoma (OR 1.18, 95% CI 1.05-1.33, P = 5.25 × 10^-3). These findings were derived from analyses involving 29,266 lung cancer cases and 56,450 controls for lung cancer, and 8,489 cases and 374,506 controls for non-Hodgkin lymphoma. This variant was previously shown to protect against psoriasis and other autoimmune diseases, indicating a possible dual effect of TYK2 inhibition that protects against autoimmunity while increasing cancer risk.
title: Germline TYK2 mutation and cancer risk

finding: The SNP rs429358, located within the APOE region, was part of a panel of 992 SNPs tested for association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) in the context of polygenic risk scores (PRS). The study found that protein PRS including the APOE region (APOE+) demonstrated significant association with AD, achieving results below the Bonferroni significance threshold (p-value < 0.00017). This indicated that variants in the APOE region, including rs429358, are linked to modifiable risk factors for AD, establishing a genetic signal relevant to the disease.
title: Assessing genetic overlap and causality between blood plasma proteins and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The study confirmed that the TOMM40:rs11556505-T variant had a modifying effect in individuals with APOE ε4 alleles, exhibiting higher frequencies in Europeans and lower frequencies in Africans across different phenotypes.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The APOE:rs449647-T variant was found to increase the risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD) in African and African Admixed ancestry carriers of APOE ε4, while it conferred a protective effect in European ancestry carriers. This differential risk modification was emphasized across multiple ancestries.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The 19q13.31:rs10423769-A variant emerged as a significant protective factor in reducing the risk of AD among Africans carrying APOE ε4, showcasing a higher frequency in controls compared to AD cases.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The SNP rs11085720, located in an intron of the DNMT1 gene, was found to be genome-wide significant with a p-value of 8.6 × 10−13 in the two degree of freedom analysis and 2.3 × 10−12 in the one degree of freedom analysis. It implicates potential associations with DNA methylation processes during embryonic development, possibly linking maternal effects on birth weight through epigenetic mechanisms, although not identified as significant in previous studies.
title: Direct and INdirect effects analysis of Genetic lOci (DINGO): A software package to increase the power of locus discovery in GWAS meta-analyses of perinatal phenotypes and traits influenced by indirect genetic effects

finding: With a p-value of 8.80×10−6, SNP rs10853894 demonstrated strong association, but the allele frequencies were not specified. It was associated with the ZNF17 gene, involved in transcription regulation and various cellular processes.
title: Genomic predictors of response to antidepressants in Major depressive disorder (MDD): A GWAS-Based Study on Indian cohort

finding: The rs7412 variant, which is a nonsynonymous variant located in APOE, was identified as an independent signal associated with VTE.
title: Cross-Ancestry Investigation of Venous Thromboembolism Genomic Predictors

finding: The rs429358 SNP, known as the APOE E4 tagging variant, was identified as being associated with cognition progression in Parkinson's Disease (PD). This finding was based on data analyzed from the Parkinson's Progression Markers Initiative (PPMI) cohort, enhancing the understanding of genetic influences on cognitive decline in PD patients.
title: Elucidating Molecular Networks Underpinning Heterogeneity in Parkinson’s Disease Progression Across Clinical Manifestation Spectrum

finding: The SNP rs61752561 was recognized for its impact on glycosylation and function of prostate-specific antigen (PSA), which is critical in the context of prostate cancer diagnostics and progression.
title: A novel Bayesian fine-mapping model using a continuous global-local shrinkage prior with applications in prostate cancer analysis

finding: The variant rs429358, a key determinant of APOE alleles, was associated with 2.48 attributable DALYs through increased risk of Alzheimer's disease, highlighting its significance for neurodegeneration.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: As a part of the APOE allele assessment, rs7412, along with rs429358, indicated a substantial increase of 2.48 attributable DALYs linked to dementia risks.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: The SNP rs143473297 in TOMM40 was identified to account for 56.1 yearly population DALYs per 100,000 in Finnish ancestry, mainly correlating with dementia risk.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: The rs2032905 variant was located near TSHZ3 and had strong eQTL associations primarily in induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs). The gene was significant for its role in the development of the corticostriatal circuitry, suggesting implications for miscarriage.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: Although rs11085727 reached suggestive significance in the both-controls GWAS, it was linked to TYK2 and indicated a possible involvement in psoriatic arthritis.
title: Accurate cross-platform GWAS analysis via two-stage imputation

finding: This SNP, also linked to TYK2, showed suggestive significance in the both-controls GWAS, suggesting its potential relevance to psoriatic arthritis.
title: Accurate cross-platform GWAS analysis via two-stage imputation

finding: The SNP rs641738 in the gene MBOAT7 was recognized in previous studies to associate with liver disease susceptibility, further indicating the connection between metabolic disorders and glucagon signaling pathways.
title: Studies to develop a glucagon sensitivity test in humans: The GLUSENTIC study protocol

finding: The SNP rs58542926 in the gene TM6SF2 was established as significant for liver disease risk, contributing to the understanding of glucagon and liver metabolism interactions.
title: Studies to develop a glucagon sensitivity test in humans: The GLUSENTIC study protocol

finding: In the melanoma OCEANS panel, rs10250 was confirmed as a non-pathogenic SNP variant in the MAP2K2-207 amplicon. This finding demonstrated the ability of the OCEANS method to accurately call variants, albeit some being non-pathogenic.
title: Oncogene Concatenated Enriched Amplicon Nanopore Sequencing for Rapid, Accurate, and Affordable Somatic Mutation Detection

finding: The SNP rs429358, associated with the APOE gene, was significantly linked to multiple measures of cognitive function, including the Hindi Mental State Examination (HMSE) score, general cognitive function, executive function, and orientation. It was identified as a common variant and served to differentiate the APOE ε4 allele from ε2 and ε3. Its CADD score indicated a deleterious effect, and despite earlier studies not finding an association, this study identified significant correlations likely due to the larger sample size.
title: Region-based analysis with functional annotation identifies genes associated with cognitive function in South Asians from India

finding: The SNP rs7412 was part of the genotyping strategy for the APOE locus and contributed to the categorization of individuals into six sub-genotypes based on their APOE status. The findings indicated that individuals with the rs7412 (APOE ε4) allele demonstrated a modified association with cognitive decline, especially when interacting with polygenic risk scores related to Alzheimer's disease around the age of 70.
title: Apolipoprotein E moderates the association between Non-APOE Polygenic Risk Score for Alzheimer’s Disease and Aging on Preclinical Cognitive Function

finding: Similar to rs7412, rs429358 played a critical role in determining APOE genotypes and was included in the classification of APOE ε4 carriers. The presence of this SNP was linked with a significant interaction effect with the polygenic risk score on cognitive decline, emphasizing the heightened risk of cognitive impairment in individuals carrying the ε4 allele across different cognitive domains.
title: Apolipoprotein E moderates the association between Non-APOE Polygenic Risk Score for Alzheimer’s Disease and Aging on Preclinical Cognitive Function

finding: The rs7412 variant of the APOE gene had been identified as a substantive risk factor for cognitive impairment, particularly in relation to Alzheimer's disease. The presence of the E4 allele, which is determined by this SNP, was linked to a significantly increased risk for late-onset Alzheimer's disease.
title: History of incarceration and age-related cognitive impairment: Testing models of genetic and environmental risk in longitudinal panel study of older adults

finding: The rs429358 variant of the APOE gene was also recognized as a critical genetic factor in determining Alzheimer's disease risk. This SNP contributed to the risk conferred by the APOE-ε4 allele, reinforcing its association with cognitive impairment and an increased likelihood of developing neurodegenerative conditions.
title: History of incarceration and age-related cognitive impairment: Testing models of genetic and environmental risk in longitudinal panel study of older adults

finding: The variant rs429358, associated with the APOE gene, was identified as a significant predictor for Alzheimer’s disease and was reported as having a dose-dependent effect on the risk of developing Alzheimer's disease. It was among the top risk SNPs in both the HLA GIA and AA GIA models.
title: Improving genetic risk modeling of dementia from real-world data in underrepresented populations

finding: rs2075650, located near the TOMM40 gene, was identified as a significant predictor for dementia in both GIA Elastic Net SNP models, marking it as an important SNP associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Improving genetic risk modeling of dementia from real-world data in underrepresented populations

finding: This SNP, near the APOC1 gene, was one of the top important predictors for dementia within the HLA GIA group, suggesting its relevance in predicting risk for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Improving genetic risk modeling of dementia from real-world data in underrepresented populations

finding: The rs7412 SNP, part of the Apolipoprotein E (APOE) genotype, was associated with increased risk of dementia. Specifically, individuals who were heterozygous or homozygous for the APOE ε4 allele—linked to this SNP—exhibited a 2.5-fold and 6.3-fold increased risk of developing dementia, respectively, compared to those carrying the APOE ε3/ε3 genotype. This finding was significant with a p-value of less than 0.001.
title: Effect of APOE and a polygenic risk score on incident dementia and cognitive decline in a healthy older population

finding: The rs429358 SNP, also within the Apolipoprotein E (APOE) genotype, similarly indicated an increased risk of dementia. Individuals with heterozygous or homozygous APOE ε4 status showed a 2.5-fold and 6.3-fold increased risk, respectively, compared to the ε3/ε3 carriers, corroborating the associations seen with rs7412. This outcome was statistically significant (P<0.001) and highlighted the impact of APOE genotypes on cognitive decline.
title: Effect of APOE and a polygenic risk score on incident dementia and cognitive decline in a healthy older population

finding: The SNP rs768563000, associated with the low-density lipoprotein receptor (LDLR), was reported as a likely pathogenic variant confirmed in 5 out of 8 MVP participants suspected to have a pathogenic variant. The relevant change was NM_000527.5(LDLR):c.718G>T (p.Glu240Ter). The intervention demonstrated a significant reduction in low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) levels averaging −37 mg/dL following genetic counseling, indicating its clinical relevance.
title: Introducing return of results in the Million Veteran Program: Design and pilot results of the MVP-ROAR Familial Hypercholesterolemia Study

finding: The SNP rs377271627, identified as NM_000527.5(LDLR):c.296C>G (p.Ser99Ter), was included among the selected variants for potential return to participants. It was part of a broader research effort that confirmed pathogenic variants in the context of familial hypercholesterolemia and led to clinical interventions that positively impacted LDL-C levels.
title: Introducing return of results in the Million Veteran Program: Design and pilot results of the MVP-ROAR Familial Hypercholesterolemia Study

finding: The study identified rs746301110, a novel low-frequency variant in the RUVBL2 gene, which exhibited a very strong association with opioid dependence (OD) in European ancestry participants (p=6.59×10^-10). This variant was categorized as a rare INDEL (ATAGA/-, MAF<0.01) specific to this population, with evidence suggesting its functional significance through in silico predictions of splice acceptor impact.
title: Whole-exome sequencing study of opioid dependence offers novel insights into the contributions of exome variants

finding: The SNP rs429358, located in the APOE gene, was strongly associated with 13 of the 17 endophenotypes studied. It exhibited a significant influence on measures of amyloid-β, tau, glucose metabolism, and overall cognitive memory score.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: The SNP rs72986630 was found to drive the expression of the gene ZNF823. This C/T SNP was protective against schizophrenia and was predicted to disrupt a REST binding site motif, leading to increased expression of ZNF823 through decreased binding of REST in non-neuronal cells.
title: Trans-ethnic eQTL meta-analysis of human brain reveals regulatory architecture and candidate causal variants for brain-related traits

finding: This SNP represented a stop-gain variant in FUT2 that was closely linked to chronic sputum production risk. The association was elaborated based on the context of FUT2's role in fucosylation and its expression affecting respiratory infection risk.
title: Genome-wide association study of chronic sputum production implicates loci involved in mucus production and infection

finding: The sentinel variant at FUT2, rs492602, was directly associated with chronic sputum production risk. It was correlated with decreased lung function measures and higher expression of several associated genes. Importantly, this SNP also had implications in regards to COVID-19 susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide association study of chronic sputum production implicates loci involved in mucus production and infection

finding: The missense variant at this SNP showed a Glycine to Serine amino acid change correlating positively with chronic sputum production risk. This SNP was noted for its linkage to the expression of multiple genes relevant in various tissues.
title: Genome-wide association study of chronic sputum production implicates loci involved in mucus production and infection

finding: This SNP was recently reported to correlate with increased risk of chronic sputum production and had previously been associated with increased susceptibility to human polyomavirus infection, suggesting a broader immunological impact.
title: Genome-wide association study of chronic sputum production implicates loci involved in mucus production and infection

finding: The variant rs17632542 in the KLK3 gene (prostate-specific antigen) was positively associated with the diagnosis of at least one prostate cancer, presenting an odds ratio of 1.49.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The SNP rs7412 was used to construct the APOE risk score, which showed significant associations with cognitive decline and beta-amyloid accumulation in the context of Alzheimer's disease. The risk score generated indicated how different APOE genotypes (like ε2, ε3, and ε4) altered the risk of developing Alzheimer's disease symptoms over time.
title: Effect of Pathway-specific Polygenic Risk Scores for Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) on Rate of Change in Cognitive Function and AD-related Biomarkers among Asymptomatic Individuals

finding: Similar to rs7412, the SNP rs429358 contributed to the APOE risk score calculations in the study. Findings associated with this SNP suggested that individuals carrying the ε4 allele had a dramatically increased risk for Alzheimer's disease and earlier signs of cognitive decline as measured through various biomarkers.
title: Effect of Pathway-specific Polygenic Risk Scores for Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) on Rate of Change in Cognitive Function and AD-related Biomarkers among Asymptomatic Individuals

finding: The study established that the rs429358 SNP, associated with APOE epsilon 4 (ε4) allele status, played a significant role in differentiating between Alzheimer's disease (AD) and mild cognitive disorder (MCD) in participants, contributing to ongoing research into the genetic predisposition of various dementia-related phenotypes.
title: A FinnGen pilot clinical recall study for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs7412 SNP, also related to APOE ε4 allele status, was identified as a key genetic factor in distinguishing individuals with AD from those with MCD, matching findings with the established role of APOE genetics in influencing the risk of developing Alzheimer's disease.
title: A FinnGen pilot clinical recall study for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The <APOE> ε4 allele, determined from haplotypes of rs429358 and rs7412, correlated with higher brain age gap (BAG) [p = 7.8e-06], although it did not reach genome-wide significance. This confirmed the role of <APOE> in influencing risks for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genome-wide analysis of brain age identifies 25 associated loci and unveils relationships with mental and physical health

finding: This SNP acted alongside rs429358 to define the <APOE> ε4 allele, which was linked to higher BAG. This status further corroborated the established risk association of <APOE> with Alzheimer’s disease, though it did not meet the threshold for genome-wide significance.
title: Genome-wide analysis of brain age identifies 25 associated loci and unveils relationships with mental and physical health

finding: The analysis reported that the SNP rs429358 was a critical component of the genetic risk score including the APOE4 isoform, demonstrating the strongest positive association with cholesterol-related traits, particularly among individuals with high Alzheimer's disease liability.
title: Effects of genetic liability to Alzheimer’s disease on circulating metabolites across the life course

finding: Similar to rs429358, rs7412 was another SNP contributing to the genetic risk score for the APOE4 allele. This SNP also had significant correlations with lipid profiles as they related to increasing Alzheimer's disease risk, particularly with high densities of lipids being affected.
title: Effects of genetic liability to Alzheimer’s disease on circulating metabolites across the life course

finding: The SNP rs7412 was linked to the expression of the APOE-ε2 allele, which is a part of the APOE genotypes studied in relation to brain functional connectivity. The findings indicated that interactions involving this SNP could influence connectivity within brain networks during aging, although specific protective effects of the APOE-ε2 allele were observed less frequently than those associated with APOE-ε4.
title: The Interaction Effects of Sex, Age, APOE and Common Health Risk Factors on Human Brain Functions

finding: The SNP rs429358 contributed to the expression of the APOE-ε4 allele. It was found that male carriers of the APOE-ε4 allele showed greater reduction in functional connectivity between the cingulo-opercular network and the posterior multimodal network. This finding highlighted the adverse effects associated with the APOE-ε4 allele in the context of brain aging and functional connectivity.
title: The Interaction Effects of Sex, Age, APOE and Common Health Risk Factors on Human Brain Functions

finding: This SNP in the gene APOC1 was significant in determining patient membership in clusters C0 and C1, which were associated with overlapping pathologies in neurodegenerative diseases (NDDs) such as Alzheimer's disease (AD).
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: This SNP, part of the CEACAM16/AS1 locus, was important for the clustering of patients into C2, highlighting its role in genetic risk assessment for NDDs including Alzheimer's disease (AD).
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: This SNP also belonged to the CEACAM16/AS1 locus and contributed to clustering C2, suggesting its relevance in the genetic landscape of Alzheimer's disease (AD) and other NDDs.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: The study included the assessment of the number of APOE-ε4 alleles, which was determined by the single nucleotide polymorphisms rs7412 and rs429358. It was noted that these SNPs were relevant covariates in the regression models investigating associations between brain volumetric measures and cognitive outcomes.
title: Comparison of approaches to control for intracranial volume in research on the association of brain volumes with cognitive outcomes

finding: Similar to rs7412, the rs429358 SNP contributed to the determination of the number of APOE-ε4 alleles which were included as covariates in the analyses of brain volume and cognitive performance associations. The findings underscored the importance of these genetic markers in evaluating neurological outcomes.
title: Comparison of approaches to control for intracranial volume in research on the association of brain volumes with cognitive outcomes

finding: The rs116843064-A allele, corresponding to the E40K variant in ANGPTL4, demonstrated a high posterior probability (99.99%) of being the causal variant for lower triglyceride levels. It was also significantly associated with lower risks of coronary artery disease (CAD) with an odds ratio of 0.84 and type 2 diabetes (T2D) with an odds ratio of 0.91 based on GWAS meta-analyses, which were further replicated in the FinnGen study. This allele was confirmed to not be confounded by linkage disequilibrium.
title: Impact of loss-of-function in angiopoietin-like 4 on the human phenome

finding: The rs429358 locus in the apolipoprotein E gene was found to be associated with hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) in patients with cirrhosis. This association highlights the potential genetic risk factors that may contribute to the development of HCC in individuals with pre-existing liver conditions, emphasizing the importance of genetic screening in high-risk populations.
title: Machine learning predicts liver cancer risk from routine clinical data: a large population-based multicentric study

finding: The rs429358 variant was noted for its association with both type 2 diabetes (T2D) and dementia, significantly contributing to observed heterogeneity in Mendelian randomization analyses. Its association was recognized as an outlier in the relationship between diabetes risk and various dementia diagnoses. Due to the observations related to pleiotropy and heterogeneity, rs429358 was excluded for further analyses, favoring GRS330 as the valid instrument in the study.
title: Mendelian randomization study of diabetes and dementia in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The rs7412 SNP, located within the APOE gene, highlighted its significance in HF with a P-value of 6.95×10^-24.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: The SNP rs492602, related to FUT2 (secretor status), was reported in earlier variants and indicated a protective effect against certain viral infections.
title: Central role of glycosylation processes in human genetic susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infections with Omicron variants

finding: The rs429358 SNP at the APOE locus was significantly associated with reduced lifespan, with a beta coefficient of 0.013 and a p-value of 6.4 × 10^-47. It was specifically linked to increased risk of mortality from diseases of the circulatory system and diseases of the nervous system, such as Alzheimer's Disease and cardiovascular disease.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The variant rs12720356 in the TYK2 gene was found to be associated with a reduced risk of type 1 diabetes, supporting its role in autoimmune disease protection.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: Similarly, rs34536443 was identified as a protective variant against type 1 diabetes in the genetic analyses conducted, further implicating TYK2 in diabetes risk.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The missense variant rs2304256 in TYK2 was shown to confer protection against type 1 diabetes, with evidence from both GWAS findings and population studies highlighting its significant role.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1013893365 related to CERS1 was associated with glycosyl-N-stearoyl-sphingosine levels, implying its involvement in sphingolipid biosynthesis.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs35230038 in DHDH was associated with arabinose, corroborating its role in carbohydrate metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs147464959 in SLC27A5 was associated with 3b-hydroxy-5-cholenoic acid, showing its relevance in bile acid conjugation.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs61751862 associated with SPHK2 was linked to sphingomyelin levels, suggesting its role in ceramide metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The rs4420638 polymorphism on APOC1 was identified as influencing the accumulation of homocysteine, which was linked to Alzheimer's disease (AD) development and progression. This gene is known to affect cholesterol metabolism, impacting AD pathology.
title: Explainable deep transfer learning model for disease risk prediction using high-dimensional genomic data

finding: The rs11568822 polymorphism on APOC1 was found to increase the risk of Alzheimer's disease in various populations, including Caucasians, Asians, and Caribbeans. It serves as a significant marker in associating with AD risk.
title: Explainable deep transfer learning model for disease risk prediction using high-dimensional genomic data

finding: The rs10524523 polymorphism on TOMM40 was reported to affect oxidative damage and thus influences the onset and progression of Alzheimer's disease. This SNP was highlighted for its role in late-onset AD.
title: Explainable deep transfer learning model for disease risk prediction using high-dimensional genomic data

finding: The rs2075650 polymorphism on TOMM40 was noted to contribute to Alzheimer's disease susceptibility among Caucasian and Asian populations. It was specifically mentioned in the context of improving estimations of age for late-onset AD in APOE ε3 carriers.
title: Explainable deep transfer learning model for disease risk prediction using high-dimensional genomic data

finding: The rs2081046 variant was found to be significantly associated with functional fecal incontinence, positioning it as an important genetic marker related to this condition.
title: Combined GWAS and single cell transcriptomics uncover the underlying genes and cell types in disorders of gut-brain interaction

finding: The SNP rs2109069 was linked to DPP9, showing a correlation with enhanced severity of COVID-19 disease among the studied SNPs, reflecting a detrimental influence on the immune response.
title: Potential associations of selected polymorphic genetic variants with COVID-19 disease susceptibility and severity

finding: Associated with the RAVER1 gene, the lead SNP rs74956615 was identified as a risk factor for COVID-19 infection, with multiple studies confirming its link to disease severity.
title: Potential associations of selected polymorphic genetic variants with COVID-19 disease susceptibility and severity

finding: The rs8105767 SNP, belonging to the ZNF208 gene, was noted for its relationship with an increased likelihood of developing coronary heart disease, reinforcing the study's findings on the impacts of shorter TL on cardiac parameters.
title: Leukocyte Telomere Length and Cardiac Structure and Function: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with carrying at least one APOE e4 allele in the context of Alzheimer's disease. This SNP, alongside rs7412, was genotyped to determine the APOE genotype that influences Alzheimer's risk. The findings reported that specific associations linked the joint predictor and polygenic risk score with carrying the e4 allele, demonstrating significant genetic risk factors for Alzheimer's.
title: Capturing additional genetic risk from family history for improved polygenic risk prediction

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also genotyped to assess its relationship with the APOE gene and was associated with carrying two e4 alleles in individuals predisposed to Alzheimer's disease. The research highlighted that the joint predictor and polygenic risk score showed significant associations regarding the risk carried by the e4 allele, contributing to understanding genetic risk in Alzheimer's.
title: Capturing additional genetic risk from family history for improved polygenic risk prediction

finding: The SNP rs7412 was part of the ApoE genotype analysis, where it contributed to the classification of participants with Alzheimer's disease (AD) and those at risk. Its association with different alleles (specifically ApoE ε2, ε3, and ε4) informed researchers about the participants' genetic risk profiles, thus supporting its predictive value in the context of cognitive decline.
title: Machine learning-based classification of Alzheimer’s disease and its at-risk states using personality traits, anxiety, and depression

finding: The SNP rs429358 was similarly analyzed as a defining variant of the ApoE genotype. It aided in assessing the risk for Alzheimer’s disease through the stratification of participants between non-carriers and carriers of the ε4 allele, confirming its importance as a genetic factor in AD predictions.
title: Machine learning-based classification of Alzheimer’s disease and its at-risk states using personality traits, anxiety, and depression

finding: The SNP rs7412 was linked to the determination of ApoE isoforms, contributing to a predictability of 81.8% for late-onset Alzheimer's disease (AD). This finding underscored the role of this SNP in the risk of developing AD.
title: Associations between Alzheimer’s disease polygenic risk scores and hippocampal subfield volumes in 17,161 UK Biobank participants

finding: Similar to rs7412, the SNP rs429358 also played a significant role in defining ApoE isoforms, which related to the predictability of 81.8% for late-onset Alzheimer's disease. This finding reinforced its importance in AD risk.
title: Associations between Alzheimer’s disease polygenic risk scores and hippocampal subfield volumes in 17,161 UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs429358 had been identified as a significant marker determining APOE status. It was confirmed that the presence of the ε4 allele, defined by this SNP, was associated with an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD). This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic predispositions related to dementia.
title: TWINGEN – protocol for an observational clinical biobank recall and biomarker study to identify individuals with high risk of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also established as a key determinant of APOE status, similarly influencing the risk associated with the ε4 allele. The identification of this SNP alongside rs429358 underscored its role in enhancing the risk of Alzheimer's disease, clarifying genetic components pertinent to cognitive decline.
title: TWINGEN – protocol for an observational clinical biobank recall and biomarker study to identify individuals with high risk of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs116843064 near ANGPTL4 demonstrated strong associations with HDL and TRL metabolism and was part of a cluster suggesting its pivotal role in regulating lipoprotein lipase activity and lipid remnant clearance.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: The SNP rs73015024 near LDLR was noted for its critical involvement in the cholesterol transport pathway, demonstrating significant contributions to VLDL and LDL metrics impacting cardiovascular risk parameters.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: As a missense variant associated with CEA levels, rs28362459 aligns with the known involvement of FUT3 in cancer biomarkers.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: The rs2742313 SNP associated with the ILF3 gene on chromosome 19 was linked to knee pain in males, reporting a p value of 4.19 × 10^-9. Considering ILF3's role in inflammatory processes, this finding suggests its influence on joint pain mechanisms.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The SNP rs56764248 within the ILF3 gene on chromosome 19 reported a p value of 1.29 × 10^-14. Its connection to knee pain supports inflammatory pathways linked to this condition, highlighting the gene's potential as a therapeutic target.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: Associated with increased expression of CILP2, this variant was highlighted in relation to RA and revealed its homolog as a candidate autoantigen.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: Another missense variant from the TYK2 gene presented as an EUR-specific association, contributing to the understanding of RA etiology.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: This variant at the TYK2 locus was also identified as an EUR-specific missense variant that had relevance in RA.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: Identified as an EAS-specific missense variant at the TYK2 locus, contributing to understanding genetic diversity in RA.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs769449, located in the APOE locus, had an association with TBCA levels. It was linked with 15 AD-related traits, including genetic predisposition to Alzheimer's disease.
