title: Genome and epigenome wide studies of plasma protein biomarkers for Alzheimer’s disease implicate TBCA and TREM2 in disease risk

finding: The SNP rs11668344 was found to be significantly associated with accelerated aging, supporting its potential role as a biomarker for aging processes.
title: The Relationship Between Biological Aging with Interdisciplinary Health Indicators: A Scoping Review

finding: The SNP rs429358 at the APOE locus was found to be strongly associated with sporadic Alzheimer's disease (AD) with an odds ratio (OR) of 2.93 and a p-value of 2.6×10⁻²³, indicating its significant role in increasing AD risk.
title: First GWAS on Alzheimer’s Disease in Argentina and Chile populations

finding: The SNP rs7412, also at the APOE locus, was associated with a reduced risk of AD (OR=0.53, p=6.3×10⁻³) suggesting a protective effect.
title: First GWAS on Alzheimer’s Disease in Argentina and Chile populations

finding: The SNP rs167479 in RGL3 was associated with gestational hypertension and preeclampsia, with a reported P-value of 1.2×10^-3 in the GnuMoM2b replication of a large GWAS study. While nuMoM2b participated as a follow-up cohort, it was not part of the original discovery analysis.
title: Searching and visualizing genetic associations of pregnancy traits by using GnuMoM2b

finding: The SNP rs58542926 in the TM6SF2 gene demonstrated a significant influence on hepatic fibrosis progression in patients with NAFLD. This SNP was linked to alterations in liver metabolic pathways, suggesting its role in the disease's severity.
title: Quantitative genome-scale analysis of human liver reveals dysregulation of glycosphingolipid pathways in progressive nonalcoholic fatty liver disease

finding: The rs429358 SNP was identified as the alternative allele, part of the APOE epsilon 4 haplotype, which was significantly associated with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) in pooled analyses and across various subgroups, particularly in African American (AA) individuals.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: The rs7412 SNP, which was part of the APOE epsilon 2 haplotype, was found to be associated with lower AD risk and enriched in controls; it contrasts with the epsilon 4 haplotype's association with AD risk.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: The SNP rs113492558 showed a significant association with AD in African Americans (OR=2.56, p=1.7x10^-19), highlighting its genetic relevance.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: The rs547447016 SNP was identified among coding variants linked to AD, appearing to contribute to the risk in the analyzed groups, particularly when aggregating rare variants.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: Similar to rs547447016, the rs538591288 SNP was associated with AD, identified as part of the rare variant aggregation in the analysis.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: The rs745871063 SNP was found to be a new association emerging from rare variant analysis connected to AD, enhancing the understanding of genetic contributions across demographics.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: This SNP was evaluated along with others in ABCA7, contributing toward the elucidation of AD risk factors derived from a comprehensive analysis of genetic variants.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: Similar to the previous SNP, this variant was included in the assessment of genetic factors associated with AD, participating in the broader genetic architecture studied.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: This SNP was part of analyses focusing on coding variants in relation to AD, bearing implications for understanding genetic susceptibilities.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: This variant formed part of the complex analysis indicating significant associations with Alzheimer's Disease through rare variant investigations.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: The SNP rs429358 in the APOE locus was substantially associated with hs-CRP levels, as shown by the P-value of 3.30e-51. This result pointed to a powerful effect of APOE genetic variation on inflammatory responses.
title: The combined impact of persistent infections and human genetic variation on C-reactive protein levels

finding: The study found that 74.0% of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (AD) burden was attributable to carriage of the APOE epsilon 3 and epsilon 4 alleles, with approximately 30% of AD specifically attributed to epsilon 3 carriage. This locus, specifically represented by rs7412, was critical in understanding the genetic predisposition for AD.
title: The proportion of Alzheimer’s disease attributable to apolipoprotein E

finding: Carriage of the APOE epsilon 4 allele, identified through the rs429358 SNP, was found to be a significant risk factor, accounting for 74.0% of AD and 38.1% of all-cause dementia burden. The acute association with elevated dementia risk highlighted its importance in genetic epidemiology related to neurodegenerative diseases.
title: The proportion of Alzheimer’s disease attributable to apolipoprotein E

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the risk of developing Alzheimer's disease (AD), as it is part of the APOE gene which has significant implications in AD pathogenesis. The analysis included individuals with AD diagnostic status, and the presence of this SNP was indicated to correlate with altered biological mechanisms related to lipid metabolism and neuronal processes.
title: Analysis of Alzheimer’s disease Polygenic Risk Scores using RNA-sequencing provides further novel biological pathways

finding: The SNP rs7412, also part of the APOE gene, demonstrated a strong link with Alzheimer's disease risk. Similar to rs429358, this SNP was found to be enriched in analyses correlating PRS with biological mechanisms implicated in AD, including immune response and neuronal health.
title: Analysis of Alzheimer’s disease Polygenic Risk Scores using RNA-sequencing provides further novel biological pathways

finding: The SNP rs10405121 was classified as an MA-specific variant at the <italic>CACNA1A</italic> locus, significantly contributing to migraine with aura risk.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 102,084 migraine cases identifies 123 risk loci and subtype-specific risk alleles

finding: This intronic variant in PEPD showed a strong association with VATadjBMI (P = 3.3 x 10^-24) and was previously linked to waist circumference adjusted for BMI (WCadjBMI) and type 2 diabetes.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The study found that the low-producing TGFB1 polymorphism (rs1800472 C>T) in kidney donors was associated with an increased risk of graft loss. Specifically, the presence of the T-allele nearly doubled the risk of graft loss (HR 2.13; 95% CI 1.16–3.90; P=0.015) and was linked to significantly different donor genotype frequencies in patients with versus without graft loss (P=0.042). The results suggest that TGF-β1 has protective effects on long-term kidney transplant survival.
title: A functional TGFB1 polymorphism in the donor associates with long-term graft survival after kidney transplantation

finding: The rs9636202 SNP located in the 19p13.11 region demonstrated a shared genetic influence between chronotype and the mean mode of anisotropy (MO) of the external capsule. The posterior probability of colocalization was high (PPH4 = 0.992), and this region also exhibited strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) with various other phenotypes including reaction time and coronary artery disease.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs429358 at 19q13.32 illustrated significant shared genetic influences in relation to both insomnia and risk for Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs708686 variant was located upstream of FUT6 at locus 19p13.3 and had previous associations with Carbohydrate Antigen 19.9 (CA-19.9) and blood protein levels, indicating potential relevance to disease pathways.
title: Leveraging global multi-ancestry meta-analysis in the study of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis genetics

finding: The SNP rs826323, which maps to ZNF420, was identified in the cross-ancestry meta-analysis with a genome-wide significant p-value of 1.39×10−08. This finding marked a new addition to the understanding of loci associated with MaxAlc.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs11878277 in the HDGFL2 gene was significantly associated with entinostat response, implicating it in the regulatory mechanisms of histone deacetylation in AML.
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukemia patients

finding: The TM6SF2 rs58542926 T/C gene polymorphism was found to be significantly associated with susceptibility to significant hepatic fibrosis. Statistical analysis revealed an odds ratio (OR) of 1.292 for the T allele compared to the C allele in the allelic model (T vs. C), indicating an association with higher risk of liver fibrosis. Additionally, in the recessive model (TT vs. CT+CC), the odds ratio was 2.829, further supporting the role of the T allele in increasing susceptibility. These findings suggest that the TT genotype and T allele of this polymorphism are important genetic factors influencing liver fibrosis progression.
title: Association between TM6SF2 rs58542926 T/C gene polymorphism and significant liver fibrosis: A meta-analysis

finding: The index SNP rs61494113 at 19p13.11 was part of a known pleiotropic cancer locus and showed shared causal signals with both LUSC and ER-negative breast cancer, with significant findings before and after multi-trait analysis.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: The index SNP rs56069439 displayed evidence of shared genetics with ER-negative breast cancer and was involved in the similarly significant findings for LUSC.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: The minor allele of rs157585 was associated with a prominent loss of function for DNase I hypersensitive sites (DHS) in glioblastoma cells, normal human astrocyte (NHA) cells, and monocyte cells. This SNP was among the top 100 AD GWAS candidate SNPs.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: The variant rs74579864 led to a strong gain of function in the acetylation of histones 2 and 3 at various positions in H1-Derived Neuronal Progenitor cells. This SNP was notable among the top AD GWAS candidate SNPs.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: The minor allele of rs35396326 was associated with significant acetylation of histones 2 and 3 in H1-Derived Neuronal Progenitor cells, although this effect was negative at different positions compared to another SNP. It was recognized as a significant variant with a positive beta coefficient related to AD risk.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: Identified as one of the variants with a dominant allelic effect on chromatin features, its minor allele consistently showed significant predicted functional impact regardless of neighboring alleles.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: As one of the four variants with a dominant effect, rs114536010's minor allele also exhibited significant effects on chromatin features irrespective of genomic context.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: The minor allele of rs1305062 was significantly linked to loss of function for CTCF binding sites in glioblastoma cells, which worsened with the minor allele of the neighboring SNP rs141864196.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: Carriers of the minor allele of rs2972559 showed significant loss of function in CTCF binding sites in glioblastoma, especially when combined with neighboring variant rs4802241.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: The minor allele of rs584007 was associated with significant loss of DNase I hypersensitive sites in normal human astrocytes, with the loss being exacerbated by the presence of another SNP's minor allele, rs59325138.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: The rs7412 SNP was associated with the ApoE genotype, specifically defining the ApoE ε2 allele. Its relevance was underscored in the context of cognitive performance and Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk, as it was assessed alongside cognitive metrics in various participant groups. This association indicated a notable differentiation in cognitive function between genotypes.
title: Single-value fMRI scores reflect both stage and risk across the Alzheimer’s disease continuum

finding: The rs429358 SNP was similarly vital in determining the ApoE ε4 allele genotype. It was investigated in relation to neuropsychological test performances and cognitive risk factors for AD. The findings demonstrated significant implications for individuals categorized under subjective cognitive decline (SCD) and first-degree relatives of AD dementia patients, linking the allele status to cognitive outcomes.
title: Single-value fMRI scores reflect both stage and risk across the Alzheimer’s disease continuum

finding: Variant rs11666792 emerged as a lead variant affecting FUT2 and RASIP1. The protective G allele was shown to increase FUT2 expression in human islets, while also playing a role in type 1 diabetes susceptibility.
title: Identification of novel type 1 and type 2 diabetes genes by co-localization of human islet eQTL and GWAS variants with colocRedRibbon

finding: This SNP was confirmed as likely causally associated with fatty acid traits, contributing to understanding lipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Notably associated with multiple fatty acid traits, underscoring its role in the genetic architecture of lipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Associated with various fatty acid traits, this SNP provided evidence of shared genetic influences across traits in model 3.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP linked to the LDLR gene was shown to overlap significantly with histone modification and chromatin accessibility, relevant to fatty acid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: A novel rare coding variant, rs756613425, located in the gene U2AF1L4, was associated with AUD among females in the EUR2 population, showing a significant P-value of 5.38×10^-9, thus highlighting a previously unreported genetic link to AUD.
title: Multi-ancestry Whole-exome Sequencing Study of Alcohol Use Disorder in Two Cohorts

finding: The rs7251 locus was identified as a schizophrenia risk locus associated with peripheral and central IRF3 mRNA expression. Further analysis revealed that the same allele (rs7251-C) was linked to a higher risk of both schizophrenia (SCZ) and autoimmune diseases, as well as a poorer cognitive performance. A PheWAS of rs7251 indicated six genome-wide significant associations with autoimmune diseases, particularly thyroid dysfunction. Four of these six phenotypes displayed strong evidence of colocalization with SCZ risk, suggesting that IRF3 may play a critical role in mediating the comorbidity between schizophrenia and autoimmune conditions.
title: A transcriptome-wide Mendelian randomization study in isolated human immune cells highlights risk genes involved in viral infections and potential drug repurposing opportunities for schizophrenia

finding: In the study, rs58542926 was recognized as a lead missense variant in TM6SF2 associated with metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD). This SNP was part of a unique locus contributing to the genetic architecture of liver fat accumulation as identified through genome-wide association studies (GWAS).
title: Machine learning across multiple imaging and biomarker modalities in the UK Biobank improves genetic discovery for liver fat accumulation

finding: The variant rs429358 was confirmed to have a strong association with AD, replicating findings from previous studies at a significant level (P=2.4 × 10^-10).
title: A genome-wide association study in Peruvians suggests new risk loci for Alzheimer Disease

finding: The gallstone risk allele rs7599-A led to suppression of hepatic TMEM147 expression, indicating that the protein protects against gallstone formation. This variant was associated with significantly reduced expression of TMEM147 in the liver, with a p-value of 3.0 x 10^-47.
title: Genome-wide Analysis Identifies Novel Gallstone-susceptibility Loci Including Genes Regulating Gastrointestinal Motility

finding: The SNP rs2003476 in the CRTC1 gene was associated with seven aging and age-related disease outcomes, including the frailty index, late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD), congestive heart failure (CHF), father's age at death, mother's age at death, breast cancer, and endometrial cancer. This association underscored the relevance of CRTC1 in lifespan extension and disease mechanisms.
title: Early menarche and childbirth accelerate aging-related outcomes and age-related diseases: Evidence for antagonistic pleiotropy in humans

finding: The SNP rs11670056 was associated with the transcription elongation factor complex and was linked to various cardiovascular diseases, blood traits, body mass index (BMI), and educational attainment, which suggested its role in the shared genetic liability relating to both major depressive disorder (MDD) and atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD).
title: Distinct genomic signatures and modifiable risk factors underly the comorbidity between major depressive disorder and cardiovascular disease

finding: The SNP chr19:35687796:G:A, which is intergenic to UPK1A and ZBTB32, demonstrated genome-wide significance in the context of COVID-19 severity and hospitalization.
title: A genome-wide association study of COVID-19 related hospitalization in Spain reveals genetic disparities among sexes

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the APOE genotype, which was found to significantly influence hippocampal volume changes with age. Specifically, it was noted that carriers of the ε4 allele, represented by this SNP, exhibited reductions in hippocampal volume starting from age 61, highlighting the early onset of neurodegenerative changes linked to this genetic variant.
title: Hippocampal volumes in UK Biobank are associated with APOE only in older adults

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also linked to the APOE genotype and played a crucial role in determining hippocampal volume over time. The results indicated that ε3/ε4 carriers, characterized by the presence of this SNP, began to show significant declines in hippocampal volume from age 69, illustrating the SNP's relevance in the context of age-related neurodegeneration.
title: Hippocampal volumes in UK Biobank are associated with APOE only in older adults

finding: The rs4420638 SNP in the APOE gene was part of the PRP-5, showing a significant association with polyvascular disease in the context of type 2 diabetes, contributing to an odds ratio (OR) of 5.2.
title: Complexity of Coronary Disease and a Genetic Risk Profile in Patients with Type 2 Diabetes in Colombia

finding: The SNP rs2307019 interacted with rs507666 in an epistatic manner, significantly affecting the plasma levels of ALPI, MUC2, and FAM3D, with substantial improvements in predictive model performance when incorporated as an interaction term.
title: Non-linear genetic regulation of the blood plasma proteome

finding: The SNP rs812936 showed an interaction with rs507666 that influenced FAM3D plasma levels. This interaction suggested that the regulation of FAM3D was modulated not only by ABO and FUT2 interactions but also by the ABO-FUT3 relationship, although its frequency in the population was low.
title: Non-linear genetic regulation of the blood plasma proteome

finding: The SNP rs12461706 was associated with periodontitis (p = 3.9 × 10⁻⁹) and was considered among the SNPs with very strong evidence for an association with periodontal disease. In the analyses, it contributed to the significant association with colorectal cancer risk.
title: Two-sample Mendelian randomization analysis of associations between periodontal disease and risk of colorectal, lung, and pancreatic cancers

finding: Similar to rs439358, the rs7412 SNP, associated with the APOE-4 allele, indicated that carriers faced greater risks regarding cognitive decline linked to financial adversity. The findings emphasized that both SNPs together acted as indicators of increased susceptibility to cognitive impairments and brain atrophy due to prolonged financial challenges.
title: Persistent financial adversity and cognitive ageing: A lifecourse investigation

finding: The lead SNP rs8736 at the MBOAT7 locus was linked to a diverse array of phospholipids including phosphatidic acids and phosphatidylcholines. This genetic variant revealed important roles in lipid metabolism, particularly concerning arachidonic acid remodeling, indicating broader implications for cardiometabolic health.
title: Genome-wide analysis of blood lipid metabolites in over 5,000 South Asians reveals biological insights at cardiometabolic disease loci

finding: The intronic variant rs8101801 in the C19orf80 locus was significantly associated with PC(40:9)+AcO- and PI(38:4)-H-. This association underlined the importance of C19orf80 in regulating serum triglyceride levels and its effect on major lipids linked to cardiovascular health.
title: Genome-wide analysis of blood lipid metabolites in over 5,000 South Asians reveals biological insights at cardiometabolic disease loci

finding: The rs601338 genotype was shown to determine FUT2 secretor status, where the G allele designated secretors and the A allele designated non-secretors.  Non-secretors (AA) exhibited significantly higher IgG levels against BKPyV and JCPyV compared to secretors (GA or GG), indicating a role of genetic variation in antibody response to these polyomaviruses.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: The rs681343 SNP demonstrated a significant association with IgG levels against BKPyV, with a P-value of 6.40e-16, which was linked to the FUT2 gene and its effect on secretor status.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: Associated with IgG levels against JCPyV, rs12462111 carried a P-value of 4.84e-10 and was in high linkage disequilibrium with the FUT2 variant rs601338, further implicating FUT2 in the immune response to this virus.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: Associated with JCPyV, rs2432132 was linked to FUT2, with a significant P-value of 1.70e-15, demonstrating its impact on antibody response.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: The variant rs66833742 was associated with COVID-19 hospitalization (OR=0.94, 95% CI=0.92-0.96, p=2.50×10^-8) and upregulation of ZBTB7A, validating its involvement in the disease process.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: This variant being a perfect proxy for rs66833742 signifies its connection to COVID-19 hospitalization and its effect on ZBTB7A expression, enhancing its relevance in the genetic risk for COVID-19.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The SNP rs516246 was reported to be in near-complete linkage disequilibrium with a stop-gain mutation in the FUT2 gene, associating higher levels of intestinal alkaline phosphatase (ALPI) with a lower risk of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). The finding reflects the implications for understanding ALPI's role in IBD, although direct GWAS evidence was lacking.
title: Systematic disease-agnostic identification of therapeutically actionable targets using the genetics of human plasma proteins

finding: This variant was tested in relation to SVD stroke and showed a significant association with a BinomiRare mid-p-value of 0.03, indicating it may be related to the risk for stroke in the context of CADASIL.
title: BinomiRare: A carriers-only test for association of rare genetic variants with a binary outcome for mixed models and any case-control proportion

finding: This missense variant (A38P) in <italic>PLA2G4C</italic> was identified as increasing protein stability (PolyPhen-2) and was suggested to influence HAPC susceptibility in Tibetans.
title: Differences in pathogenetic mechanism between Tibetan and Han high-altitude polycythemia based on a whole genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs429358 was part of the APOE gene locus and studied for its association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk. The presence of the ε4 allele, linked to this SNP, was acknowledged as a significant risk factor for AD, while the converse ε2 allele linked to this gene, specifically interacted with age to suggest a protective role in brain aging particularly at the amygdala.
title: Brain Structural Mapping of Multi-factorial Aging Mechanism Using 35,035 UK Biobank Subjects

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also situated within the APOE gene locus and analyzed in conjunction with rs429358. Together, they contributed to identifying the APOE alleles which delineate differing risks for Alzheimer's disease. The significance of the ε4 allele tied to this SNP demonstrated an original and notable correlation with increased risk of AD, while the ε2 allele showed a potential reduction in this risk.
title: Brain Structural Mapping of Multi-factorial Aging Mechanism Using 35,035 UK Biobank Subjects

finding: The study revealed that rs429358, a missense variant in the APOE gene, was strongly associated with protection against non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), highlighted by significant P values in various analyses. The allele 4 of APOE conferred lower risk for NAFLD as indicated by odds ratios (0.84 for heterozygotes and 0.64 for homozygotes). This variant represented a novel finding in the context of GWAS for NAFLD.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Non-Alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease Identifies Association with Apolipoprotein E

finding: The variant located within NECTIN2's intron was found to be significantly associated with CSF sTREM2 levels (P=2.52×10^-8) and demonstrated independence from APOE genotype, marking it as an important genetic factor in AD risk and sTREM2 modulation.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with variations in APOE genotype among UK Biobank participants. Specifically, the findings linked the APOE ε4 allele, which includes this SNP, to an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD) and poorer cognitive scores following SARS-CoV-2 infection. This context highlights the significant impact that APOE genotype had on cognitive decline and brain pathology, particularly under the stress of viral infections.
title: Plasma proteomic evidence for increased Alzheimer’s disease-related brain pathology after SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: The rs7412 SNP was also analyzed for its role in determining APOE genotype among participants. Similar to rs429358, this finding contributed to the identification of APOE ε2 and ε4 alleles, impacting risk assessments for Alzheimer's disease. The presence of the ε2 allele generally indicated a protective aspect against AD, but the interaction with COVID-19 outcomes suggested that APOE genotype could play a crucial role in dementia risk post-infection.
title: Plasma proteomic evidence for increased Alzheimer’s disease-related brain pathology after SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: The rs12461806 variant was significantly associated with mtDNA-CN (p=7.5×10^-88), mapping to the TINCR/LONP1 genes, indicating a potential role in mtDNA regulation.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The variant rs73001065 was associated with a decreased risk of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease and correlated with reduced levels of the APOB protein, suggesting its physiological impact on this condition.
title: Plasma Proteome Variation and its Genetic Determinants in Children and Adolescents

finding: The SNP rs2303108 was recognized as part of the seven SNPs associated with both central and general obesity in relation to PCOS, enhancing the understanding of genetic predisposition to this condition.
title: Both general- and central- obesity are causally associated with polycystic ovarian syndrome: Findings of a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The rs73005873:G>A variant in MUC16 was associated with increased risk for SARS-CoV-2 infection, supported by an OR of 1.03 (P = 6.4 × 10^-10).
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs142412517 was significantly associated with the proxy Alzheimer's disease phenotype, driven primarily by its rarity. This rare missense variant caused an amino acid change from arginine to tryptophan (p.R239W) and had a CADD score of 25.4. Its impact on the protein was not fully elucidated, and it was in low linkage disequilibrium with known APOE e4 variants.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs190065070 near EMC10 was associated with AF, reaffirming the importance of novel loci in understanding AF risk.
title: Deciphering the genetic architecture of atrial fibrillation offers insights into disease prediction, pathophysiology and downstream sequelae

finding: The SNP rs7412 was identified as part of the APOE ε4 allele tagging, which is strongly associated with an increased risk of Alzheimer’s disease (AD). This association implied that genetic liability to AD significantly affects structural brain measures, particularly in mid-life populations, but there was no strong evidence attributing changes in brain morphology as a result of this SNP.
title: The bidirectional causal effects of brain morphology across the life course and risk of Alzheimer’s disease: A cross-cohort comparison and Mendelian randomization meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs157580 was located in the intron region of TOMM40 and downstream of NECTIN2. It was identified as significant in the context of the gene APOE, which is a well-known Alzheimer's Disease risk gene. The significance of rs157580 was evidenced by its strong pQTL weights estimated by the lasso method and BTPT at very low p-values (3.38e-102 and <1e-300 respectively). Additionally, its causal effects were highlighted in the context of Alzheimer's Disease dementia and its association with family history of the disease.
title: Proteome-wide association studies using summary proteomic data identified 23 risk genes of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs5117, located in the APOC1 gene, was identified as the most significant SNP in the study with a p-value of 1.04E-22. This finding was part of the analysis that showed the genetic region including APOE, APOC1, and TOMM40 as the strongest genetic risk locus for Alzheimer's disease (AD). The results demonstrated that this SNP was associated with a phenotype-related influence score in the context of deep learning methods applied to GWAS data.
title: Deep learning-based identification of genetic variants: Application to Alzheimer’s disease classification

finding: The SNP rs429358, located in the APOE gene, was another significant SNP identified with a p-value of 1.41E-16. Similar to rs5117, it was part of the genetic region known to be the strongest risk locus for Alzheimer's disease, correlating with the outcomes observed for AD susceptibility using both traditional and deep learning approaches in the study.
title: Deep learning-based identification of genetic variants: Application to Alzheimer’s disease classification

finding: The missense variant rs28362459 (p.Leu20Arg) at the FUT3 locus was found to be associated with gallbladder polyp and cholelithiasis. It showed an OR of 1.46 and a p-value of 5.1×10^-11 for gallbladder polyp, and an OR of 1.11 with a p-value of 7.3×10^-9 for cholelithiasis.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The rs5030775 (A18T) polymorphism was associated with more potent stimulation of the IP3 response compared to wild type LH. This mutation was located on the signal peptide position, impacting protein recognition and secretion, which could alter GnRH pulse frequency and influence LHB gene expression related to PCOS.
title: Novel Mutations in Human Luteinizing Hormone Beta Subunit Related to Polycystic Ovary Syndrome among Sudanese Women

finding: The rs1800447 (W28R) polymorphism was reported to correlate with menstrual irregularities and infertility, as well as elevations in serum testosterone levels, thus indicating its relevance to the phenotypic characteristics of PCOS.
title: Novel Mutations in Human Luteinizing Hormone Beta Subunit Related to Polycystic Ovary Syndrome among Sudanese Women

finding: The rs34349826 (I35T) mutation was linked with increased serum LH concentrations and responses to hormone stimulation, indicating its involvement in the hormonal imbalances seen in PCOS.
title: Novel Mutations in Human Luteinizing Hormone Beta Subunit Related to Polycystic Ovary Syndrome among Sudanese Women

finding: The SNP rs429358, associated with the apolipoprotein E (APOE) gene, was linked to the risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD). The study found that in APOE4 carriers, energy metabolism-related metabolites were influenced by age and this genotype. This suggests a significant role for rs429358 in the metabolic pathways associated with AD onset in this population.
title: Longitudinal analysis of UK Biobank participants suggests age and APOE-dependent alterations of energy metabolism in development of dementia

finding: The SNP rs7412, which also defines the apolipoprotein E content, was found to be directly genotyped and contributed to the understanding of dementia risk. Along with rs429358, it helped demonstrate that the onset of Alzheimer's disease was regulated by impaired energy balance in the brain for participants with the APOE4 genotype.
title: Longitudinal analysis of UK Biobank participants suggests age and APOE-dependent alterations of energy metabolism in development of dementia

finding: The ApoE4 allele (rs429358) was identified as the strongest genetic risk factor for late-onset dementia. Individuals in the study were classified based on the number of E4 alleles (0-2), which related to their risk of developing brain health issues associated with alcohol consumption.
title: No safe level of alcohol consumption for brain health: observational cohort study of 25,378 UK Biobank participants

finding: Similar to rs429358, the ApoE4 allele (rs7412) was noted as a critical genetic risk factor for late-onset dementia. The participants were categorized by their E4 allele counts (0-2), linking this genotype to their susceptibility to alcohol-induced brain health deterioration.
title: No safe level of alcohol consumption for brain health: observational cohort study of 25,378 UK Biobank participants

finding: The study indicated a significant interaction effect between the apolipoprotein E rs405509 T/T genotype and the epsilon 4 genotype on cognitive impairment and grey matter volume. This finding related to the phenotypic impact of APOE genotypes, particularly in persons at risk for late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD), emphasizing the rs405509 SNP's relevance in neuroimaging studies focused on neurodegenerative patterns.
title: Apolipoprotein E genotype and MRI-detected brain alterations pertaining to neurodegeneration: A systematic review

finding: The SNP rs429358 was part of the determination of APOE genotypes, which included the associations of longer telomere length (TL) with a reduced risk of Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) and AD-related dementia (AD/ADRD). This finding related to the overall protective role of longer TL in midlife against these conditions.
title: Mid-life leukocyte telomere length and dementia risk: a prospective cohort study of 435,046 UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs7412 was included in the determination of APOE genotypes, indicating that individuals with these variants (along with rs429358) showed associations between longer TL and a decreased risk of AD/ADRD. This highlights the relationship between genetic makeup and telomere length in influencing risk for dementia.
title: Mid-life leukocyte telomere length and dementia risk: a prospective cohort study of 435,046 UK Biobank participants

finding: In the context of the CD37 gene, rs8108669 was found to be the most significant SNP affecting CD37 expression in B cells, CD4 cells, and CD8 cells. Previously not significant in a smaller study (1M), it became notable in IBSEP with a low p-value also observed in OneK1K. This SNP was associated with the upregulation of CD37 expression, linking it to autoimmune diseases such as systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
title: A unified framework for cell-type-specific eQTLs prioritization by integrating bulk and scRNA-seq data

finding: This SNP served as the lead SNP for multiple sclerosis (MS) at the CD37 locus and was colocalized in four cell types: B cells, CD4 cells, CD8 cells, and monocytes, with very high posterior probability of colocalization. The associated epigenomic evidence suggested its relevance to MS pathology, with strong signals in ChIP-seq tracks at the CD37 promoter.
title: A unified framework for cell-type-specific eQTLs prioritization by integrating bulk and scRNA-seq data

finding: The variant rs4801778 was found to be associated with reported SARS-CoV-2 infection and also overlaps several red blood cell-associated GWAS loci. It remained the lead variant in its region after exclusion from the UK Biobank and co-localized with genetic signals for blood cell phenotypes, suggesting its significance in red blood cell parameters.
title: Genetic Examination of Hematological Parameters in SARS-CoV-2 Infection and COVID-19

finding: The variant rs74956615 was associated with severe illness and hospitalization due to COVID-19. After further analysis, it remained a sentinel variant for severe illness and was associated with lymphocyte and platelet counts, indicating its role in immune and thrombosis-related mechanisms.
title: Genetic Examination of Hematological Parameters in SARS-CoV-2 Infection and COVID-19

finding: The rs72999063 SNP was associated with a beta effect of 0.09 kg/m² and a p-value of 3.2×10^-13, identified as a common variant located 400kb upstream of the ATP13A1 gene and linked to BMI.
title: Protein-truncating variants in BSN are associated with severe adult-onset obesity, type 2 diabetes and fatty liver disease

finding: The minor allele of APOE SNP rs429358, which encodes the ε4 isoform, was associated with reduced expression of APOE (p=5.61×10^-4) and adjacent genes APOC2 and CLPTM1 (p=0.017 for both), linking it to AD pathology.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of Alzheimer disease reveals many differentially expressed genes and multiple biological pathways in brain tissue from African American donors

finding: Initially associated with Covid-19 susceptibility in Europeans, with an OR of 1.38 (P=1.80×10^-9). However, this association diminished over time and was not replicated in independent datasets.
title: A year of Covid-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: The rs7255633 variant was associated with the Tanner 2 to 4 transition in girls and acted as both an eQTL and sQTL. It was related to genes including LENG8 and CDC42EP5, which have implications for educational attainment and potentially for brain functions linked to sexual maturation.
title: Joint models reveal genetic architecture of transitions between pubertal stages and their association with BMI in a Latino population

finding: The SNP rs10422256 affected LDLR plasma protein levels only in STEMI patients at 24 hours post-event, with a genotype x time interaction effect of β=-0.29 and a p-value of 0.022. This finding suggested a temporal aspect of genetic influence on lipid metabolism post-MI, emphasizing the importance of timing in therapeutic strategies.
title: Single-cell dissection of the immune response after acute myocardial infarction

finding: The SNP rs10411210 at 19q13.11 was associated with colorectal cancer in the Colombian sample, yielding an OR of 1.24 (95% CI: 1.009-1.52, P=0.0412). This result was consistent with earlier findings regarding its role in CRC risk.
title: Colorectal Cancer Risk and Ancestry in Colombian admixed Populations

finding: The study analyzed the APOE genotype and identified significant associations between the presence of the e4 allele (carriers of combinations like e3/e4 and e4/e4) and smaller hippocampus volumes in females. This finding related to the impacts of the APOE e4 status on brain health among menopausal hormone therapy (MHT) users.
title: Menopausal hormone therapy and the female brain: leveraging neuroimaging and prescription registry data from the UK Biobank cohort

finding: Similar to rs7412, the rs429358 SNP was part of the genotyping that indicated the presence of the e4 allele was associated with smaller hippocampus volumes in carriers compared to non-carriers. This finding highlighted the relationships between APOE e4 status and brain structural changes in the context of MHT use.
title: Menopausal hormone therapy and the female brain: leveraging neuroimaging and prescription registry data from the UK Biobank cohort

finding: The SNP rs429358 was genome-wide significantly associated with Alzheimer's disease in the TOPMed-r2 test, highlighting its strong connection to AD risk.
title: A Specialized Reference Panel with Structural Variants Integration for Improving Genotype Imputation in Alzheimer’s Disease and Related Dementias (ADRD)

finding: The SNP rs597668 was identified as a risk factor for Alzheimer's disease in the European population, while it also appeared to play a protective role in the East Asian population, and was associated with a suggestive significant structural variant in EXOC3L2.
title: A Specialized Reference Panel with Structural Variants Integration for Improving Genotype Imputation in Alzheimer’s Disease and Related Dementias (ADRD)

finding: Found at locus 19p13.3, the SNP rs2109069 was also significantly associated with COVID-19 severity, displaying a p-value of 6.4×10⁻¹³, further supporting the genetic basis for severe COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Single cell sequencing analysis uncovers genetics-influenced CD16+monocytes and memory CD8+T cells involved in severe COVID-19

finding: The rs12979860-T allele in IFNL4 was significantly correlated with viral hepatitis and cirrhosis within the Hispanic American group, where its role as a risk factor for severe COVID-19 was also noted.
title: A comprehensive knowledgebase of known and predicted human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 susceptibility and severity

finding: The rs4803778 locus, which remained significant when adjusting for APOE genotype, was shown to be associated with cerebral amyloid angiopathy (CAA), with an odds ratio of 1.24 and p-value of 5.8 × 10^-12. This locus influenced DNA methylation at nearby CpG sites, linking it to epigenetic regulation in relation to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genome-wide association study of multiple neuropathology endophenotypes identifies novel risk loci and provides insights into known Alzheimer’s risk loci

finding: This variant was significantly associated with CAA, being a lead mQTL for methylation sites, showing an odds ratio of 1.24 and p-value of 6.7 × 10^-12, which supports the role of this locus in epigenetic regulation.
title: Genome-wide association study of multiple neuropathology endophenotypes identifies novel risk loci and provides insights into known Alzheimer’s risk loci

finding: The SNP rs1065853, located in a known enhancer of APOE, demonstrated a genome-wide significant interaction effect with sex across 110 metabolites. It showed notable differences in phospholipid concentrations between men and women, highlighting its role in metabolic processes and its connections to conditions such as Alzheimer's disease (AD) and coronary artery disease (CAD). This finding emphasized the importance of sex-specific effects on metabolism.
title: Pleiotropic and sex-specific genetic architecture of circulating metabolic markers

finding: The SNP rs2288904-G/A in the SLC44A2 gene was identified as a risk factor for venous thromboembolism (VTE). This polymorphism was confirmed through genome-wide association and murine studies, indicating its association with a tendency for recurrent VTE amongst patients.
title: Lack of the human choline transporter-like protein CTL2 causes hearing impairment and a rare red blood cell phenotype

finding: The rs8111424 variant was confirmed as a genome-wide significant risk factor at the UNC13A locus for FTLD-TDP, with an odds ratio of 1.37 and associated with TDP-43 pathology.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The rs12973192 variant was associated with the UNC13A locus in FTLD-TDP B, confirmed through linkage with rs8111424. It represents a significant risk factor for this subtype.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The rs576561313 variant, known as C19orf52 or TIMM29, was found to be a genome-wide significant risk factor for FTLD-TDP C.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The rs12608932 variant was the most significant SNV at the UNC13A locus, found to modulate splicing of UNC13A and associated with vesicle release impairment, crucial for FTLD-TDP pathology.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The SNP rs2455069, located on chromosome 19 (19q13.41), was identified as a valid instrumental variable (IV) for Alzheimer’s disease using the MR-SPI method. The presence of the G allele at this SNP was found to cause a missense mutation in the CD33 protein, resulting in a substitution of Arginine (R) to Glycine (G) at the 69th amino acid position (R69G). This structural alteration was predicted by AlphaFold3 and was suggested to contribute to an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD) due to its association with the accumulation of amyloid plaques in the brain.
title: Deciphering causal proteins in Alzheimer’s disease: A novel Mendelian randomization method integrated with AlphaFold3 for 3D structure prediction

finding: The rs7412 SNP was associated with the APOE epsilon genotype, which significantly influenced the hippocampus ROI age (HA) gap. Specifically, APOE epsilon4 homozygotes exhibited a greater HA gap, suggesting that this variant could serve as a biomarker for brain aging.
title: Deep learning-derived age of hippocampus-centred regions is influenced by APOE genotype and modifiable risk factors

finding: The rs429358 SNP was also linked to the APOE epsilon genotype, with similar findings regarding the HA gap. Individuals carrying the APOE epsilon4 allele displayed a larger HA gap, indicating that this SNP is crucial for understanding brain aging phenomena.
title: Deep learning-derived age of hippocampus-centred regions is influenced by APOE genotype and modifiable risk factors

finding: The variant rs121918393 was discussed in relation to its association with age at onset (AAO) in Alzheimer's disease. Specifically, a case report mentioned a carrier developing mild cognitive impairment nearly three decades later than the median onset age, implicating rs121918393 as a relevant genetic variant. Though nominally significant, it was noted that the effect size was modest, possibly due to the model not considering homozygosity effects.
title: Genetic Associations with Age at Dementia Onset in the PSEN1 E280A Colombian Kindred

finding: This SNP served to characterize the APOE epsilon alleles, exhibiting a significant association with age at onset. The imputation results revealed matching genotypes with previously known values, suggesting consistent performance in the investigation of its role relative to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genetic Associations with Age at Dementia Onset in the PSEN1 E280A Colombian Kindred

finding: Similar to rs429358, rs7412 was associated with the APOE epsilon alleles. The genotypic data derived from imputation matched those that had been separately genotyped, thereby supporting its relevance to Alzheimer's disease age at onset.
title: Genetic Associations with Age at Dementia Onset in the PSEN1 E280A Colombian Kindred

finding: The study identified the variant rs429358 in the APOE gene as a significant risk factor for Mesoamerican Nephropathy (MeN). This variant was found in 26% of the studied patients and was associated with higher levels of uric acid compared to individuals without the APOE4 haplotype, indicating that uric acid may play an important role in the disease's pathophysiology.
title: Exome Analysis Points APOE4 Haplotype as Major Risk to Develop Mesoamerican Nephropathy

finding: The SNP rs1613662 at the 19q13.42 locus was implicated in both basophil count traits and VTE risks, showing significant associations through its involvement with the GP6 gene, a collagen receptor that promotes platelet activation.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: The SNP rs116843064 in the 19p13.2 region had the highest combined annotation-dependent depletion (CADD) score and was associated with potential regulatory functions based on its impact on transcription factor binding.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: The SNP rs6511703 was included in the significant list of top SNPs affecting transcription factor interactions, highlighting its regulatory significance.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: The SNP rs892090 showed strong colocalization in all pertinent trait pairs linked to platelets and CVDs, confirming its significant role in the interrelationship between these traits.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: The rs7412 SNP, which encodes the APOE ε2 allele, was identified as protective for incident Alzheimer's disease. This finding highlighted its role in genetic susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease, alongside its interplay with the rs429358 SNP.
title: Associations of Alzheimer’s disease with inpatient hospital costs and with quality-adjusted life years: Evidence from conventional and Mendelian randomization analyses in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs429358 SNP encodes the APOE ε4 allele, which was found to increase the risk of Alzheimer's disease. Like rs7412, it played a significant role in influencing genetic susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Associations of Alzheimer’s disease with inpatient hospital costs and with quality-adjusted life years: Evidence from conventional and Mendelian randomization analyses in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs2108622 (V433M) variant linked to reduced CYP4F2 activity, which requires an increased warfarin dosage, was significant in the Yadav group.
title: Endogamy and high prevalence of deleterious mutations in India: evidence from strong founder events

finding: The variant rs2277732 in the DPP9 gene was associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (OR 1.17; p=5.34 x 10^-5), highlighting its relevance to respiratory conditions in the context of severe COVID-19.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The rs74956615 SNP at the RAVER1 locus was associated with reduced risks for several autoimmune conditions, including psoriasis (OR 0.71; p=1.53 x 10^-22) and rheumatoid arthritis (OR 0.78; p=1.04 x 10^-9), suggesting its protective role in these diseases.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The missense variant rs34536443 in the TYK2 gene was shown to confer a reduced risk of autoimmune diseases such as psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis, which was linked to alterations in immune responses and relevant to COVID-19 outcomes.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The variant rs11085727 at the TYK2 locus was associated with a reduced risk of psoriasis (OR 0.88; p=1.35 x 10^-17) and psoriatic arthropathy (OR 0.81; p=9.54 x 10^-10), supporting its protective effects in autoimmune diseases.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs731839 was part of the identified putative causal variants associated with adiponectin, establishing its role as a lead variant in the analyses.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: The lead cis-pQTL rs2288480 was in high LD with the lead MS variant at the 19q13.33 locus, showing a shared genetic signal between DKKL1 and multiple sclerosis with a PP of 96.1%.
title: From genome to phenome via the proteome: broad capture, antibody-based proteomics to explore disease mechanisms

finding: The independent secondary cis-pQTL rs66532151 was associated with multiple sclerosis at a p-value of 3.4×10−7, indicating a genetic connection and reinforcing the evidence for DKKL1's role in MS.
title: From genome to phenome via the proteome: broad capture, antibody-based proteomics to explore disease mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs405509 was associated with the thickness of specific brain regions, particularly the left parahippocampal gyrus, in cognitively healthy older individuals. This finding highlighted the broader genetic landscape influencing brain structure alterations in Alzheimer's disease (AD) beyond the widely recognized APOE-e4 allele, indicating that multiple genetic variants collectively affect brain morphology.
title: Compositional structural brain signatures capture Alzheimer’s genetic risk on brain structure along the disease continuum

finding: The SNP rs7412 was found to be associated with APOE genotype in the study, which has established relevance to dementia risk and cognitive decline. The analysis involved a population-based approach in the English Longitudinal Study of Ageing (ELSA) and was essential for determining individual APOE genotypes.
title: Unraveling the role of plasma proteins in dementia: insights from two cohort studies in the UK, with causal evidence from Mendelian randomization

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs429358 was also linked to the determination of the APOE genotype, which is crucial for assessing the risk of developing dementia. This association was verified through TaqMan assays as part of the proteomic investigation into dementia-related protein markers.
title: Unraveling the role of plasma proteins in dementia: insights from two cohort studies in the UK, with causal evidence from Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as pivotal in the study, with the lowest p-value indicating its strong association with Alzheimer's disease (AD). Its influence was noted to increase from heterozygous to homozygous occurrences across all ethnic categories in the dataset. This variant was recognized as part of the APOE haplotype, which is a well-established genetic risk factor for AD.
title: Discovering Genetic Signatures Associated with Alzheimer’s Disease in Tiled Whole Genome Sequence Data: Results from the Artificial Intelligence for Alzheimer’s Disease (AI4AD) Consortium

finding: The SNP rs769455 displayed an increased risk association with AD, particularly among individuals carrying the ε3/ε4 genotype. This effect was found to enhance the weighted encoding value when considered alongside the rs429358 variant on the same tile variant, reaffirming its relevance to AD risk.
title: Discovering Genetic Signatures Associated with Alzheimer’s Disease in Tiled Whole Genome Sequence Data: Results from the Artificial Intelligence for Alzheimer’s Disease (AI4AD) Consortium

finding: SNP rs7412 was included in the analysis as it contributes to the understanding of the APOE genotype's influence on AD. The model accounted for this SNP by including an offset to reflect the known impact of the APOE variants, enabling the identification of additional genetic associations beyond the established APOE effects.
title: Discovering Genetic Signatures Associated with Alzheimer’s Disease in Tiled Whole Genome Sequence Data: Results from the Artificial Intelligence for Alzheimer’s Disease (AI4AD) Consortium

finding: The variant rs429358, which determines the APOE ε4 allele, was found to decrease Aβ42 (Z=-36.29; p = 2.0×10^-288) and increase pTau (Z=18.31; p=6.87×10^-75) in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), solidifying its role in Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis for Alzheimer’s disease cerebrospinal fluid biomarkers

finding: The APOE ε2 haplotype variant, rs7412-T, was associated with increased Aβ42 (Z=11.97; p=5.09×10^-33) and decreased pTau (Z=-6.59; p=4.49×10^-11), demonstrating its protective effect against Alzheimer's.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis for Alzheimer’s disease cerebrospinal fluid biomarkers

finding: The rs4420638 variant was linked to Aβ42 levels (Z=-25.51; p=1.57×10^-143) in high linkage disequilibrium with rs429358, reinforcing its role in Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis for Alzheimer’s disease cerebrospinal fluid biomarkers

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with pTau levels (Z=13.83; p=1.66×10^-43), confirming its involvement in Tau pathology related to Alzheimer's.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis for Alzheimer’s disease cerebrospinal fluid biomarkers

finding: The analysis indicated that the splice region variant rs72658867 exerted a protective effect against risk of hyperlipidaemia, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.86 and a signed log 10 p value (SLP) of -5.21. This finding was derived from its prevalence, as it had a frequency of 0.012 in controls compared to 0.0097 in cases and it was previously reported to be associated with lower cholesterol levels and reduced risk of coronary artery disease.
title: Analysis of 200,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects illustrates the contribution of rare genetic variants to hyperlipidaemia

finding: The marker rs56113850 was associated with nicotine metabolism at genome-wide significance in smokers of European ancestry, indicating its crucial role in predicting nicotine metabolism rates.
title: Predicting Nicotine Metabolism Across Ancestries Using Genotypes

finding: In smokers of African ancestry, the marker rs11878604 was associated with nicotine metabolism ratio (NMR) at genome-wide significance and was recognized as an independent signal, emphasizing its importance in the metabolic prediction models.
title: Predicting Nicotine Metabolism Across Ancestries Using Genotypes

finding: This marker was associated at genome-wide significance and ranked highly in the METS meta-GWAS, showing its relevance in nicotine metabolism among treatment-seeking smokers.
title: Predicting Nicotine Metabolism Across Ancestries Using Genotypes

finding: Markers rs11878604 and rs116921376 were implicated in tobacco-related consequences such as lung cancer and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, thereby linking these SNPs to important health outcomes related to tobacco use.
title: Predicting Nicotine Metabolism Across Ancestries Using Genotypes

finding: The rs7412-T allele was associated with lower levels of Apolipoprotein B and reduced risks of lipid metabolism disorders (ICD10: E78), showing concordant effects across diverse ancestries, and correlating with previously emphasized protective roles against Alzheimer's disease.
title: Whole-genome sequencing of half-a-million UK Biobank participants

finding: The rs429358-C allele was tied to increased risks of several cognitive disorders (ICD10: F01-F09) and cerebrovascular diseases (ICD10: I60-I69) across ancestries, with noted associations to lower C-reactive protein levels and intriguing links to risks for obesity (ICD10: E66) and pulmonary diseases (ICD10: J44).
title: Whole-genome sequencing of half-a-million UK Biobank participants

finding: Regulated the proteins CD97 and EMR2, both under the same directional influence, indicating shared genetic regulation.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: The SNP rs7412 was associated with the APOE genotype classification in the study, specifically distinguishing between \\u03B54-carrier and \\u03B54-noncarrier. This classification was used as a covariate in the analysis of dementia risk factors.
title: Joint association of daytime sleep behaviors and dietary quality with the risk of dementia: A large prospective cohort study

finding: The SNP rs429358 was included in the categorization of APOE genotypes, identifying participants as \\u03B54-carrier or \\u03B54-noncarrier. This classification was considered in the context of assessing dementia risk within the cohort.
title: Joint association of daytime sleep behaviors and dietary quality with the risk of dementia: A large prospective cohort study

finding: This SNP was identified as a proxy for an absent SNP and provided valuable data in the analysis.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The low-frequency European-specific intronic variant rs752383928 was associated with serum urate levels, showing a stronger effect in males than in females (in females AF = 0.74%, effect size (se) = 1.63 (0.29), p-value = 2.43×10^-8; in males AF=0.73%, effect size (se) = 2.70 (0.18), p-value = 1.33×10^-50).
title: Global Biobank Meta-analysis Initiative: powering genetic discovery across human diseases

finding: This variant in TYK2 was significantly associated with critical illness due to COVID-19, showing an OR of 1.43. This variant is linked to immunodeficiency when loss of function occurs, indicating its role in disease severity.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: This missense variant, also in TYK2, was correlated with critical illness, showing an OR of 1.17, thus reinforcing the genetic association with severe COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: Another TYK2 missense variant that associated with critical illness due to COVID-19, highlighting the genetic factors that contribute to severe reactions in infected individuals.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: Associated with reported infection, this SNP showed a small but significant protective effect, linking it to a lower risk of hospitalization.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: This missense variant in PPP1R15A was associated with reduced infection symptoms, showing the complexity of genetic influences on disease expression.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: This intronic variant in DPP9 was positively associated with critical illness, emphasizing its role in the lung-related complications of COVID-19.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: Related to interstitial lung disease, this variant was significant for increased risk in hospitalized COVID-19 patients.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: SNP rs7254729 was found to be associated with reduced risk of thyroid autoimmune disease but a higher risk of basal cell carcinoma.
title: Extensive antagonistic variants across human genome

finding: The rs429358 genotype was associated with the Apo E4 status, which was included as a covariable in the investigation of retinal vascular measures (RVMs) associated with incident dementia. Specifically, the study utilized Cox's proportional hazards models to evaluate the risk of all cause dementia (ACD), Alzheimer's dementia (AD), and vascular dementia (VD) in patients with type 2 diabetes. It was determined that RVMs from diabetic retinopathy screening had significant associations with dementia risks, and the analysis accounted for Apo E4 status, highlighting its role in the context of dementia risk assessment.
title: Retinal Vascular Measures from Diabetes Retinal Screening Photographs and Risk of Incident Dementia in Type 2 Diabetes: A GoDARTS Study

finding: The SNP rs45524632 (KEAP1 locus) exhibited significant effect size heterogeneity in a heel bone mineral density T-score meta-analysis, supporting its role in COVID-19 epidemiology and genetic risk assessments.
title: Host genetic liability for severe COVID-19 overlaps with alcohol drinking behavior and diabetic outcomes and in over 1 million participants

finding: The SNP rs7412, located within the APOE locus on chromosome 19, had extremely strong marginal associations with low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) across three populations (UK Biobank, BBJ, and PAGE), with all P-values less than 1E-200. This indicated that rs7412 was strongly associated with LDL-C and the convergence of the Gibbs sampler achieved reasonable performance during the polygenic risk score assessment.
title: Improving Polygenic Prediction in Ancestrally Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs115550680 in the gene ABCA7 was associated with Alzheimer's disease in previous studies, reported with a p-value of 2.2×10^-9. In this study, it was again found to be genome-wide significant (p=1.17×10^-8) when combining MVP and ADGC datasets.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs73505251 in ABCA7 was also significant, with a p-value of 3.26×10^-10 indicating strong evidence for its association with Alzheimer's disease.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: This SNP yielded a significant p-value of 4.40×10^-10, confirming its role in Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP produced a p-value of 3.22×10^-8, indicating significant involvement in Alzheimer's disease.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: This SNP was associated with ABCA7 expression, p=9.16×10^-7, showing a connection to Alzheimer’s disease risk.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The rs429358 SNP was associated with the risk factor <italic>APOE</italic>-ε4, which influenced Aβ deposition, particularly in regions vulnerable to tau deposition such as the entorhinal cortex and the hippocampus. This SNP had a prominent role in the accumulation of Aβ fibrillar plaques for a given level of CSF Aβ42/40.
title: Age, sex and APOE-ε4 modify the balance between soluble and fibrillar β-amyloid in cognitively intact individuals: topographical patterns and replication across two independent cohorts

finding: The rs7412 SNP contributed to the classification of <italic>APOE</italic> alleles, which indicated a significant relationship with higher Aβ deposition in neocortical areas such as the anterior, middle, and posterior cingulate cortex for older individuals and women. This SNP was integral to understanding the interactions between soluble and deposited Aβ pathology in relation to established AD risk factors.
title: Age, sex and APOE-ε4 modify the balance between soluble and fibrillar β-amyloid in cognitively intact individuals: topographical patterns and replication across two independent cohorts

finding: The variant rs541048548, another HC-pLoF variant mapped to the ICAM3 gene, was detected only in severe COVID-19 patients. ICAM3 plays a significant role in the immunopathogenesis of SARS virus and has shown downregulated expression in asymptomatic COVID-19 cases compared to symptomatic ones, highlighting its importance in disease severity.
title: Rare Variants in Inborn Errors of Immunity Genes Associated with Covid-19 Severity

finding: The SNP rs769450 showed proximity to four hub genes: OPA3, APOE, FBXO46 in excitatory neurons, and APOE in inhibitory neurons. The gene APOE, well-known for its link to AD, ranked highly in both excitatory and inhibitory neurons, underscoring its relevance in Alzheimer's risk.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: The SNP rs9304690 was associated with the hub gene KCNC3 in inhibitory neurons, correlating with a dysfunction of potassium channels potentially linked to Alzheimer's Disease.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: The SNP rs12610495 was highlighted as associated with severe COVID-19 and shared genetic architecture with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). Although it did not reach genome-wide significance for COVID-19 risk, it was identified as an eQTL affecting DPP9 expression in lung tissue. The 'G' allele of rs12610495 correlated with increased risk of severe COVID-19, raising hypotheses about its role in inflammation or as a potential receptor for SARS-CoV-2.
title: An atlas connecting shared genetic architecture of human diseases and molecular phenotypes provides insight into COVID-19 susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs4806498 was noted near MBOAT7 and had prior associations with liver fat, affirming its importance in lipid metabolism pathways.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs1058587 variant at the GDF15 locus was identified as the most significant risk locus for hyperemesis gravidarum (HG) in this study. It was confirmed as a lead signal across various cohorts and was associated with lower circulating levels of GDF15. The study hypothesized that the H-variant of this SNP may result in reduced cleavage to mature GDF15 protein, contributing to its strong association with HG risk.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of severe pregnancy nausea and vomiting identifies risk loci associated with appetite, insulin signaling, and brain plasticity

finding: The study found that the T allele of rs12979860 was overrepresented in COVID-19 patients compared to the general population without the disease (36.16% vs. 26.40%, p=6.4×10^-4; OR=0.633; 95% CI=(0.487,0.824)). This suggested that the T allele could be a risk factor for COVID-19. Additionally, the CC genotype was significantly lower in COVID-19 patients (37.85% vs. 55.51%, p=8×10^-5; OR=0.488; 95% CI=(0.342,0.698)). This finding supported the hypothesis that genetic variants of IFNL4, particularly the rs12979860 polymorphism, may predispose individuals to COVID-19.
title: IFNL4 genetic variant can predispose to COVID-19

finding: Similar to other newly significant loci, rs146447071 was identified as part of the pleiotropic findings and may contribute to age-related ocular diseases.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: Identified near the PTBP1 promoter, rs351973 was associated with gene interactions critical for retinal cell regeneration, further suggesting its role in the pathology of ocular diseases.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The SNP rs429358 within the APOE gene on chromosome 19 was identified as a well-known AD risk SNP which demonstrated the highest importance score. This finding confirmed its significant association with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs769449 was confirmed as an AD-associated genetic variant, thus reinforcing its previously established link to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs11556505 located in the TOMM40 gene was highlighted as a high-importance SNP, emphasizing the relevance of chromosome 19 in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs34342646 in the NECTIN2 gene was identified as another high-importance SNP associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The analysis confirmed the SNP rs10414043 within the APOC1 gene as associated with Alzheimer's disease, further establishing its relevance.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs10119 was confirmed as AD-associated, adding to the previously known variants within the APOC1 and TOMM40 genes.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs71352238 was identified as an AD-associated variant within the APOC1 gene, confirming known findings.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The rs12610495-G variant related to DPP9 was linked to IPF, suggesting its role in exacerbating COVID-19 severity in predisposed individuals.
title: Integration of GWAS and multi-omic QTLs identifies uncharacterized COVID-19 gene-biotype and phenotype associations

finding: This SNP was located in the gene APOE, known for its role in amyloid degradation and had historical connections to Alzheimer's disease (Alz). Its association with basal ganglia volumes marked a new linkage.
title: Unveiling the Genetic Landscape of Basal Ganglia: Implications for Common Brain Disorders

finding: The rs10410835 variant was associated with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) in the one-to-one case-control study. It was functionally linked to the NECTIN2 gene in the APOE region, which is expressed in the brain and plays a role in the homeostasis of astrocytes and neurons.
title: New genetic loci discovery for Alzheimer’s disease using explainable deep neural networks

finding: The rs11666329 SNP was significantly associated with AD in the one-to-one case-control design, being functionally linked to NECTIN2 gene, also found in the APOE region, which contributes to brain synapse formation.
title: New genetic loci discovery for Alzheimer’s disease using explainable deep neural networks

finding: The rs405509 variant emerged as the top risk factor for AD in the one-to-two case-control study design. It is located at the APOE promoter and is associated with cognitive impairment in the elderly.
title: New genetic loci discovery for Alzheimer’s disease using explainable deep neural networks

finding: This SNP was linked to the NECTIN2 gene and identified to be significantly associated with AD in the one-to-two case-control study design.
