title: New genetic loci discovery for Alzheimer’s disease using explainable deep neural networks

finding: The rs8106813 variant was associated with AD and linked to the APOC1P1 pseudogene, with previous associations to the development of late-onset AD.
title: New genetic loci discovery for Alzheimer’s disease using explainable deep neural networks

finding: This SNP was associated with NLR on chromosome 19, with a beta coefficient of -0.07 and a p-value of 5.93 x 10^-12. It is situated in the EPS15L1 gene, which indicates a possible role in pathways related to inflammation.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study of neutrophil-lymphocyte ratio and polygenic risk score development to explore causal association with diabetic retinopathy

finding: The rs2617822 polymorphism in the VAV1 gene was suggested to be associated with rheumatoid arthritis (RA), although this research was characterized as preliminary. This finding was supported by VAV1 being identified as a hub gene with multiple connections to other genes involved in RA, indicating its potential relevance in the disease's pathogenesis.
title: Identification and Analysis of Novel Synovial Tissue-based Biomarkers and Interacting Pathways for Rheumatoid Arthritis

finding: The variant rs1244787406-G acted as a proxy marker for the monoallelic TYROBP deletion and was associated with an increased risk of dementia and Alzheimer's disease (AD) among carriers, as shown in a phenome-wide association scan involving 2489 endpoints. The study reported that carriers had a significantly earlier age of onset for dementia, at a median age of 76.5 years, compared to 79.0 years for non-carriers.
title: Monoallelic TYROBP deletion is a novel risk factor for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Similar to rs1244787406, the variant rs1002399693 was part of a haplotype associated with the 5.2-kb TYROBP deletion, which was enriched in the Finnish population. Though not as thoroughly analyzed individually, it was indicated that both rs1244787406 and rs1002399693 could serve as reliable proxy markers for identifying TYROBP deletion carriers.
title: Monoallelic TYROBP deletion is a novel risk factor for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs3916804-C SNP in ERCC2 was suggestively associated with improved survival (HR=0.44), with carriers living a median of 13.0 years post-surgery compared to 8.5 years for T/T genotype carriers.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The rs3916788-C SNP in ERCC2 showed suggestive association with improved survival times (HR=0.62), where the C/C genotype gave the longest survival at 13.0 years.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The rs144057986-C in ERCC1 was associated with improved survival (HR=0.58); carriers had a median survival of 13.3 years compared to 8.0 years for T/T carriers.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The SNP rs7412, encodes for the APOE ε2 allele and showed significant associations with AD, influencing its genetic risk factors.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The SNP rs429358, which encodes for the APOE ε4 allele, was found to be critically associated with AD, significantly impacting its risk.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The SNP rs3865444 was linked to AD through interaction analyses, contributing to the genetic complexity surrounding the disease.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The SNP rs483082 exhibited associations with AD risk, indicating its role in the complex genetic landscape of the disease.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The rs429358 SNP in the APOE locus was confirmed as a genome-wide significant finding associated with Alzheimer’s disease (AD). It demonstrated significant negative effect directions in CSF Aβ42 measures (Effect=-0.58, P=8.36e-49) and positive effect directions in PET measures (Effect=0.684, P=2.00e-25). This SNP remained the only GWAS-significant hit throughout various analyses.
title: Connecting genomic and proteomic signatures of amyloid burden in the brain

finding: The rs12151021 SNP in the ABCA7 locus was also associated with AD as per the PAD meta-analysis findings (P=3.92e-10), correlating with amyloid pathology.
title: Connecting genomic and proteomic signatures of amyloid burden in the brain

finding: The rs429358 variant located in the APOE locus was associated with the risk of SARS-CoV-2 infection, showing an OR of 1.29 with a p-value of 9x10^-9. However, after adjusting for cardiovascular disease and Alzheimer's disease status, the association's strength was attenuated (OR=1.15, P=0.005), indicating that the original association was likely confounded by these comorbidities.
title: Genetic association analysis of SARS-CoV-2 infection in 455,838 UK Biobank participants

finding: The rs117336466 variant located in the first intron of TMEM161A showed a significant association with COVID-19 positivity, with an odds ratio of 2.16 and a p-value of 4.5x10^-8, indicating its potential connection to COVID-19 susceptibility as well.
title: Genetic association analysis of SARS-CoV-2 infection in 455,838 UK Biobank participants

finding: Variant rs2109069 showed a significant AF difference with a p-value of 0.014 in COVID-19 patients compared to the general population. Previous studies had associated this variant with severe COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 relevant genetic variants confirmed in an admixed population

finding: The rs1058587 SNP in the GDF-15 gene was associated with the pregnancy-specific condition HG at genome-wide levels of significance. The study found that the H202D variant (H to D variant at position 6) significantly influenced the accuracy of GDF-15 measurements by certain immunoassays, specifically the R&D reagents, which consistently underreported concentrations of the D-containing variant peptide compared to the Roche Elecsys assay. This underreporting skewed the understanding of circulating GDF-15 levels in relation to the SNP and could explain inconsistencies in previous studies linking GDF-15 levels to body weight and nausea during pregnancy. Correction equations were provided to assist in re-analyzing data where the genotypes were known, improving the interpretation of previous genetic epidemiological studies.
title: The common H202D variant in GDF-15 does not affect its bioactivity but can significantly interfere with measurement of its circulating levels

finding: The rs429358 SNP was associated with the APOE ε4 carrier status, which was linked to higher cerebral blood flow among female participants in the study. This finding was crucial as it indicated that the presence of the ε4 allele impacted blood flow in areas related to Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: APOE4 and Chronic Health Risk Factors are Associated with Sex-Specific Preclinical Alzheimer’s Disease Neuroimaging Biomarkers

finding: The rs7412 SNP was also involved in determining APOE genotype status. Similar to rs429358, it was associated with the APOE ε4 carrier status, indicating that carriers had elevated cerebral blood flow. This linkage underscored the genetic risk associated with specific alleles in relation to sex differences in Alzheimer's neuroimaging markers.
title: APOE4 and Chronic Health Risk Factors are Associated with Sex-Specific Preclinical Alzheimer’s Disease Neuroimaging Biomarkers

finding: This SNP was identified in the SUGP1 gene and had a high CADD score, suggesting it may be pathogenic.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: Located in the HAUS5 gene, rs71353000 was noted as a novel variant with potential pathogenicity.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs6859 in the NECTIN2 gene was significantly associated with Alzheimer’s disease (AD) risk in multiple cohorts. A causal mediation analysis conducted with 708 participants showed that an increase in the dose of the A allele of rs6859 was associated with a 0.144 increase per standard deviation of the pTau-181 levels in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), demonstrating how this genetic variant can indirectly impact the likelihood of developing AD through its influence on pTau-181 levels. Specifically, carriers of the AA genotype exhibited a 19.40% higher probability for AD than their homozygous GG counterparts, suggesting that this SNP partly mediates the association with AD pathology.
title: The association between rs6859 in NECTIN2 gene and Alzheimer’s disease is partly mediated by pTau

finding: The analysis revealed that the patient had a homozygous C/C genotype at rs429358, which is consistent with the APOE E3 genotype. This was significant as the APOE genotype plays a crucial role in Alzheimer's disease pathology, influencing amyloid deposition and neurodegeneration.
title: Fatal Iatrogenic Cerebral Amyloid-Related Encephalitis in a patient treated with lecanemab for Alzheimer’s disease: neuroimaging and neuropathology

finding: The findings confirmed that the patient was also homozygous C/C at rs7412, indicating a homozygous E3 genotype. Similar to rs429358, this genotype is relevant in the context of Alzheimer's disease and its associated risk factors.
title: Fatal Iatrogenic Cerebral Amyloid-Related Encephalitis in a patient treated with lecanemab for Alzheimer’s disease: neuroimaging and neuropathology

finding: The SNP rs7412 was associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk as part of the GRS<sup>ALZinclAPOE</sup>, which included this and one additional SNP to the initial set of 83 associated with AD. This SNP contributed to understanding the influence of the APOE genotype on AD risk.
title: Transferability of a European-derived Alzheimer’s Disease Genetic Risk Score across Multi-Ancestry Populations

finding: The SNP rs429358 was similarly linked to increased Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk within the GRS<sup>ALZinclAPOE</sup>. This SNP, along with rs7412, provided critical insights into the role of the APOE genotype, particularly around the ε4 allele, in Alzheimer's disease susceptibility.
title: Transferability of a European-derived Alzheimer’s Disease Genetic Risk Score across Multi-Ancestry Populations

finding: The study reported a strong association between rs429358 (APOE4) and p-S65-Ub levels, with a beta coefficient of 0.50 and a p-value of 8.67x10-25. This association indicated that carrying the APOE4 allele was linked to higher levels of the mitochondrial damage marker p-S65-Ub in LBD cases, suggesting a significant role of the APOE4 genotype in modulating mitochondrial quality control.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies APOE and ZMIZ1 variants as mitophagy modifiers in Lewy body disease

finding: The rs429358 SNP was associated with the presence of the APOE ε4 allele, which has been implicated in increased risk for Alzheimer’s disease (AD). This genotype was linked to the variability in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) total tau (t-tau) levels among AD patients, influencing plasticity protein concentrations.
title: Cerebrospinal fluid total tau levels indicate aberrant neuronal plasticity in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs7412 SNP was identified as part of the assessment for the APOE ε2 allele, which is associated with reduced risk for Alzheimer’s disease (AD). This allele's presence correlated with distinct t-tau level profiles in AD individuals, suggesting a protective role against the disease's neuronal impairments.
title: Cerebrospinal fluid total tau levels indicate aberrant neuronal plasticity in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The common variant rs62107113 at 19q12 was associated with a modest increase in risk for developing HGSOC, positioned near the CCNE1 gene, which is involved in cell cycle regulation.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of 398,238 women unveils seven novel loci associated with high-grade serous epithelial ovarian cancer risk

finding: The lead variant rs350143 in ARID3A was discovered to have binding sites for transcription factors linked to immunoregulation, reinforcing its relevance in the pathology of atopic dermatitis.
title: Meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis in 1,094,060 individuals identifies new risk loci, and sub-analysis characterizes the loci with disease severity and onset

finding: The APOE4 SNP rs429358 also demonstrated a significant association with tau deposition, explaining 3.6% of the variation in cortical tau levels among participants.
title: Novel CYP1B1-RMDN2 Alzheimer’s disease locus identified by genome-wide association analysis of cerebral tau deposition on PET

finding: The SNP rs429358 was part of the screening for the APOE genotype, which was shown to be associated with Alzheimer's disease pathology. The data highlighted the importance of APOE-related genetic risk in relation to the accumulation of beta-amyloid and tau protein pathology, reinforcing its role in Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Large-scale proteome analysis of CSF implicates altered glucose metabolism in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also involved in determining the APOE genotype in the studied participants. This polymorphism, in conjunction with rs429358, contributed to the genetic framework relevant to Alzheimer’s disease pathology, again linking genetic predisposition to the observed proteomic changes and neurodegenerative processes.
title: Large-scale proteome analysis of CSF implicates altered glucose metabolism in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs429358, located in the APOE gene on chromosome 19, was found to increase the odds of developing dementia in Parkinson’s disease (OR = 1.36, 95% CI = 1.31 - 1.41, P = 3.25e-57). This finding was established in a genome-wide association study comparing Lewy body diseases with and without dementia.
title: Investigation of the genetic aetiology of Lewy body diseases with and without dementia

finding: The SNP rs429358, which tags the APOE ε4 allele, was robustly associated with both mortality and cognitive impairment in Parkinson's disease, reflecting its known roles in Alzheimer's disease and general mortality.
title: Genome-wide determinants of mortality and clinical progression in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs75627662 located near APOE served as a vQTL that exhibited an additive effect on transformed LDL receptor (LDLR) levels. This SNP demonstrated a genotype-dependent relationship with LDL cholesterol such that carriers of the minor T-allele had elevated LDLR levels but diminished correlation with LDL cholesterol, emphasizing a notable gene-environment interaction.
title: Systematic discovery of gene-environment interactions underlying the human plasma proteome in UK Biobank

finding: The study found that rs3865444 significantly influenced the causal inference of the level of CD33 on CD33<sup>dim</sup> HLA DR<sup>+</sup> CD11b<sup>-</sup>, indicating its strong role in immune response phenotypes.
title: Causal effect of the gut microbiota on the risk of psychiatric disorders and the mediating role of immunophenotypes

finding: The SNP rs7412 was associated with the presence of the APOE-4 allele, which was significantly linked to increased risk of Alzheimer’s disease and dementia. This finding was crucial as it was determined through the genotyping and imputation of APOE isoforms, highlighting the genetic predisposition to cognitive decline in older adults.
title: Diverging Patterns of Cognitive Decline by Sex and Race-Ethnicity in Seriously Ill Older Americans

finding: The SNP rs429358 also contributed to the identification of the APOE-4 allele, reinforcing its association with heightened risk of Alzheimer’s disease and dementia. This finding stressed the importance of genetic factors in understanding cognitive decline among older adults, particularly as it pertained to interactions with demographic variables such as sex and race-ethnicity.
title: Diverging Patterns of Cognitive Decline by Sex and Race-Ethnicity in Seriously Ill Older Americans

finding: The study identified the FCGBP variant rs1326680184 as significantly associated with spontaneous intraabdominal hemorrhage (SIH) in severe acute pancreatitis (SAP) patients. Specifically, a higher proportion of SIH-SAP patients (80.0%) carried this variant compared to non-SIH-SAP patients (27.5%). The variant was shown to alter FCGBP levels, predisposing patients to SIH, and it correlated with poor clinical outcomes such as increased mortality and complications. The results were corroborated by multiple analyses, including ELISA tests demonstrating lower FCGBP levels in rs1326680184 carriers.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing Reveals FCGBP Variant Associated with Spontaneous Intraabdominal Hemorrhage in Severe Acute Pancreatitis

finding: The LDLR variant (rs730882082) was linked to altered expression of three proteins (FGF-21, GDNF, and IL-4), with lower FGF-21 levels in carriers. This variant plays a significant role in familial hypercholesterolemia affecting nearly 30% of Greenlanders.
title: Genetic regulation of the plasma proteome and its link to cardiometabolic disease in Greenlandic Inuit

finding: The rs34536443 variant, a loss-of-function missense variant (p.Pro1104Ala) for the TYK2 gene, was associated with a 50% increased risk for severe COVID-19 (odds ratio: 1.50; 95%-CI: 1.40 - 1.62, p-value=4.3x10-29). This same variant had an opposing effect direction on rheumatoid arthritis, reducing the risk by 23% (odds ratio: 0.77; 95%-CI: 0.72 – 0.83; p-value=2.4x10-12). The findings suggested that the minor C allele of rs34536443 conferred significant genetic susceptibility to severe COVID-19 while reducing the risk for rheumatoid arthritis and other autoimmune diseases.
title: Complex patterns of multimorbidity associated with severe COVID-19 and Long COVID

finding: The SNP rs4801940 was associated with the ZNF468 locus, where an additional T allele decreased 0.45 ng/mL of 17-hydroxyprogesterone (17OHP), an important hormone during pregnancy.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: At this locus, an association was established connecting trace element metabolism.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: This SNP demonstrated an association with various metabolic interactions, especially involving vitamins.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The finding related to the rs7412 SNP was significant. Carriers of the Apolipoprotein E ε4 allele, which is determined by the presence of this SNP, were observed to have an increased risk of cognitive impairment. This finding was extracted from genetic data imputed to the 1,000 Genomes Project reference panel and suggested that the presence of this allele plays a critical role in adverse brain health outcomes.
title: Decomposing Interaction and Mediating Effects of Race/Ethnicity and Circulating Cystatin C on Cognitive Status in the United States Health and Retirement Study

finding: The rs429358 SNP was also associated with the ApoE ε4 allele, indicating that individuals with at least one copy of this allele had a heightened risk of cognitive impairment. This allele's carrier status was essential in the study of the relationship between genetic factors and dementia prevalence, thus supporting the relevance of this SNP in cognitive health within the studied population.
title: Decomposing Interaction and Mediating Effects of Race/Ethnicity and Circulating Cystatin C on Cognitive Status in the United States Health and Retirement Study

finding: In a study by Powell et al. (2013), the SNP rs1126757 was associated with better antidepressant responses. Specifically, patients with higher IL11 methylation levels in conjunction with the rs1126757 allele displayed improved treatment outcomes, underscoring the potential for combining genetic and epigenetic factors to predict treatment efficacy in individuals with MDD.
title: Leveraging DNA Methylation to Predict Treatment Response in Major Depressive Disorder: A Critical Review

finding: The SNP rs189753894 was identified as a lead SNP associated with the gene CACNA1A in a GWAS of late-onset Alzheimer's disease. The odds ratio was reported as 1.726, suggesting that this SNP increased the risk of developing the disease, particularly among APOE e4 non-carriers. The study highlighted the relevance of CACNA1A, noting its significant expression in brain tissues, including the cerebellum, and its role in neuronal cell death.
title: APOE-stratified genome-wide association study suggests potential novel genes for late-onset Alzheimer’s disease in East-Asian descent

finding: The variant rs12972156, located at the APOE locus, served as an instrumental variable for Alzheimer’s disease liability in the analysis. The findings showed that the genetically predicted Alzheimer’s disease liability increased the odds of weight loss, a result which was supported by conventional estimates, indicating that this variant may be less prone to misclassification than family history reports in evaluating Alzheimer's risk.
title: Examining risk factors for weight change during midlife: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The study found that individuals carrying the APOE e4 allele, as determined by genotype at rs7412, experienced significantly steeper declines in memory (β = -0.234, P<0.001) and general cognitive function (β = -0.246, P<0.001) compared to non-carriers. This indicated a marked progression in cognitive impairment related to aging.
title: Predictors of longitudinal cognitive ageing from age 70 to 82 including APOE e4 status, early-life and lifestyle factors

finding: Similar to the findings for rs7412, carriers of the APOE e4 allele at rs429358 were shown to have a higher risk of accelerated cognitive decline. The results highlighted that both rs7412 and rs429358 contributed to identifying individuals at greater risk for cognitive aging, underscoring their importance in the study.
title: Predictors of longitudinal cognitive ageing from age 70 to 82 including APOE e4 status, early-life and lifestyle factors

finding: The SNP rs601338, located at 19q13.33, exhibited significant association with type 1 diabetes (T1D) and coronary artery disease (CAD), presenting the highest CADD score of 52, suggesting potential deleterious effects. This underscores its possible role in the shared genetic architecture between ADs and CVDs.
title: Genetic analyses identify shared genetic components related to autoimmune and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The rs7255816 variant, located in the CYP4F12 gene, exhibited an African abundant variant distribution across populations. This finding suggested its potential implications in pharmacogenetic associations related to drug metabolism in African populations.
title: AI coupled to pharmacometric modelling to tailor malaria and tuberculosis treatment in Africa

finding: The C-allele of rs429358 (the ε4 allele) was linked to a significant decrease in Aβ pathology (PC2), associated with a lower score of -0.50SD, indicating its role as a risk factor for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The SNP rs2258983 related to the protein SIGLEC9 was implicated in shared effects with ALS based on a recent BioFINDER study. Although this study did not uncover supportive evidence from the CSF database, the significance of this SNP was noted in conjunction with findings regarding its concordant direction of effects on ALS, supported by robust colocalization analysis between plasma pQTL datasets.
title: Prioritization of therapeutic targets for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis using protein-wide Mendelian randomization analysis

finding: The rs7259350 variant, located near the APOE/APOC cluster, was identified as the most pleiotropic locus, associating with the variance of nine biomarkers which included total cholesterol (TC), low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C), high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C), triglycerides (TG), and liver enzymes among others. This locus showed strong main effects on the same biomarkers and interacted with lifestyle factors related to cardiovascular disease risk.
title: Variance-quantitative trait loci enable systematic discovery of gene-environment interactions for cardiometabolic serum biomarkers

finding: The SNP <CYP2B6 516G>T (rs3745274) was found to be independently associated with efavirenz concentration in cervicovaginal fluid (CVF) during pregnancy, showing a significant increase in drug concentration (β = 997 ng/mL, p = 5.7 x 10^-5). This indicates the SNP's role in influencing the pharmacokinetics of efavirenz.
title: Pharmacogenetics of efavirenz exposure in cervicovaginal fluid during pregnancy and postpartum

finding: This SNP was an sQTL for LTBP4 in fibroblasts and although it showed prominence, it did not have notable effects in aortic tissues but was important due to its role in the TGF-β pathway.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The variant rs150414818 located in the ALDH16A1 gene was associated with higher gout risk. It was shown to disrupt the interaction between ALDH16A1 and HPRT1, leading to urate overproduction.
title: Exploring metabolic changes in gout – Insights from a genetic study

finding: The allele rs752383928 for ALDH16A1 was associated with negative effects on cholesterol and triglyceride levels, which suggested potential cardiovascular risks in patients with gout.
title: Exploring metabolic changes in gout – Insights from a genetic study

finding: This SNP was reported to be associated specifically with gout in male populations, thus further implicating genetic factors in gout risk.
title: Exploring metabolic changes in gout – Insights from a genetic study

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the APOE-ε4 haplotype, showing a significant negative effect on longevity (β = -21.84, P = 4.25E-7). This indicates a correlation between the presence of the APOE-ε4 allele and reduced lifespan.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs7412 also tagged the APOE haplotypes, contributing to the findings related to Alzheimer's disease and longevity. It was part of the analysis showing the influence of the APOE locus on lifespan.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs147053538 mapped to an intergenic region between PSG11 and PSG7 and served as an eQTL for multiple genes. Its implication in aging was noted alongside its chromatin interactions suggesting a cardiovascular role in modulating longevity.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: The rs7508679 SNP was found to modify the intervention effects on various waist-related indicators such as waist circumference. In the intervention group, the effect allele was associated with greater decreases in waist-related indicators, whereas in the control group, it was associated with greater increases. This suggested a more beneficial response to the lifestyle intervention among carriers of this allele.
title: Effect of the INSR gene variants on the long-term response to a 31-month childhood obesity intervention

finding: The rs10420008 SNP significantly influenced the results of the intervention on waist-related indicators and also modified intervention effects on body weight and BMI at 9 months. Similar to rs7508679, in the intervention group, the effect allele was linked with improved outcomes, indicating its role in enhancing the response to the obesity intervention.
title: Effect of the INSR gene variants on the long-term response to a 31-month childhood obesity intervention

finding: The rs11883325 SNP exhibited similar trends as rs7508679 and rs10420008, where it modified the effects of the obesity intervention on waist indicators, leading to greater reductions in the intervention group and increases in the control group.
title: Effect of the INSR gene variants on the long-term response to a 31-month childhood obesity intervention

finding: The rs4804416 SNP was involved in modifying the intervention effects on waist-related indicators, aligning with the observations for the other prominent SNPs. Those with the effect allele showed a more favorable response to the intervention in terms of waist circumference reduction.
title: Effect of the INSR gene variants on the long-term response to a 31-month childhood obesity intervention

finding: The SNP rs72986630, located in the 5' UTR of the ZNF823 gene, qualified as a candidate effector gene at a SCZ risk locus, reinforcing the gene's involvement in the immune response connected to schizophrenia.
title: A transcriptome-wide Mendelian randomization study in isolated human immune cells highlights interferon regulatory transcription factor 3 as a schizophrenia hub gene

finding: The missense mutation rs7247025-C in the LILRB2 gene was found to be overrepresented in infected individuals compared to the general population, indicating it was associated with increased susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: “Immunogenetics of resistance to SARS-CoV-2 infection in discordant couples”

finding: The variant rs59342471/T in the LAIR2 gene was associated with protection against SARS-CoV-2 infection, indicating a potential role in immune response modulation.
title: “Immunogenetics of resistance to SARS-CoV-2 infection in discordant couples”

finding: The SNP rs10422861 was included in the study as a genetic variant influencing pancreas fat accumulation, which was associated with a higher odds ratio for PDAC risk.
title: Genetic Evidence Causally Linking Pancreas Fat to Pancreatic Cancer: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The study indicated that the SNP rs7412, which defines one of the alleles for the APOE gene, was associated with a greater reduction in LDL cholesterol levels in response to statin treatment. Specifically, the e2 genotype indicated by this SNP displayed a superior LDL cholesterol-lowering effect compared to the e3e3 genotype.
title: The Triangulation WIthin A STudy (TWIST) framework for causal inference within Pharmacogenetic research

finding: As one of the 18 novel SNPs, rs2386593 played a role in elucidating the genetic associations underlying the comorbidity of obesity and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: Identified as one of the novel shared SNPs, rs11667487 was integral to the research findings that established genetic links between the two conditions.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: As one of the novel findings from the study, rs8112975 contributed to defining the shared genetic architecture between obesity and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: The rs7412 SNP, located in the ApoE gene, was linked to low-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels (LDL-C) with a p-value of 2.30E-08. It replicated findings from European, Asian, and Chinese populations.
title: A Chinese host genetic study discovered type I interferons and causality of cholesterol levels and WBC counts on COVID-19 severity

finding: The rs838133 A- allele was associated with higher relative carbohydrate and sugar intake but lower protein and fat intake. This variant was demonstrated in functional studies to cause elevated plasma FGF21 levels, although it associates weakly with plasma FGF21 levels. Additionally, haplotype analyses revealed that rs838133 A allele influenced macronutrient intake, showing a stronger association with increased alcohol and free sugar intake, while being negatively correlated with protein and fat intake.
title: Diet pattern determines circulating FGF21 levels while distinct FGF21 variants influence diet pattern and FGF21 levels

finding: The rs838131 variant was strongly associated with higher plasma FGF21 levels, acting independently from rs838133. When conditioning on rs838133, the effect of rs838131 on plasma FGF21 levels remained significant. This variant was linked to influencing the diet-regulatory mechanism of FGF21 in humans, with complex interactions regarding alcohol and macronutrient intake. The associations reaffirmed the distinct roles of the two FGF21 variants in influencing different dietary behaviors.
title: Diet pattern determines circulating FGF21 levels while distinct FGF21 variants influence diet pattern and FGF21 levels

finding: The SNP rs58542926-A in the TM6SF2 gene was identified as a significant risk factor for fatty liver disease among individuals with metabolic syndrome, with an odds ratio of 2.7 (1.9-3.9; p=0.021). Similar to other mentioned SNPs, this finding highlighted its role in the genetic predisposition to severe phenotypes of FLD.
title: Severe liver damage, low bone mineral content, and PDXDC1/TTC39B gene variations linked to NAFLD with metabolic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2053079 was associated with schizophrenia (SCZ) and predicted to have ZNF563 as its causal gene. ZNF563, a zinc finger nuclease involved in neuronal differentiation, was specifically upregulated in parvalbumin (PVALB) cells for SCZ (logFC = 0.61), highlighting its significance in understanding the genetic components of SCZ.
title: Transcriptomic pathology of neocortical microcircuit cell types across psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs7259620 in the APOE region was identified with a strong association for LOAD in stage 1, showing a P-value of 2.25×10^-1, consistent with previous findings highlighting APOE as a major risk factor for Alzheimer's disease.
The variant rs875121 related to the ATF5/SIGLEC11 loci showed a significant association with LOAD in stage 2 analysis with a P-value of 1.03×10^-8, supporting its role in Alzheimer's risk.

The study reported that the SNP rs429358, associated with the presence of the APOE epsilon4 allele, had a significant effect on plasma p-tau217 levels, with carriers showing higher levels (b=0.19, P=5x10^-16). This finding was significant in the context of Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: Cross-sectional study of plasma phosphorylated Tau 217 in persons without dementia

finding: The SNP rs10414043 in the APOC1 gene was implicated as a significant SNP associated with p-tau217 levels, highlighting its potential role in Alzheimer’s disease biomarkers, although specific details on its association strength or direction were not provided.
title: Cross-sectional study of plasma phosphorylated Tau 217 in persons without dementia

finding: The SNP rs112009052, located at GRCh38, chr19:40593595 A/T, was identified as a splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL) for LTBP4. The T allele was associated with increased splicing leading to decreased transcription of a truncated LTBP4 transcript. This allele also correlated with elevated plasma levels of LTBP4 and an increased risk for AAA, with a posterior probability for colocalization of 0.89.
title: Plasma proteomics reveals the potential causal impact of extracellular matrix proteins on abdominal aortic aneurysm

finding: The lead variant rs74956615 at the TYK2 locus demonstrated a strong association with autoimmune diseases, with a significant P-value of 9.7 × 10^-12. This locus is known for protective associations against autoimmune diseases, highlighting its importance in immune response.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: The functional missense variant rs34536443 (p.Pro1104Ala) in the TYK2 locus reduced TYK2 function but did not achieve genome-wide significance (P = 7.5 × 10^-7) due to its missingness in some cohorts, which complicated fine-mapping accuracy.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: The missense variant rs34187696 (p.Gly337Val) in ZSCAN5A was indicated to influence monocyte counts and was successfully fine-mapped in association with asthma.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: This intronic variant in TGFB1 showed a significant association with otosclerosis at a genome-wide level, with an odds ratio of 0.8 and a strong context of connection to TGFβ1 signaling characteristics.
title: Genome-wide Screen of Otosclerosis in Population Biobanks: 18 Loci and Shared Heritability with Skeletal Structure

finding: Found in CALR3 on 19p13.11, rs192992408 displayed strong genetic influences pertaining to lung cancer susceptibility, noted particularly in African ancestry.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs429358 is part of the APOE gene locus and is crucial for defining the APOE haplotypes, directly implicating it in the genetic risk factors associated with various neurodegenerative diseases, including DLB.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: The SNP rs7412, alongside rs429358, contributed to determining APOE haplotypes, emphasizing its role in the genetic predisposition to Dementia with Lewy Bodies (DLB) and other related disorders.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: The genetic variant rs17271883 near FUT6 was identified as a tumor biomarker with significant associations to cancer-related proteins and glycans, indicating its potential relevance in cancer pathogenesis and immune regulation.
title: The Molecular Human – A Roadmap of Molecular Interactions Linking Multiomics Networks with Disease Endpoints

finding: The SNP rs103294 near AC010518.3 contributed to a constructed network revealing its links to immune regulation, emphasizing the potential of this variant in influencing disease outcomes through immune mechanisms.
title: The Molecular Human – A Roadmap of Molecular Interactions Linking Multiomics Networks with Disease Endpoints

finding: The missense variant rs429358 in the APOE gene was linked to various traits, including dementia and Alzheimer's disease. Notably, it conferred a 30% lower risk of dementia in African populations compared to European populations.
title: Diversity and Scale: Genetic Architecture of 2,068 Traits in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs429358 was positively associated with lower cognitive function in the context of the APOE ε4 allele. This association was particularly pronounced in older individuals (age >68) and in females when assessing general cognitive function, orientation, and language/fluency.
title: Effect of APOE ε4 and its modification by sociodemographic characteristics on cognitive measures in South Asians from LASI-DAD

finding: The SNP rs7412 also showed a positive association with lower cognitive function through the APOE ε4 allele. Similar to rs429358, the impact was more significant among older participants and females concerning memory and language/fluency.
title: Effect of APOE ε4 and its modification by sociodemographic characteristics on cognitive measures in South Asians from LASI-DAD

finding: The SNP rs445925, which maps to the APOC1 gene, showed significant associations with plasma HMG levels in statin users. The effect was dependent on statin intake, indicating that this variant contributed to statin response variability as characterized by plasma HMG. Individuals carrying at least one copy of the minor allele exhibited a decrease in LDL-cholesterol regardless of statin use, highlighting a complex interplay between this SNP and statin therapy.
title: Heterogeneity in statin responses explained by variation in the human gut microbiome

finding: The SNP rs7412, located in the APOE gene, was also found to be significantly associated with plasma HMG levels in statin users, similar to rs445925. The association was present only among those taking statins, suggesting that it plays a role in the pharmacogenomics of statin therapy. Like rs445925, the presence of the minor allele corresponded to a decrease in LDL-cholesterol levels in both statin users and non-users.
title: Heterogeneity in statin responses explained by variation in the human gut microbiome

finding: The variant rs429358 at the APOE locus showed the strongest association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) with a p-value of 7.2 x 10^-77, indicating a significant genetic risk factor for AD.
title: Key variants via Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project whole genome sequence data

finding: The rs492602 variant is related to FUT2, a gene associated with secretor status, which was found to have a protective effect against critical COVID-19.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: This stop-gain variant was associated with a non-secretor phenotype, noted to have protective effects against life-threatening COVID-19.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: The R145C variant (rs769455) was associated with an almost three-fold increased risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD) among individuals with the <italic>APOE</italic> ε3/ε4 genotype. R145C carriers had an odds ratio of 2.75 (95% CI, 1.84 to 4.11; P = 8.3×10^-7) compared to non-carriers. Additionally, carriers exhibited an AD age-at-onset nearly 6 years younger (β, -5.72; 95% CI, -7.87 to -3.56; P = 2.0×10^-7) and a faster cumulative incidence of AD as indicated by a hazard ratio of 2.42 (95% CI, 1.81 to 3.25; P = 3.7×10^-9).
title: APOE missense variant R145C is associated with increased Alzheimer’s disease risk in African ancestry individuals with the APOE ε3/ε4 genotype

finding: The lead variant rs2452170, part of locus 34, was determined to be significantly associated with LOAD. It maintained its significance even after conditioning on independently associated variants in the nearby APOE region, suggesting its independence and relevance to the pathogenesis of LOAD.
title: Largest GWAS (N=1,126,563) of Alzheimer’s Disease Implicates Microglia and Immune Cells

finding: The analysis revealed a significant reduction in the CC genotype of rs12979680 in COVID-19 patients compared to controls (38% vs 55%, p<0.001), indicating a protective effect of this allele against the disease.
title: Genetic variation of IFNL4 is associated with COVID-19

finding: This SNP was linked to the LDLR gene and indicated an association with traits related to lipoprotein levels.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Associated with the PEPD gene, this SNP was identified in relation to novel fatty acid loci.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP was recognized among novel loci linked to fatty acid traits.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: ABCA7:rs72973581-A was identified as a protective variant, indicating its potential resilience toward AD risk across different ancestries.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: NFIC:rs9749589-A illustrated a resilient nature, linking to the broader narrative of genetic predisposition to AD.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: APOE3 Christchurch:rs121918393-A was reported as resilient, suggesting implications for AD susceptibility among different ancestries.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The variant rs113010808 was identified as the lead variant in both Thyroid and Heart tissues for the regulation of the WDR18 gene. It demonstrated significant implications in the genetic regulation of gene expression across these tissue types, showing allelic heterogeneity with other variants.
title: Redefining tissue specificity of genetic regulation of gene expression in the presence of allelic heterogeneity

finding: The SNP rs2240149 exhibited a strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) relationship with rs4806884 (r² = 0.79) but a weaker relationship with rs113010808 (r² = 0.15), suggesting its potential role in the expression regulation of the WDR18 gene in different tissues.
title: Redefining tissue specificity of genetic regulation of gene expression in the presence of allelic heterogeneity

finding: The variant rs4806884, like rs2240149, was involved in the cis-eQTL regulation of the WDR18 gene, showing a higher degree of allelic heterogeneity across tissues, with a notable r² of 0.79 with rs2240149.
title: Redefining tissue specificity of genetic regulation of gene expression in the presence of allelic heterogeneity

finding: The missense variant rs121918393 (APOECh) was associated with APOECh carriers showing a lower polygenic risk score for Alzheimer’s disease (p=0.02), suggesting a potential protective effect against AD.
title: Characterization of APOE Christchurch carriers in 455,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: This variant was located in APOE/APOC1 and had a very high posterior-probability-of-replicability (PPR=1). It was associated with the treatment-related LDL cholesterol (LDL-C) reduction from baseline and demonstrated a strong signal in the pooled GWAS 2df test with a p-value of 1.09 × 10^-51.
title: Statistical Assessment of Biomarker Replicability using MAJAR Method

finding: In the study, an intronic variant in IFNL4, specifically rs12979860, was found to be associated with RSV-specific IgG concentration. The presence of the minor allele (A) was correlated with higher levels of RSV IgG, indicating genetic influence on the immune response to RSV. Individuals with the AA genotype showed significantly higher RSV IgG levels compared to those with the GG genotype, with statistical significance established by a t-test (p=0.01). This finding highlighted the role of genetic factors in the immunological response to RSV infection, particularly in the context of asthma.
title: Respiratory syncytial virus-specific immunoglobulin G (IgG) concentrations associate with environmental and genetic factors: the Factors Influencing Pediatric Asthma Study

finding: The study investigated the impact of host IL28B SNP rs12979860 on interferon responsiveness among chronic genotype 3 Hepatitis C patients, suggesting that certain genotypes may significantly affect treatment outcomes and liver disease progression.
title: Study of Hepatitis C Virus infection among multi-transfused patients with inherited β-globin synthesis gene defect, in the eastern region of India

finding: The analysis of the SNP rs8099917 also focused on its role in interferon responsiveness and the progression of advanced liver disease within the same cohort of chronic genotype 3 Hepatitis C patients, highlighting its importance in therapeutic strategies.
title: Study of Hepatitis C Virus infection among multi-transfused patients with inherited β-globin synthesis gene defect, in the eastern region of India

finding: The variant rs111234557 was identified in the context of Qatari-derived LDL-C polygenic score (PGS) panels. While it was included in the PGS5_QBB_6SNP panel, it represented an additional SNP unique to this panel that was not found in the EUR_6SNP or EUR_12SNP panels, indicating its potential localized importance for lipoprotein metabolism in the Qatari population.
title: Identification of a Novel SLC2A9 Gene Association with LDL-C levels and Evaluation of Polygenic Scores in a Multi-Ancestry Genome Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs2288464 was proposed as a candidate due to its position in the 3’ untranslated region of MRPL34, a gene coding for mitochondrial ribosome proteins. Although the initial association was not significant in whole genome sequencing (P = 0.0655), it showed a strong trend in WES and imputed data, suggesting a role in influencing MT-CN, despite insufficient power to detect a robust association in WGS data.
title: Mitochondrial genome copy number measured by DNA sequencing in human blood is strongly associated with metabolic traits via cell-type composition differences

finding: The variant rs12721046 was identified to have a significant influence on the associations of genetically-proxied Alzheimer’s disease with various imaging-derived phenotypes. This SNP was shown to dominate the analyses, with its precision being remarkably high when compared to other genetic variants. Its primary associations included its effect on white matter mean diffusivity and cortical orientation dispersion index. Furthermore, it was implicated in the relationship with cerebral amyloid deposition, highlighting its critical role in Alzheimer's disease pathology. The findings demonstrated that when rs12721046 was excluded from analyses, the causal effect estimates were attenuated towards the null, suggesting that the previously observed associations were largely driven by this particular variant.
title: Educational attainment, structural brain reserve, and Alzheimer’s disease: a Mendelian randomization analysis

finding: The rs429358 SNP was part of the APOE gene, where the presence of the variant APOE ε4 was significantly associated with late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD). The findings related to increased risk due to its association with decreased hippocampal volume and increased size of the inferior lateral ventricles.
title: Brain morphology mediating the effect of genetic risk variants on Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Similar to rs429358, rs7412 contributed to the formation of the APOE ε4 allele, which was identified as a strong genetic risk factor for LOAD, showing connections to neuroimaging biomarkers such as reduced entorhinal cortex thickness.
title: Brain morphology mediating the effect of genetic risk variants on Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs75627662 was significantly associated with LOAD in both UKB and ADNI. Its effects were mediated by neuroanatomical changes in the entorhinal cortex, amygdala, and hippocampus, reflecting a similar mechanism to APOE ε4.
title: Brain morphology mediating the effect of genetic risk variants on Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7408312 was indicated to show significant colocalization with PTSD, suggesting its importance in the shared genetic risk associated with cardiovascular conditions.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs145793672 located at the 19p13.11 locus was part of the group of five pleiotropic loci identified in the context of MDD and MI, indicating its importance in the shared genetic architecture of these phenotypes.
title: Role of Blood Lipids in the Shared Genetic Etiology Between Major Depressive Disorder and Myocardial Infarction: A Large-scale Multi-trait Association Analysis

finding: SNP rs116843064 at the 19p13.2 locus was recognized as the most significant exonic variant associated with MI, correlating with the ANGPTL4 gene, which plays a critical role in lipid metabolism, thus linking it to both MI and lipid traits.
title: Role of Blood Lipids in the Shared Genetic Etiology Between Major Depressive Disorder and Myocardial Infarction: A Large-scale Multi-trait Association Analysis

finding: The SNP rs429358 located at the 19q13.32 locus was reported as an important genetic variant implicated in MI, indicating its relevance in relation to lipid metabolism.
title: Role of Blood Lipids in the Shared Genetic Etiology Between Major Depressive Disorder and Myocardial Infarction: A Large-scale Multi-trait Association Analysis

finding: In a 2013 GWAS conducted in African Americans, rs115550680 was associated with an increased risk for Alzheimer's Disease (AD). This SNP, which was rare in European populations, demonstrated a risk comparable to the highly pathogenic APOE-D4 variant also observed in Europeans. This finding highlighted the significance of this SNP in neurogenetics, particularly in populations of African descent.
title: Assessing the lack of diversity in genetics research across neurodegenerative diseases: a systematic review of the GWAS Catalog and literature

finding: The SNP rs67397200, located in the ABHD8 gene at 19p13.11, had the strongest positive association with ROR-P and was identified in a GWAS for ER-negative breast cancer. It was associated with increased risk of the luminal B and triple negative intrinsic-like subtypes while correlating with a decreased risk of the luminal A subtype. This suggests its relevance in aggressive breast cancer phenotypes.
title: Development and testing of a polygenic risk score for breast cancer aggressiveness

finding: The variant rs364691 located at 19q13.31 showed a P-value of 1.6×10−6 and OR of 1.35. Previous studies indicated its upregulation in treatment-naïve UC patients, thereby establishing its relevance.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The rs7412 variant was associated with the APOE gene, known for its role in lipid transport and cholesterol metabolism. It was included in the context of constructing the e4count metric, which indicated the number of ε4 alleles an individual carries, a key factor in understanding the genetic risk of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-class Modeling Identifies Shared Genetic Risk for Late-onset Epilepsy and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs429358 SNP was also part of the APOE gene analysis, contributing to the e4count metric representing the number of ε4 alleles. This variant has been well-established in previous research as a significant genetic risk factor for late-onset Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-class Modeling Identifies Shared Genetic Risk for Late-onset Epilepsy and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs157580 SNP was identified as one of the top SNPs with the highest coefficient magnitude in the shared genetic risk factors for both Alzheimer's disease and late-onset epilepsy, indicating its notable contribution to the genetic risk profile between these two disorders.
title: Multi-class Modeling Identifies Shared Genetic Risk for Late-onset Epilepsy and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs1064725 variant was highlighted as one of the three SNPs with the highest coefficient magnitude linked to shared genetic risks of Alzheimer's disease and late-onset epilepsy, suggesting its importance in the genetic interplay of these conditions.
title: Multi-class Modeling Identifies Shared Genetic Risk for Late-onset Epilepsy and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: It was identified as a missense variant in the <italic>APOE</italic> gene, tagging the <italic>ε4</italic> allele associated with an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: A Finnish-specific frameshift variant linked to congenital nephrotic syndrome of the Finnish type.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with thinning in the choriocapillaris (CSI), providing insight into its distinct role among AMD risk alleles.
title: Photoreceptor layer thinning is an early biomarker for age-related macular degeneration development: Epidemiological and genetic evidence from UK Biobank optical coherence tomography data

finding: The rs7412 SNP was found to be associated with APOE genotype, which is recognized as a major genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease (AD). In the context of the study, carriers of the APOE epsilon 4 allele, which can be determined by this SNP, were linked to an increased risk of cerebrovascular lesions. This highlights its significance in understanding individual vulnerability to cerebrovascular pathology.
title: White matter brain age as a biomarker of cerebrovascular burden in the ageing brain

finding: The rs429358 SNP was also identified as a key marker for determining APOE genotype. Similar to rs7412, it was associated with the APOE epsilon 4 allele status. The presence of this allele was correlated with higher risks of both Alzheimer's disease and cerebrovascular lesions, emphasizing its role in the vascular health and cognitive decline of individuals.
title: White matter brain age as a biomarker of cerebrovascular burden in the ageing brain

finding: The SNP rs429358 in the APOE locus was associated with an earlier age at onset (AAO) of ischemic stroke in women, with a beta of -1.29 years (meta p-value = 2.48×10^-11). This finding reinforced previous associations of this variant with increased mortality and stroke AAO, suggesting that the association may reflect a survival bias rather than a direct relationship with ischemic stroke per se.
title: Evidence of survival bias in the association between APOE-Є4 and age of ischemic stroke onset

finding: The rs429358 SNP, tagging the APOE ε4 allele, was identified as a major risk factor for conversion to Parkinson's disease dementia (PDD) with a Hazard Ratio (HR) of 2.42 and a p-value of 1.2 x 10^-15. This SNP is significant due to its association with cognitive decline and dementia in PD.
title: Association between the LRP1B and APOE loci and the development of Parkinson’s disease dementia

finding: This intron variant in the gene JAK3 was identified as one of the top 20 most impactful features in the model for Pred at 1uM, indicating its potential role in influencing drug effectiveness for IBD treatment.
title: Combining explainable machine learning, demographic and multi-omic data to identify precision medicine strategies for inflammatory bowel disease

finding: This intron variant in the gene TYK2 was one of five unique features identified for the model regarding 5-ASA treatment, indicating its relevance in patient response to this therapy.
title: Combining explainable machine learning, demographic and multi-omic data to identify precision medicine strategies for inflammatory bowel disease

finding: This intron variant in TYK2 was also part of the five unique features for 5-ASA, suggesting it contributed to variations in therapeutic response among patients.
title: Combining explainable machine learning, demographic and multi-omic data to identify precision medicine strategies for inflammatory bowel disease

finding: At locus 19q13.33, the SNP rs1405655 was newly associated with severe COVID-19 (P=3.25×10^-8; OR=1.09 for minor allele C). This locus implicated genes such as NAPSA, which was also shown to play a role in lung surfactant production.
title: New susceptibility loci for severe COVID-19 by detailed GWAS analysis in European populations

finding: This SCZ GWAS index SNP was situated in the promoter region of GATAD2A and was predicted to disrupt REST binding, highlighting its potential significance in neurogenesis and schizophrenia.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as a significant marker associated with APOE isoforms, which were estimated in all MESA participants. The findings suggested that this SNP related to cognitive decline and dementia, thereby demonstrating its relevance to the pathways involving cardiovascular diseases and dementia.
title: Subclinical Vascular Composites Predict Clinical Cardiovascular Disease, Stroke, and Dementia: The Multi-Ethnic Study of Atherosclerosis (MESA)

finding: Similar to rs429358, the SNP rs7412 was associated with APOE isoforms in the study participants. This rs7412 SNP was also relevant in the context of predicting dementia risk, as APOE has been recognized in the literature as influential in Alzheimer's disease and vascular dementia, linking it to cardiovascular health outcomes.
title: Subclinical Vascular Composites Predict Clinical Cardiovascular Disease, Stroke, and Dementia: The Multi-Ethnic Study of Atherosclerosis (MESA)

finding: In the study, rs405509 was characterized as an important SNP located in the APOE promoter. It was found to interact with rs429358, potentially neutralizing its predisposing effect for late onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD). It had a high feature importance score in tree-based machine learning algorithms despite having a low allele frequency difference between LOAD and controls.
title: Machine learning methods applied to genotyping data capture interactions between single nucleotide variants in late onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs1160985 located in TOMM40 showed a significant interaction with rs405509, displaying a remarkable p-value of 1.42E-153. This interaction was among the most significant found in the context of LOAD classification, suggesting its association with the disease.
title: Machine learning methods applied to genotyping data capture interactions between single nucleotide variants in late onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: rs429358 was identified as one of the strongest genetic determinants for LOAD, with a high allele frequency difference in cases versus controls (pval=3.72E-44, logFC=1.37). It was among the top SNPs prioritized by the machine learning models, although not the highest in feature importance.
title: Machine learning methods applied to genotyping data capture interactions between single nucleotide variants in late onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7412 is known to be protective against Alzheimer's disease and showed a low allele frequency difference in this study (pval=5.14E-09, logFC=-1.39), despite its relationship with LOAD being established in prior research.
title: Machine learning methods applied to genotyping data capture interactions between single nucleotide variants in late onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: rs769449 was identified as having a significant presence in LOAD cases (pval=9.95E-37, logFC=1.33), suggesting its relevance as a genetic factor in Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: Machine learning methods applied to genotyping data capture interactions between single nucleotide variants in late onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: This SNP was located downstream of APOC1 and displayed significant allele frequency differences between LOAD and control groups (pval=4.56E-42, logFC=1.14), indicating its role as a potential genetic risk factor.
title: Machine learning methods applied to genotyping data capture interactions between single nucleotide variants in late onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs429358, associated with the APOE-e4 allele, showed significant allelic heterogeneity among populations, particularly with an I2 value of 96.54, suggesting substantial effect variability due to ancestry.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis and fine-mapping in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs7412, related to the APOE-e2 allele, did not exhibit any heterogeneity in the study and was referenced in the broader context of genetic risk for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis and fine-mapping in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs12151021 was recognized as significant in previously established loci for Alzheimer's disease, emphasizing its relevance.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis and fine-mapping in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP associated with APOE was tied to several colocalization signals including genes related to Alzheimer’s disease and sleep traits.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: The rs12608932 polymorphism in the UNC13A gene was significantly related to survival in ALS patients, particularly within univariate analyses, indicating its potential role as a modifier of ALS progression.
title: The additive effect of genetic modifiers on ALS prognosis: a population-based study

finding: The study identified the missense variant rs35033974 as being associated with TEX101 proteins through proteomic measurements of human spermatozoa. This finding was significant in understanding the role of TEX101 in reproductive biology and potential implications for male infertility.
title: Immunoprecipitation-targeted proteomics assays facilitate rational development of SARS-CoV-2 serological diagnostics

finding: Found as one of the lead variants in previous studies and confirmed its association with susceptibility to DD.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: This SNP is associated with the APOE gene and was significantly enriched in centenarians, indicating a protective effect related to cognitive health.
title: Cognitively Healthy Centenarians are genetically protected against Alzheimer’s disease specifically in immune and endo-lysosomal systems

finding: This SNP is associated with the APOE gene as well and showed significant enrichment in centenarians, contributing to a protective gene profile against Alzheimer's.
title: Cognitively Healthy Centenarians are genetically protected against Alzheimer’s disease specifically in immune and endo-lysosomal systems

finding: This SNP near ABCA7 was enriched in centenarians, involved in amyloid processing, indicating its protective role in cognitive health.
title: Cognitively Healthy Centenarians are genetically protected against Alzheimer’s disease specifically in immune and endo-lysosomal systems

finding: This SNP was identified as a shared genetic locus for RA and severe COVID-19, located in the TYK2 gene, demonstrating a strong association.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was linked to SLE and COVID-19 hospitalization, situated in the FUT2 gene, indicating significant shared genetics.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The frameshift deletion on ABCA7 (rs547447016) was suggestive in both AD-age score and Cox regressions, although it did not show significance in logistic regression, marking its potential influence on AD.
title: A novel age-informed approach for genetic association analysis in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs62121377 eQTL for LGALS7 presented a beta of -1.60 and a p-value of 4.47e-13, indicating a significant relationship. Decreased expression of LGALS7 was associated with keratinocyte hyperplasia in psoriasis skin, highlighting its relevance in the disease's pathogenesis.
title: Immunosuppression causes dynamic changes in expression QTLs in psoriatic skin

finding: The eSNP rs601338, associated with FUT2, had a beta of -0.39 and a p-value of 1.42e-19. It ranked as the fourth-most-significant SNP associated with psoriasis risk in a meta-analysis, providing evidence for its genetic involvement in the disease.
title: Immunosuppression causes dynamic changes in expression QTLs in psoriatic skin

finding: The rs12610495:G>A variant in the DPP9 gene was found to protect against severe COVID-19 outcomes with strong odds ratios (OR) of 0.49 for critical illness, 0.64 for hospitalization, and 0.85 for reported infection, associated with increased intron excision in lung tissue.
title: Alternative splicing in the lung influences COVID-19 severity and respiratory diseases

finding: The locus rs76076446 in RAX2 showed a significant finding (P = 1.07 x 10<sup>-13</sup>) associated with PRC thickness and is known for its role in eye development, with pathogenic variants leading to retinal disorders.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also linked to the APOE genotype. Like rs239358, it contributed to the classification of participants as APOE ε2, ε3, or ε4 carriers. This classification is crucial in understanding genetic predispositions to cognitive impairments related to anticholinergic drug use.
title: Anticholinergic burden in middle and older age is associated with reduced cognitive function, but not with brain atrophy

finding: It was established that the rs7412 SNP in the APOE gene was associated with cognitive function, specifically indicating that certain genotypes correlated with different rates of cognitive decline in individuals at extreme old age. The study utilized data from the New England Centenarian Study, which highlighted the significant impact of this SNP on cognitive metrics as measured by the Information-Memory-Concentration portion of the Blessed Dementia Scale.
title: Bayesian Variable Selection Utilizing Posterior Probability Credible Intervals

finding: The analysis revealed that the rs429358 SNP in the APOE gene was also linked to variations in cognitive function among participants of the New England Centenarian Study. This SNP, alongside rs7412, was instrumental in defining the APOE alleles, which were evaluated for their association with the rate of cognitive decline in elderly subjects.
title: Bayesian Variable Selection Utilizing Posterior Probability Credible Intervals

finding: The rs8179181 variant of the TGFB1 gene was identified as being associated with Parkinson's disease (PD) in a Spanish Caucasian population. This association was observed in both discovery and replication phases of the study, with a documented odds ratio of 0.48 and a strong statistical significance (p = 0.00057). The variant was deemed a novel susceptibility locus for PD, indicating that individuals with this variant may have a reduced risk of developing the disease.
title: TGFB1 rs8179181 polymorphism is reproducibly associated with Parkinson’s disease in a Spanish population

finding: This SNP's missense variant was connected to PLAUR, part of the plasminogen-activating system, highlighting its role in regulating inflammation.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs7412 was crucial for determining the APOE genotypes in each participant. This SNP, along with rs429358, provided significant insights into the role of the APOE gene in Alzheimer's disease, particularly in the classification of participants during the polygenic risk score analysis.
title: Polygenic effects on the risk of Alzheimer’s disease in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs429358 was used alongside rs7412 to ascertain the APOE genotypes among participants. This allowed for a deeper understanding of genetic risk factors for Alzheimer's disease, confirming its pivotal contribution to the analysis of Alzheimer's disease in the population studied.
title: Polygenic effects on the risk of Alzheimer’s disease in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs1160985 was identified as a top-hit SNP related to Alzheimer's disease, although the region around it was removed from the analysis for accuracy. Its initial association indicated potential relevance in AD susceptibility, supporting the polygenic risk score calculations in this cohort.
title: Polygenic effects on the risk of Alzheimer’s disease in the Japanese population

finding: rs12610495 was associated with decreased expression of DPP9 in IPF lungs and was linked to an increased risk of both critically ill COVID-19 and IPF. Furthermore, it indicated strong colocalization with the disease GWAS signals, signifying its role as a causal variant for DPP9, particularly under conditions specific to IPF.
title: Context-specific eQTLs reveal causal genes underlying shared genetic architecture of critically ill COVID-19 and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: This SNP was found to colocalize with DPP9 expression in fibroblasts, indicating its role as a potential causal variant influencing gene expression specifically in the context of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.
title: Context-specific eQTLs reveal causal genes underlying shared genetic architecture of critically ill COVID-19 and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: This SNP exhibited a strong association with DPP9 expression in IPF cases and demonstrated robust evidence of colocalization with GWAS signals, reinforcing its role as a causal variant.
title: Context-specific eQTLs reveal causal genes underlying shared genetic architecture of critically ill COVID-19 and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The SNP rs255774 was identified as a novel variant associated with Crohn's disease (CD) within the leukocyte immunoglobulin-like receptor (LILR) gene cluster. The variant's odds ratio was 1.32 (95% CI = 1.22 to 1.42). It exhibited strong evidence of being a splicing QTL (sQTL), which affected the intron splicing of the LILRB2 gene, leading to the exclusion of immunoreceptor tyrosine-based inhibitory motifs (ITIMs) that interact with MHC class I molecules, potentially enhancing immune response related to CD.
title: Regulatory Variants on the Leukocyte Immunoglobulin-Like Receptor Gene Cluster are Associated with Crohn’s Disease and Interact with Regulatory Variants for TAP2

finding: The analysis of the rs7412 SNP within the context of APOE haplotypes revealed that individuals carrying the ε4 haplotype exhibited an increased risk of dementia. This was particularly highlighted by the interaction between higher mCAIDE scores and the APOE ε4 risk effect.
title: Dementia Risk Scores, APOE, and risk of Alzheimer disease: one size does not fit all

finding: The SNP rs429358, which partially defines the APOE ε4 genotype, was found to have a strong association with levels of three cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) modules (M26, M33, and M34). This association remained significant even after adjustments for potential population stratification, indicating a robust link between this SNP and specific proteomic changes related to Alzheimer's disease (AD).
title: Proteomic Network Analysis of Alzheimer’s Disease Cerebrospinal Fluid Reveals Alterations Associated with APOE ε4 Genotype and Atomoxetine Treatment

finding: The SNP rs10417628 was identified as a missense variant located in exon 5 of the AMH gene, contributing to variation in circulating AMH levels in women. It was the strongest signal found in the study, and analyses indicated that this SNP may reflect AMH detection rather than AMH expression.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis identifies three novel loci for circulating anti-Müllerian hormone levels in women

finding: The rs7412 allelic variant at the APOE locus consistently demonstrated higher PAR estimates across all ancestries compared to other genetic loci, confirming its significance as a major genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: The rs429358 allelic variant at the APOE locus had notably high PAR values, particularly in Black/African American and East Asian populations, reinforcing its status as a critical genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: The SNP rs3745683 in ANGPTL8 was significantly associated with reductions in multiple lipid traits in patients with obstructive sleep apnea (OSA). It was found to attenuate ANGPTL8 transcription by inhibiting its binding to the transcription factor YBX1. The variant was correlated with lower serum levels of HDL-C, CHOL, and ApoA, which are important lipid metrics recognized as risk factors for cardiovascular disease.
title: Insulin-AKT1-YBX1 Regulation of ANGPTL8 Promote Lipogenesis in Obstructive Sleep Apnea-Associated Dyslipidemia

finding: This variant was proximal to the SIGLEC9 gene and associated with increased exacerbation frequency and greater emphysema in a small cohort. It indicated an important connection between genetic variation and clinical manifestation in COPD patients.
title: Proteomic Networks and Related Genetic Variants Associated with Smoking and Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as potentially deleterious and was found to be related to pain intensity within the 125 independent loci associated with the phenotype.
title: The genetic architecture of pain intensity in a sample of 598,339 U.S. veterans

finding: The SNP rs872629 was identified in the SIGLEC5 gene located on chromosome 19q13. It was significantly associated with decreased levels of mumps-specific IL-1β secretion (p=1.77E-09). This finding highlights the role of this SNP in mediating immune responses to mumps vaccination.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: The SNP rs1106476 was also found in the SIGLEC5 gene on chromosome 19q13 and was associated with decreased secretion of both IL-1β (p=1.78E-09) and TNFα (p=1.32E-11) in response to the mumps vaccine, indicating its significant role in controlling inflammatory immune responses.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: The SNP rs112456998, found in the SIGLEC5 gene at chromosome 19q13, was associated with variations in mumps-specific IL-1β secretion (p=3.21E-09), underscoring its involvement in immune response mechanisms.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: The SNP rs73050880 was identified in the SIGLEC5 region and was associated with mumps-specific IL-1β secretion (p=3.85E-09), affirming its role in the host immune response to mumps vaccination.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine
