finding: The TT genotype of rs405697 showed a stronger association with the Control (CN) group, indicating a potential protective effect against Alzheimer's Disease.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The TT genotype of rs439401 was more associated with the CN group rather than Alzheimer's groups, implying a protective effect in the context of Alzheimer's risk.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The GG genotype of rs4420638 was seen to associate with increased AV45 uptake and was linked to the Alzheimer's Disease and LMCI groups.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The AA genotype of rs157582 was related to increased AV45 scores and higher ADAS13 scores, indicating an association with Alzheimer's risk.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The GG genotype of rs157580 was associated with protective outcomes and showed a stronger relationship with the Control group.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The TC and TT genotypes of rs7412 exhibited associations with control and potential protective factors against Alzheimer's.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The GG genotype of rs6859 was more linked with the CN group than with the Alzheimer's disease population, indicating possible protective effects.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The rs10418535 SNP was located between MAP1S and FCHO1 within macrophage-specific peaks, disrupting a PU.1/IRF motif predictive of decreased chromatin accessibility.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The R136S variant (Christchurch) indicated by the SNP rs121918393 was shown to enhance a Disease-Associated Microglia (DAM) phenotype in a 5xFAD mouse model of amyloidosis. It reduced plaque load and dystrophic neurites, suggesting a protective role against amyloid pathology. In contrast, in the PS19 mouse model of tauopathy, the same variant suppressed neuroinflammatory responses to tau-laden neurons but did not reduce tau accumulation. Instead, it partially rescued synaptic and myelin loss. These results demonstrated that the R136S variant's protective effects involved modulation of microglial responses depending on the type of neurodegenerative pathology.
title: APOE Christchurch enhances a disease-associated microglial response to plaque but suppresses response to tau pathology

finding: The SNP rs321909 was reported as influencing the expression of <italic>ARID3A</italic> in comparisons with healthy controls while adjusting for East Asian ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs12459238 had an association with the expression of <italic>ARID3A</italic> when comparing TB patients against healthy controls, adjusted for East Asian ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs346066 was tied to Khoe-San ancestry and influenced the expression of a long non-coding RNA <italic>LINC01002</italic>.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs56369375 was identified as affecting <italic>ARID3A</italic> when comparing TB-T2D patients to T2D patients, under Khoe-San ancestry adjustments.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs2571075 was associated with the expression of <italic>ABCA7</italic> when comparing TB-T2D patients with those having T2D while adjusting for East Asian ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The analysis demonstrated a very strong relationship between total gene expression of gene RPS28 and the allele counts for SNP rs2972574. As the number of minor alleles increased, there was a modest relative increase in the usage of exon 3, while the usage of exon 2 decreased, indicating an allele-specific effect on exon usage.
title: Marker-Trait Complete Analysis

finding: The SNP rs12463023, which resulted in the amino acid substitution from serine (S39) to proline (P39), was found to generate a predicted cleavage site for 3C proteases, altering CARD8's function. This reduction in CARD8's sensitization to coronavirus 3CL<sup>pro</sup> led to its enhanced ability to sense 3C proteases from select picornaviruses, indicating that this variant affected CARD8's role in inflammasome activation and response to viral infection.
title: Host specific sensing of coronaviruses and picornaviruses by the CARD8 inflammasome

finding: The SNP rs601338 was positively associated with celiac disease and inflammatory bowel disease in the Finnish population, as reported in the study by Parmar et al. (2012). This finding highlighted the significance of the FUT2 gene in relation to these gastrointestinal disorders.
title: Normal development and fertility of Fut1, Fut2, and Sec1 triple knockout mice

finding: The study associated rs4030945 with the expression of embryonic liver development genes in contexts of hepatitis C-induced cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). This finding indicated a significant link between this SNP and the progression of liver cancer, further emphasizing the role of genetic factors in tumor microenvironments.
title: Modelling liver cancer microenvironment: novel 3D culture system as a potential anti-cancer drug screening tool

finding: The rs117307819 variant, a synonymous variant in the ELAVL1 gene, had a CADD score of 12.75 and was observed in three families: UF16, UF20, and UF10. It was predicted to be possibly damaging based on its TraP score.
title: A Weights-based variant ranking pipeline for familial complex disorders

finding: The variant rs3786897 co-localized with PEPD regulation in adipose tissue, indicating its role in the metabolic discordance where it was associated with increased abdominal obesity while potentially being protective against type 2 diabetes. PEPD depletion was shown to reduce adipogenic potential, therefore linking it to obesity mechanisms.
title: Predicting mechanisms of action at genetic loci associated with discordant effects on type 2 diabetes and abdominal fat accumulation

finding: The pQTL variant rs34536443 linked to TYK2 indicated partial loss of function effects on protein expression, highlighting its role in immune response and related traits.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The FUT2 locus, characterized by the rs601338 deletion variant, was identified as a significant genetic determinant in relation to gastrointestinal conditions, establishing critical gene-by-gene interactions involving protein expression levels.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs429358, located on chromosome 19, was identified as associated with the R2 dimension of brain atrophy in Alzheimer's disease (AD) patients, specifically in those with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) and AD. This association was noted as a well-established genetic risk factor for AD, suggesting that individuals carrying the minor allele 'C' exhibited a correlation with the focal medial temporal lobe atrophy observed in these patients.
title: Genetic, clinical underpinnings of subtle early brain change along Alzheimer’s dimensions

finding: The SNP A54T (rs1133893) was found to have a high minor allele frequency in European (0.2922) and American populations (0.272). It was shown to impart a gain-of-function on the MARCH2 protein regarding its antiviral effect against HIV-1, as MARCH2 carrying this variant exhibited significantly lower levels of HIV-1 envelope glycoproteins in nascent virions and reduced infectivity of HIV-1 particles compared to wildtype MARCH2.
title: Determining the antiviral mechanism of MARCH2

finding: The SNP R219P (rs34099346) was identified with a higher minor allele frequency in South Asian populations (0.174). This variant was also associated with a gain-of-function effect on MARCH2 in terms of its ability to enhance antiviral activity against HIV-1, leading to lower gp120 and gp41 levels in virions and decreased infectivity of HIV-1 when compared to the wildtype MARCH2.
title: Determining the antiviral mechanism of MARCH2

finding: The analysis highlighted that the SNP rs1490425955 represented an orthologous variant (OrthoVar) where both human AP1M1 and C. elegans UNC-101 exhibited an identical amino acid substitution at conserved positions (p.P375S in humans and p.P362S in C. elegans). This finding emphasized the conservation of the genetic change across species and indicated that understanding such variations could be relevant for evaluating human mutations related to disease.
title: ConVarT: a search tool for orthologous variants: A method and server for functional inference of human genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs429358 was part of the well-known haplotypes defining the isoforms of Apo E, which are associated with Alzheimer's Disease and cholesterol phenotypes. It was reported that the protein traits discovered in the study were driven by the rs429358 allele. Additionally, it was indicated that differential abundance associated with this SNP was responsible for the associations found with Apo E protein levels.
title: Protein prediction for trait mapping in diverse populations

finding: Similar to rs429358, SNP rs7412 defined the isoforms of Apo E and was also linked to known associations with Alzheimer's Disease and cholesterol levels. The study revealed that the protein abundance mechanisms associated with rs7412 were crucial for understanding the relationships between Apo E protein levels and these complex traits.
title: Protein prediction for trait mapping in diverse populations

finding: The common missense variant rs72973581 exhibited a MAF of around 0.6 and was linked to a reduced odds ratio (OR) of 0.57 (confidence interval 0.41-0.80) for Alzheimer's disease (AD), indicating a possible protective effect. However, this variant may also interact with other risk factors, including ABCA7, contributing to the complex pathogenesis of AD and influencing lipid metabolism disruptions noted in the study.
title: A single-cell atlas of ABCA7 loss-of-function reveals lipid disruptions, mitochondrial dysfunction and DNA damage in neurons

finding: The SNP rs8736 in the MBOAT7 gene was previously reported to be associated with human blood metabolites and alcohol-related cirrhosis of the liver, indicating its role in lipid metabolism and potential disease associations.
title: MetaPhat: Detecting and decomposing multivariate associations from univariate genome-wide association statistics

finding: The missense variant rs7412 in the APOE gene was identified with a strong association to multivariate lipidomics, particularly highlighted by a P-value of 4.2e-13, while it was not detected in any of the univariate analyses.
title: MetaPhat: Detecting and decomposing multivariate associations from univariate genome-wide association statistics

finding: The study identified rs7412, known as the Apolipoprotein E (APOE) ε2 allele, as a high posterior inclusion probability (PIP) SNP associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD). BEATRICE successfully detected this variant, highlighting its significance as a common risk factor for AD.
title: BEATRICE: Bayesian Fine-mapping from Summary Data using Deep Variational Inference

finding: The SNP rs11670056 was found in enhancer regions related to the ELL gene in PDGF-treated CASMC. It was one of the examples highlighted as being associated with cardiovascular disorders, showing evidence of significant enhancer activity in the context of cardiac remodeling and pathologies.
title: Epigenetic Remodeling in Human Coronary Artery Smooth Muscle Cell Phenotypic Switching

finding: Similar to rs423958, the rs7412 SNP was linked to the APOE epsilon 4 genotype, where carriers exhibited significantly lower WM integrity measures and higher volumes of white matter hyperintensities. These findings suggested an association with increased AD risk and possible age-related decline in brain health.
title: A comprehensive analysis of APOE genotype effects on human brain structure in the UK Biobank

finding: SNP rs8012 was a significant met-QTL for glutarylcarnitine levels, with a p-value of 1.24×10−43. This SNP mapped 8kb from the GCDH gene, which encodes the enzyme glutaryl-CoA dehydrogenase, essential for converting glutaryl-CoA to crotonyl-CoA. The expression analysis indicated that rs8012 acted as a cis-eQTL for GCDH in 31 tissues, with colocalization of the met-QTL and eQTL signals in at least one tissue for GCDH and several other nearby genes such as HOOK2, SYCE2, FARSA, AD000092.3, and CALR. The findings emphasized GCDH as a highly plausible effector gene mediating the effects of rs8012 on glutarylcarnitine levels.
title: A multi-tissue transcriptome analysis of human metabolites guides the interpretability of associations based on multi-SNP models for gene expression

finding: The polymorphism rs11666254 in the promoter region of FPR2 was significantly associated with an increased risk of sepsis in trauma patients. The study indicated that this promoter polymorphism led to a downregulation of FPR2/ALX expression, thereby suggesting a connection between reduced receptor expression and heightened inflammatory responses, evidenced by elevated TNF-α levels in peripheral blood leukocytes when stimulated by LPS.
title: Novel regulator Fpr2 controls immune homeostasis via CCL4-dependent neutrophils

finding: The SNP rs7255066 was the sole independent SNP in the two-sample Mendelian randomisation analysis, showing evidence of a causal association between plasma PVR levels and Alzheimer's disease, making it a significant and positive finding in the context of this study.
title: Genetic and epigenetic architectures of neurological protein biomarkers in the Lothian Birth Cohort 1936

finding: The rs2278426 variant (R59W) in ANGPTL8 was associated with increased levels of circulatory TNFα and IL7. This association was supported by findings in both discovery (867 Arab individuals) and replication cohorts (278 Arab individuals), wherein significant differences in TNFα and IL7 levels were observed. Additionally, the variant was linked to lipid metabolism issues, such as reductions in HDL and associations with various metabolic disorders.
title: ANGPTL8 R59W variant influences inflammation through modulating NF-κB pathway under TNFα stimulation

finding: The SNP rs641738 was identified as a variant associated with an increased risk of Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD) in individuals of European descent. This finding highlighted the potential role of MBOAT7-TMC4 in modulating lipid metabolism and its relevance to diseases characterized by triglyceride accumulation in the liver.
title: Dual targeting of hepatocyte DGAT2 and stellate cell FASN alleviates nonalcoholic steatohepatitis in mice

finding: The rs273688 variant was identified as a missense variant leading to decreased SIGLEC9 protein expression in plasma. This variant was more common in African populations and is hypothesized to be a response to pathogen burden, highlighting its potential impact on immune response and therapeutic applications.
title: A survey of proteomic variation across two ethnic groups in Nigeria and its relationship to obesity risk

finding: The variant rs2455069 was associated with CD33 protein expression levels. Despite its lack of significant p-value in the ARiC data, it was strongly associated in this study, validating its relevance in immune signaling and potential implications for CD33-targeting therapies.
title: A survey of proteomic variation across two ethnic groups in Nigeria and its relationship to obesity risk

finding: The SNP rs10424191 on chromosome 19, positioned within the gene ZNF536, was found to be significant for the postcentral gyrus.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: This SNP was linked to creatinine levels, illustrating its role in metabolism.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: Found in high LD with rs2303759 related to multiple sclerosis, rs10411630 disrupted EGR1 binding motif, supporting its role as an rSNP.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: This missense variant was associated with the metabolite lactosylceramide lactosyl-N-nervonoyl-sphingosine (d18:1/24:1), revealing a connection to late-onset Alzheimer's disease through shared genetic architecture.
title: Genome-microbiome interplay provides insight into the determinants of the human blood metabolome

finding: This SNP was located near the CNN2 gene and was also associated with the metabolite lactosylceramide lactosyl-N-nervonoyl-sphingosine (d18:1/24:1), revealing a novel metabolic quantitative trait locus.
title: Genome-microbiome interplay provides insight into the determinants of the human blood metabolome

finding: The rs12459419 SNP was linked to increased production of the long CD33 protein isoform (CD33M), associated with heightened AD susceptibility. This SNP modulated mRNA splicing, favoring CD33M and resulting in increased Aβ levels and less plaque compaction in the context of aggressive amyloid deposition.
title: Alzheimer’s disease associated isoforms of human CD33 distinctively modulate microglial cell responses in 5XFAD mice

finding: The study identified significant differences in DNA methylation associated with the APOE ε4 allele defined by the rs429358 SNP. Specifically, there was hypomethylation observed at 13 out of 20 differentially methylated positions (DMPs), with the most significant DMP, cg16471933, located 139 base pairs upstream of rs429358. Methylation levels were higher in ε4 carriers, highlighting a potential mechanism linked to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Identification of epigenome-wide DNA methylation differences between carriers of APOE ε4 and APOE ε2

finding: The rs7412 SNP, part of the APOE ε2/ε3/ε4 haplotypes, was found to influence DNA methylation patterns in ε4 carriers. Notably, it was associated with multiple meQTLs affecting nine CpGs, contributing to the hypomethylation observed in the APOE locus and surrounding genes, thereby implicating its role in the regulation of lipid metabolism and Alzheimer’s disease risk.
title: Identification of epigenome-wide DNA methylation differences between carriers of APOE ε4 and APOE ε2

finding: The SNP rs7412 was confirmed to be significantly associated with Lp(a) concentration (β=0.15; p=0.008) in the LipidCardio cohort, replicating previous findings from a large GWAS. The study reported no association between rs429358 and Lp(a) levels.
title: Cohort profile: The LipidCardio Study - Role of Lipoproteins in Cardiovascular Disease

finding: The SNP rs6510896 was associated with the long noncoding RNA CTB-180A7. This lncRNA showed enhancer-like activity related to gene ALKBH7, and was found in a region that exhibited significant deletions in ASD cases compared to controls, indicating its potential relevance in neurodevelopmental disorders such as ASD.
title: Evidence for enhancer noncoding RNAs (enhancer-ncRNAs) with gene regulatory functions relevant to neurodevelopmental disorders

finding: The SNP rs372349612 was identified as changing the amino acid from Phenylalanine (F) to Leucine (L) at position 783 of the RFX1 protein, although this change was noted to occur on rare occasions (less than 0.001%). This finding implied a potential influence on the interaction with PP1c, as prior peptide display screens indicated that leucine could be tolerated at this position, which supports the significance of the interaction between RFX1 and the PP1c protein phosphatase. This SNP relates to the broader understanding of how RFX1 may regulate target genes through its interaction with PP1c.
title: Recruitment of the protein phosphatase-1 catalytic subunit to promoters by the dual-function transcription factor RFX1

finding: The rs4806787 SNP was identified as a SARS-CoV-2-specific reQTL in plasmacytoid dendritic cells (pDCs), influencing their immune response dynamics. This SNP was recognized for its significant role in modulating susceptibility to viral infections.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: This SNP demonstrated chromatin contacts with the gene NECTIN2, contributing to Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Similar to rs411920, this SNP also demonstrated chromatin contacts with NECTIN2.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was associated with chromatin contacts with NECTIN2, which plays a role in Alzheimer's susceptibility.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Associated with NECTIN2, this SNP exhibits chromatin interaction relevant for Alzheimer’s disease.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Another SNP that demonstrated interaction with NECTIN2, reinforcing its connection to Alzheimer’s risk.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs2739412 was identified as a population-biased splicing QTL (pb-sQTL) for the KLK5 gene in skin. It influenced the relative abundances of the three main alternative splicing isoforms of KLK5 in European American (EA) individuals, where the C allele was associated with an increase in the isoform KLK5-203. In contrast, African American (AA) individuals did not show this effect. This finding highlighted the significance of the SNP in affecting splicing depending on ancestry.
title: A fast non-parametric test of association for multiple traits

finding: The SNV rs1339188502 was identified as a missense A to G mutation that significantly altered the predicted editing outcomes on the CD33 gene. Specifically, it was associated with a 45.8% decrease in the predicted 1 bp insertion probability and resulted in a 30.2% decrease in 1 bp frameshift frequency, alongside a 22.5% increase in 2 bp frameshift frequency. This showed that it had the highest predicted 'Max Variant Effect' on the targeting gRNA used in CAR-T cell therapy.
title: Widespread impact of natural genetic variations in CRISPR/Cas9 outcomes

finding: The SNP rs7412 was linked to the APOE2 genotype, which is known to confer a protective effect against Alzheimer's disease (AD). The study demonstrated that individuals with the homozygous APOE2 carriers had differences in brain structure compared to homozygous APOE4 carriers, suggesting that the protective effects of the APOE2 genotype were associated with variations in cognitive functions and brain asymmetry patterns.
title: Global brain asymmetry and its variations in aging and related diseases

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the APOE4 genotype, established as a significant genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease. The investigation revealed that individuals carrying the homozygous APOE4 genotype experienced substantial differences in brain structure related to aging and cognitive decline, particularly when contrasted with those carrying the homozygous APOE2 genotype. These findings emphasized the role of the APOE4 genotype in promoting structural asymmetries in the context of brain aging and related disorders.
title: Global brain asymmetry and its variations in aging and related diseases

finding: The rs8110787 SNP was associated with several red blood cell (RBC) traits, including hematocrit (HCT), mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH), mean corpuscular volume (MCV), and red blood cell counts (RBC). It was linked to the gene CALR through VAMPIRE annotations, which categorized it as a significant variant (category 1). Functional validation experiments confirmed that a regulatory element (CRE chr19:12,996,905-12,998,745) controlled CALR (adjusted p-value of 1.9E-7), showing that rs8110787 significantly interacted with the CALR promoter (p < 1E-120). Furthermore, it served as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for CALR in CAGE and BIOS datasets, with p-values of 9.4E-16 and 1.0E-25, respectively.
title: From GWAS Variant to Function: a Study of ~148,000 Variants for Blood Cell Traits

finding: The SNP rs429358, located in the APOE gene, was identified as a major genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease (AD). Its significance was highlighted in both the pcMTSCCA and hocMTSCCA methods as part of the top ten genetic loci that increased AD risk.
title: inMTSCCA: An Integrated Multi-task Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis for Multi-omics Brain Imaging Genetics

finding: The SNP rs56131196, associated with the APOC1 gene, was also found to have a significant connection to Alzheimer's disease risk. It was part of the multiple relevant AD-risk loci identified through the pcMTSCCA and hocMTSCCA methods.
title: inMTSCCA: An Integrated Multi-task Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis for Multi-omics Brain Imaging Genetics

finding: Similarly, rs4420638, another SNP in the APOC1 gene, was determined to be significant for Alzheimer's disease risk. It was associated with other identified loci in the pcMTSCCA and hocMTSCCA methodologies.
title: inMTSCCA: An Integrated Multi-task Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis for Multi-omics Brain Imaging Genetics

finding: The SNP rs7412, which is another variant in the APOE gene, was recognized as a genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease through both multivariate methods. Notably, its significance was not captured by other comparison methods which did not consider pairwise endophenotype associations.
title: inMTSCCA: An Integrated Multi-task Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis for Multi-omics Brain Imaging Genetics

finding: The SNP rs440446, also located in the APOE gene, was identified as one of the AD-risk loci in the analysis conducted using pcMTSCCA and hocMTSCCA. This SNP contributed to the growing consensus on the genetic influences of the APOE region on Alzheimer's disease.
title: inMTSCCA: An Integrated Multi-task Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis for Multi-omics Brain Imaging Genetics

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with higher triglyceride levels and hyperlipidemia while showing no direct associations with OSA diagnosis.
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The study by Liu et al. (2014) indicated that the SNP rs58542926, located in the TM6SF2 gene, was associated with the progression of hepatic fibrosis in patients suffering from non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). This finding highlighted the impact of genetic variations on liver-related pathology, specifically within the context of metabolic dysfunction and liver disease progression.
title: Mitochondrial topoisomerase I (Top1MT) prevents the onset of metabolic dysfunction-associated steatohepatitis (MASH) in mice

finding: The study reported on the successful CRISPR/Cas9 editing at the rs429358 locus in human embryonic stem cells with an APOE33 genotype, creating isogenic APOE34 and APOE44 lines. This editing resulted in a thymine to cytosine change, leading to a corresponding Cys112Arg substitution in the APOE protein product. This finding was pivotal in examining the phenotypic consequences of the APOE44 genotype, particularly in relation to the inflammatory responses and cellular dysfunction noted in astrocytes, which are relevant to the pathogenesis of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Upregulated NF-κB pathway proteins may underlie APOE44 associated astrocyte phenotypes in sporadic Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs41290120 was identified as a significant finding associated with sdLDL-c in the NECTIN2 region. The p-value for this variant was reported to be 8.47 x 10^-9, indicating a strong association. This was part of a larger analysis using the SCANG method on WGS data from the ARIC study, and this SNP was categorized as a protein quantitative trait locus (pQTL) for apolipoprotein E.
title: Dynamic Scan Procedure for Detecting Rare-Variant Association Regions in Whole Genome Sequencing Studies

finding: The SNP rs283808 also emerged as a significant association with sdLDL-c, showing a p-value of 5.71 x 10^-7. This SNP was included in the 4,637 bp region identified by the SCANG method in the NECTIN2 gene, which contained a total of 60 variants associated with sdLDL-c in the ARIC study.
title: Dynamic Scan Procedure for Detecting Rare-Variant Association Regions in Whole Genome Sequencing Studies

finding: The missense variant rs149307620 in NOTCH3 showed a notable association with LOAD, where it was present in 10 cases but absent in controls.
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for a role for PSEN1 and suggests involvement of the PI3K/Akt/GSK-3β and WNT signalling pathways

finding: For the SNP rs7258891, evidence of mediation was found relating to age iQTLs via neutrophil proportions. This SNP influenced DNA methylation (meQTL) for a specific CpG site and exhibited associations with various cell count phenotypes, indicating that the effect of age on the meQTL was likely mediated by changes in cell type composition.
title: Interaction molecular QTL mapping discovers cellular and environmental modifiers of genetic regulatory effects

finding: The SNP rs113631324 was identified within the POU2F2 promoter EPIN linked to the gene PHGDH, showing a low p-value of 3.80e-8 for prostate cancer association.
title: The PENGUIN approach to reconstruct protein interactions at enhancer-promoter regions and its application to prostate cancer

finding: The rs4420638 polymorphism on APOC1 was found to increase the accumulation of homocysteine, thereby affecting the risk of Alzheimer's Disease (AD). This finding highlighted the involvement of APOC1 in cholesterol metabolism that relates to AD pathology.
title: A Penalized Linear Mixed Model with Generalized Method of Moments for Complex Phenotype Prediction

finding: The rs2075650 polymorphism on TOMM40 was identified as highly associated with late-onset Alzheimer's Disease. It was also suggested that this SNP could influence oxidative damage, thereby affecting the onset and progression of AD.
title: A Penalized Linear Mixed Model with Generalized Method of Moments for Complex Phenotype Prediction

finding: This tag SNP was part of the polygenic risk score model, and it was highlighted due to its association with adenoma count which is crucial for colorectal cancer risk assessment.
title: Ability of known colorectal cancer susceptibility SNPs to predict colorectal cancer risk: A cohort study within the UK Biobank

finding: The rs2304130 variant, located in the second intron of ZNF101, was significantly associated with reduced plasma cholesterol, LDL-C, apoB, and triglyceride levels, highlighting the potential influence of ZNF101 on lipid and lipoprotein metabolism.
title: MicroRNA-541-3p alters lipoproteins to reduce atherosclerosis by degrading Znf101 and Casz1 transcription factors

finding: The rs2304256 polymorphism in the TYK2 gene was found to be associated with protection against type 1 diabetes (T1D). This finding suggested that individuals with this specific SNP may have a reduced risk of developing T1D, highlighting the role of TYK2 in autoimmune conditions.
title: Pharmacological inhibition of tyrosine protein-kinase 2 reduces islet inflammation and delays type 1 diabetes onset in mice

finding: The C-allele at rs117558072 was found to significantly reduce muscle CERS1 expression in human skeletal muscle. This reduction correlated with poorer overall health rating and decreased grip strength, indicating a detrimental impact on muscle function related to age.
title: Inhibition of CERS1 in skeletal muscle exacerbates age-related muscle dysfunction

finding: The G-allele at rs1122821 was also associated with a significant decrease in muscle CERS1 expression, leading to impairments in overall health and reduced grip strength. The findings highlighted a relationship between decreased CERS1 expression and age-related muscle function deterioration.
title: Inhibition of CERS1 in skeletal muscle exacerbates age-related muscle dysfunction

finding: In contrast, the T-allele at rs71332140 was found to increase CERS1 expression in human skeletal muscle. However, the primary findings focused on the expression-reducing alleles at rs117558072 and rs1122821, which were linked to negative health outcomes.
title: Inhibition of CERS1 in skeletal muscle exacerbates age-related muscle dysfunction

finding: Associated with reduced PPP5C expression, this emVar was linked to lower IBD risk, indicating its involvement in T cell signaling and metabolic regulation.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: This variant, when targeted, was shown to have an allelic skew affecting PPP5C, suggesting its role in modulating T cell activation and potentially impacting autoimmune disease.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: The SNP rs138137383 was located in the enhancer EH2, which was involved in the interaction with the APOE promoter through a specific loop structure in astrocyte cells. The presence of this SNP correlated with Alzheimer's Disease (AD), as it was part of the enhancer's association with cellular identity and function during the analysis of topologically associating domains (TADs). The results suggested a plausible link between the hierarchical structure of TLD boundaries associated with this SNP and the mechanisms underlying AD, indicating a need for further investigation to confirm these associations.
title: DeDoc2 identifies and characterizes the hierarchy and dynamics of chromatin TAD-like domains in the single cells

finding: The analysis referencing TM6SF2 rs58542926 indicated its influence on hepatic fibrosis progression, particularly in patients suffering from non-alcoholic fatty liver disease. This finding was contextualized within the metabolic disease framework, where alterations in DNA methylation at the TM6SF2 locus were observed in MetD patients versus healthy controls, contributing to the understanding of metabolic diseases' mechanisms and their association with cancer risk.
title: G-quadruplex formation in GCK and TM6SF2 are targets for differential DNA methylation in metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease and type II diabetes mellitus patients

finding: The rs641738C>T allele of MBOAT7 was reported to be associated with fibrosis in several liver diseases. It was specifically shown that loss of MBOAT7 leads to liver fibrosis, although the underlying mechanism remained incompletely understood. Given that MBOAT7 had the highest expression in hepatic stellate cells (hHSCs), which play a critical role in fibrogenesis, this finding suggested new directions for elucidating the mechanisms of liver fibrosis.
title: Dynamic human liver proteome atlas reveals functional insights into disease pathways

finding: The rs7412 SNP, which defines the APOE e2 allele, showed significant associations with lower levels of LDL cholesterol in the blood among homozygotes compared to other genotypes, highlighting its role in lipid metabolism and potential protective mechanisms against Alzheimer's disease (AD).
title: Manifestations of genetic risk for Alzheimer’s Disease in the blood: a cross-sectional multi-omic analysis in healthy adults aged 18-90+

finding: The rs429358 SNP, encoding the APOE e4 allele, was associated with elevated levels of several inflammation-related proteins, including PLA2G7 and CD28, and multiple lipids, indicating its influence on lipid metabolism and inflammation, which are critical components in Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Manifestations of genetic risk for Alzheimer’s Disease in the blood: a cross-sectional multi-omic analysis in healthy adults aged 18-90+

finding: The rs3752246 SNP in ABCA7 was associated with lower levels of lactosylceramide metabolites and higher levels of DEFA1, linking it to lipid homeostasis and an inflammatory response pathway in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Manifestations of genetic risk for Alzheimer’s Disease in the blood: a cross-sectional multi-omic analysis in healthy adults aged 18-90+

finding: The study found that the non-CC genotype of the IFNL4 SNP rs12979860 was significantly associated with an increase in treatment failure rate among patients treated for chronic hepatitis C. Logistic regression analysis showed a strong association between this genotype and the treatment outcome, with a p-value of 6.4×10−3. Non-cirrhotic patients had a lower failure rate (13%) compared to cirrhotic patients (29%). This association indicated that the IFNL4 genetic variant influenced the response to therapy, underscoring the importance of host genetic factors in treatment outcomes for chronic HCV infection.
title: Viral genome wide association study identifies novel hepatitis C virus polymorphisms associated with sofosbuvir treatment failure

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as the strongest lead SNP associated with GIP1, demonstrating a highly significant association (P = 2×10−40) with longevity traits. It was located near the APOE gene, which has been previously validated for its role in self-rated health and resilience.
title: Genetically independent phenotype analysis identifies LPA and VCAM1 as drug targets for human ageing

finding: The RNA editing QTL (rs769450) located in the APOE gene showed significantly negative associations with two RNA editing events in TOMM40. It was discovered that these editing events had abnormally higher editing frequencies in Alzheimer's Disease (AD) compared to controls. The down-regulation function of this QTL on editing events in TOMM40 suggested its alleviation role in neurodegeneration.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: The study found that the rs12608932(C) allele within the UNC13A gene had a significant negative impact on predicted survival in patients with ALS, when analyzed using a Cox regression model. Specifically, the coefficient was +0.05 with a p-value of 0.02, indicating that those with the rs12608932(C) allele were predicted to have poorer survival outcomes. This result underscores the potential use of predicted survival in genetic discovery related to ALS, especially in cases where actual survival data is lacking.
title: predicTTE: An accessible and optimal tool for time-to-event prediction in neurological diseases

finding: The E167K variant, resulting from the rs58542926 SNP in the TM6SF2 gene, was associated with increased hepatic lipid content and identified as a strong genetic risk factor for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) as well as for fibrosis and cirrhosis. This finding highlighted the importance of the E167K variant in NAFLD pathogenesis, connecting it to both lipid metabolism and liver health outcomes.
title: Perturbation of transmembrane 6 superfamily member 2 expression alters lipid metabolism in a human liver cell line

finding: rs12460041 was classified as a Tier 2 anc-eQTL linked to the gene TRAPPC6A, confirmed by fine-mapping using PESCA with a posterior probability (PP) greater than 0.80 in the AFR_high group. It was found to be specific to populations with high African ancestry, showing no overlap with the AFR_low ancestry group.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: This SNP was identified as a lead eQTL for TRAPPC6A in AFR_low populations while demonstrating low linkage disequilibrium with rs12460041 in AFR_high populations, signifying distinct genetic architecture relating to ancestry.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as a significant risk factor for late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (AD), as it is one of the two SNPs defining the APOE ε4 variant. This SNP exhibited a negative correlation of -0.25, marking it as the leading SNP among the 9312 analyzed. The C/C allele associates with an increased risk of AD, and its normalization in the context of CALF indicated a direct relationship with age of onset.
title: Frisky CALF sometimes outruns LASSO

finding: The rs601338 SNP in the FUT2 gene was linked to secretor status, which was considered in the analysis of maternal and infant factors affecting gut microbiota composition. The implications of this finding were significant, as secretor status could influence the infant's microbiome and, consequently, body mass index (BMI) over the first year of life.
title: Consumption of artificially sweetened beverages during pregnancy impacts infant gut microbiota and body mass index

finding: The SNP rs2288904-A in the SLC44A2 gene was identified to have a minor allele frequency of 0.22 and was found to be protective against venous thromboembolism (VTE). It caused an R154Q substitution resulting in significantly impaired binding of neutrophils to activated platelet integrin αIIbβ3, thereby elucidating a mechanism behind its protective effect. Notably, individuals homozygous for rs2288904-A exhibited approximately 75% reduced interaction with VWF-primed platelets compared to the common allele homozygous group, providing functional evidence of this SNP's role in modulating platelet-neutrophil interactions.
title: Activated αIIbβ3 on platelets mediates flow-dependent NETosis via SLC44A2

finding: SNP rs1054972 was part of a CC-GWAS-specific locus defining differences between SCZ and bipolar disorder (BIP). It is located on chromosome 19 and lies within an exon of the KLF16 gene. Although the SNP exhibited an effect on SCZ in the case-control analyses, it did not reach significance since it was yet to be validated in those studies. KLF16 is linked to transcription factor activities and potentially impacts schizophrenia-related pathomechanisms.
title: Identifying loci with different allele frequencies among cases of eight psychiatric disorders using CC-GWAS

finding: The analysis of the imputed genotype for rs142572000 using the TOPMed reference panel indicated a higher imputed genotype certainty, marked by dosages closer to 0, 1, or 2. This higher certainty led to an overestimation of the Rsq value, which correlated with an increased MARE (Mean Absolute Relative Error) and an overall disagreement with the true genotype indicated by a lower dosage r2 value. Specifically, MARE for rs142572000 was recorded as 0.473, while the estimated beta for imputed dosage (beta_imp) was 0.336, showcasing discrepancies in imputation accuracy despite a high Rsq.
title: Genotype imputation accuracy and the quality metrics of the minor ancestry in multi-ancestry reference panels

finding: The findings for rs10410162 revealed that as the template switching rate (theta) decreased, there was a corresponding increase in both Rsq and MARE values, further indicating a rise in the certainty of the imputed alleles. This SNP exhibited a strong deviation where Rsq was found to be greater than Empirical Rsq (EmpRsq) at low theta values, while the relationship displayed an insensitivity of EmpRsq to changes in theta, particularly reflecting how EmpRsq stabilizes despite varying imputation quality metrics.
title: Genotype imputation accuracy and the quality metrics of the minor ancestry in multi-ancestry reference panels

finding: The SNP rs429358 in the 19q13.32 region was implicated in amplitude traits of intrinsic brain activity, suggesting its relevance to neurological functions.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic functional architecture of human brain

finding: This Finnish-enriched rare missense variant in the GP6 locus was suggested causal for benign neoplasms of meninges, demonstrating a risk-increasing association.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: The variant rs2228367 was identified as the second lead variant in factor F4, which was one of the platelet factors derived from the GLEANR analysis. It was a replicated GWAS hit associated with three platelet-related phenotypes: mean platelet volume (MPV), platelet count (PLT), and platelet distribution width (PDW). Additionally, it was recognized as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) in whole blood across multiple studies, specifically for the gene tropomyosin 4, an actin-binding protein that has significant implications in platelet diseases.
title: Sparse matrix factorization of GWAS summary statistics robust to sample sharing improves detection and interpretation of factors with diverse genetic architectures

finding: The SNP rs7412 was associated with the ApoE epsilon 2 allele of the APOE gene, which related to the stability of APOE isoforms and served as a risk factor for coronary heart disease.
title: Proteome-Wide Association Studies for Blood Lipids and Comparison with Transcriptome-Wide Association Studies

finding: The SNP rs4420638 had a significant association with elevated levels of total cholesterol (TC), triglycerides (TG), and high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL), indicating its role in lipid metabolism.
title: Proteome-Wide Association Studies for Blood Lipids and Comparison with Transcriptome-Wide Association Studies

finding: The SNP rs410852 was identified as an eQTL for LILRA3, specifically affecting classical and non-classical monocytes, but not other immune cell types.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs2098952 was associated with LILRB4 expression and correlated with poor prognosis in rectum adenocarcinoma.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs887391 showed similar allele-specific transcriptional activity in both PC-3 and LNCaP cells, where the risk allele exhibited significantly higher transcriptional activity than the normal allele in LNCaP cells.
title: A dinucleotide tag-based parallel reporter gene assay method

finding: The SNP rs1160558441 was analyzed in the context of the 5' UTR of the ETHE1 gene, where it was found to create an out-of-frame (OOF) upstream start codon (uAUG) within an in-frame (IF) upstream open reading frame (uORF). Despite being predicted to be functionally silent by the Optimus 5-Prime model, the mutation had implications on translation repression, as both OOF and IF elements are sufficient for this effect. The Scrambler model, when trained with a low entropy penalty, detected both interpretations of the variant's impact, highlighting the complexity of variant effects in 5' UTR regions.
title: Interpreting Neural Networks for Biological Sequences by Learning Stochastic Masks

finding: The rs641738 SNP was associated with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease in overweight or obese children, highlighting its potential role in metabolic processes that could impact cardiovascular health.
title: Identification of biomarkers, pathways and potential therapeutic targets for heart failure using bioinformatics analysis

finding: This SNP was connected to susceptibility to atrial fibrillation, a condition that can lead to heart failure, showcasing its relevance in cardiac rhythm and health.
title: Identification of biomarkers, pathways and potential therapeutic targets for heart failure using bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs516246 was identified as a significant trans-pQTL for E-cadherin across both the SPIROMICS and COPDGene cohorts. It showed a peak association with a p-value of 8.95x10^-16 in SPIROMICS and 1.21x10^-16 in COPDGene, indicating its strong correlation with serum E-cadherin levels. Furthermore, the analysis revealed that rs516246 is a significant eQTL for FUT2 transcript levels in lung tissue, with heterozygous individuals exhibiting decreased FUT2 mRNA transcript levels.
title: Decreased fucosylation impacts epithelial integrity and increases risk for COPD

finding: The SNP rs601338 was found to be in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs516246 and has been previously reported to result in no expression of fucosyltransferase-2. This association highlights its significance as a contributing factor to the observed decreased levels of FUT2 protein in patients, which correlates with impaired E-cadherin functions in the context of COPD.
title: Decreased fucosylation impacts epithelial integrity and increases risk for COPD

finding: The SNP rs8105767 on chromosome 19 showed strong evidence of co-localization with an eQTL affecting the expression of the gene ZNF257 in eight tissue types, including skin (sun exposed), transverse colon, and stomach. This indicated that TL-associated loci, such as this SNP, influence telomere length via regulation of genes involved in telomere maintenance.
title: Determinants of telomere length across human tissues

finding: As a well-established variant associated with increased Alzheimer's disease risk, rs429358 (APOE ε4) was confirmed to significantly decrease the age of onset for Alzheimer's disease in populations studied.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7412 was associated with the APOE e4 genotype. The study indicated that the presence of the e4 allele, which involves rs7412, influenced the relationship between estrogen exposure and brain aging, particularly showing less evident brain aging in carriers who began hormone replacement therapy before menopause.
title: Cumulative estrogen exposure, APOE genotype, and women’s brain aging - a population-based neuroimaging study

finding: The SNP rs429358 was also linked to the APOE e4 genotype. Similar to rs7412, this SNP was relevant as the study found that higher endogenous and exogenous estrogen exposure had differential effects on brain aging in women with the e4 allele, further emphasizing the importance of considering APOE e4 status when examining hormone therapy outcomes.
title: Cumulative estrogen exposure, APOE genotype, and women’s brain aging - a population-based neuroimaging study

finding: SNP rs157580 was reported as an intron variant of the gene TOMM40 and had an average allele frequency across different populations. It was significantly associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) as noted in a previous study, which highlighted the odds ratio of AD's presence with this variant.
title: PGSbuilder: An end-to-end platform for human genome association analysis and polygenic risk score predictions

finding: The SNP rs67412075 was included in the sPrediXcan model for ANKLE1, which was significantly associated with high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC). This SNP was part of the expression model and had a probability of being an eQTL of 0.0169.
title: Cis- and trans-eQTL TWAS of breast and ovarian cancer identify more than 100 risk associated genes in the BCAC and OCAC consortia

finding: The SNP rs635299 was identified within a NEUROG3-binding site at the promoter region of the gene SIX5, which is associated with the GIPR GWAS locus. This indicates a direct potential regulatory role of NEUROG3 on SIX5, with implications for islet cell development and T2DM risk.
title: Extensive NEUROG3 occupancy in the human pancreatic endocrine gene regulatory network

finding: The SNP rs7245708 was located at the bi-directional promoter of genes QPCTL and SNRPD2, coinciding with NEUROG3-binding sites. This finding suggests that NEUROG3 may regulate these genes, contributing to the overarching regulatory network implicated in T2DM.
title: Extensive NEUROG3 occupancy in the human pancreatic endocrine gene regulatory network

finding: rs61729907 (R88W) was associated with androstenone perception, replicated in both intensity (discovery p<1.07×10^-7) and pleasantness rankings (p<9.56×10^-6) in the discovery cohort.
title: From musk to body odor: decoding olfaction through genetic variation

finding: The SNP rs5020278 (T133M) was included in the haplotype associated with androstenone perception, replicated for both pleasantness and intensity in the discovery cohort.
title: From musk to body odor: decoding olfaction through genetic variation

finding: The SNP rs61732668 (P79L) confirmed associations with androstenone perception in the validation cohort specifically for intensity (p<3.53×10^-4) and pleasantness (p<6.88×10^-3).
title: From musk to body odor: decoding olfaction through genetic variation

finding: The APOE-ε4 tagging variant (rs429358) showed the strongest association with multiple biochemical measures, including Aβ40_TX, Aβ40_FA, Aβ40/42_FA, and APOE_FA. It explained 6.6% to 14% of the variance in these measures and was linked to higher AD risk, Thal phase, and Braak stage.
title: Genome-wide association study of brain biochemical phenotypes reveals distinct genetic architecture of Alzheimer’s Disease related proteins

finding: The STRN4 intronic SNP (rs34805055) was associated with Aβ40_TX and linked to the downregulation of the PRKD2 gene in expression analysis, indicating potential regulatory effects.
title: Genome-wide association study of brain biochemical phenotypes reveals distinct genetic architecture of Alzheimer’s Disease related proteins

finding: The intergenic SNP (rs483082) between APOE and APOC1 was the most significant for the Aβ40/42_TX measure, indicating its influence on biochemical states in relation to AD.
title: Genome-wide association study of brain biochemical phenotypes reveals distinct genetic architecture of Alzheimer’s Disease related proteins

finding: The NECTIN2 intronic variant (rs283815) significantly associated with APOE_TBS splicing and had impacts on TOMM40 splicing, suggesting it contributes to the biochemical levels related to AD.
title: Genome-wide association study of brain biochemical phenotypes reveals distinct genetic architecture of Alzheimer’s Disease related proteins

finding: The SNP rs12608932, located in the UNC13A gene, was associated with the phenomenon of cryptic exon emergence in the context of TDP-43 loss of function (LOF). This association suggested that individuals carrying this polymorphism could potentially benefit more from treatment aimed at correcting cryptic exon usage aberrations stemming from TDP-43 dysfunction. This finding pointed to a possible stratification in the clinical management of ALS and FTD based on individual genetic profiles.
title: Differential exon usage and cryptic exon profiles of TDP-43 loss of function in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis brain tissue

finding: The SNP rs12973192, also within the UNC13A gene, was similarly linked to the enhancement of cryptic exon occurrences due to TDP-43 loss of function (LOF). Like rs12608932, this SNP indicated potential variations in treatment efficacy based on the presence of the polymorphism, reinforcing the concept that individualized treatment strategies could be developed for ALS and FTD patients based on their unique genetic make-up.
title: Differential exon usage and cryptic exon profiles of TDP-43 loss of function in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis brain tissue

finding: The rs601338 SNP in the FUT2 gene was associated with Crohn's disease and conferred a relative protective effect against norovirus infection, depending on the pathogen genotype.
title: Prioritising Autoimmunity Risk Variants for Functional Analyses by Fine-Mapping Mutations Under Natural Selection

finding: The SNP rs601338, associated with the FUT2 gene, was observed to correlate with susceptibility to HuNoV infection, particularly in relation to the secretor phenotype. The study highlighted that non-secretors, characterized by this SNP, still exhibited some level of interaction with HuNoV despite being less affected overall. The association with inflammatory bowel diseases, particularly in a non-secretor patient with Crohn's disease, further underscored the importance of this SNP in gastrointestinal health and disease contexts.
title: Intestinal norovirus binding patterns in non-secretor individuals

finding: The common nonsense SNP 263K>*, represented by rs201821720, was identified as the primary genetic determinant for CD177 null and expression variations. All homozygous donors carrying the 263*> allele were found to be CD177 deficient, indicating its significant role in the absence of CD177 expression in neutrophils.
title: CD177 is a novel IgG Fc receptor and CD177 genetic variants affect IgG-mediated function

finding: The SNP 431G>R, identified as rs78718189, was associated with low CD177 expression on neutrophils. Donors with the homozygous 263K431R genotype had significantly lower CD177 density compared to those with the homozygous 263K431G genotype, supporting the conclusion that this variant affects CD177 expression levels.
title: CD177 is a novel IgG Fc receptor and CD177 genetic variants affect IgG-mediated function

finding: The eQTL rs4803042 of gene ASB1 was shown to induce preferential binding of PORL2A when the A allele was present. This resulted in a decreased burst size and increased burst frequency. The presence of the A allele correlated with higher TF binding affinity compared to the G allele.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: The SNP rs4420638 demonstrated significant associations with total cholesterol (TC), high-density lipoprotein (HDL), and triglycerides (TG) in Samoans, with p-values of 2.67 × 10−16 for TC, 9.07 × 10−9 for HDL, and 7.44 × 10−10 for TG. This finding was consistent with previous studies in other populations.
title: Genome-wide association studies in Samoans give insight into the genetic architecture of fasting serum lipid levels.

finding: The SNP rs1160985 was associated with low-density lipoprotein (LDL), showing a significant p-value of 2.61 × 10−20. This peak SNP represents a distinct association signal in Polynesians compared to findings in non-Polynesian populations.
title: Genome-wide association studies in Samoans give insight into the genetic architecture of fasting serum lipid levels.

finding: The study provided evidence for an association between the single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) rs1064395 in the NCAN gene and the phenotype of Bipolar Disorder. This finding highlighted the influence of Neurocan, a protein involved in synapse modulation, on the pathology of mood disorders, supporting the role of astrocyte-secreted proteins in neuropsychiatric conditions.
title: Astrocyte-Secreted Neurocan Controls Inhibitory Synapse Formation and Function

finding: The rs2108622 sentinel variant was strongly associated with plasma levels of N-oleoyl-leucine and N-oleoyl-phenylalanine, demonstrating p-values of 5.7×10^-16 and 2.9×10^-19, respectively. This variant was located at the CYP4F2 locus on chromosome 19, which has been implicated in the regulation of lipophilic substrates. Additionally, it was previously associated with several cardiometabolic phenotypes, such as blood cholesterol levels and coronary artery disease, and is characterized by a valine to methionine substitution that reduces CYP4F2 enzymatic activity.
title: CYP4F2 is a human-specific determinant of circulating N-acyl amino acid levels

finding: This variant, associated with erythrocyte distribution, showed an increase in frequency within the last 6,000 years and had a selection coefficient of s = 0.015 in Emiratis, highlighting a significant recent selection event.
title: The Genomic History of the Middle East

finding: The missense variant rs17850995, which serves as an eQTL for SLC44A2 and is linked with high cholesterol, exhibited strong evidence of selection with a selection coefficient of s = 0.011 in Saudis, indicating notable positive selection.
title: The Genomic History of the Middle East

finding: This SNP tagged the APOE ε4 AD risk haplotype. It showed a nominal association with POAG across all ancestries (P=0.00153), indicating a potential link between POAG and Alzheimer’s disease.
title: A large cross-ancestry meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies identifies 69 novel risk loci for primary open-angle glaucoma and includes a genetic link with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The PGP1 iPSC line showed an association with the variant rs113809142, which is known to be a risk factor for Alzheimer's Disease, reinforcing the genetic landscape of AD-related phenotypes in the examined lines.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: The SNP rs374399247 was identified as having a serine to proline change at position 86 (86P) in the KIR3DL3 allotypes. This mutation led to markedly reduced cell surface expression of KIR3DL3, indicating a significant functional impact on receptor expression.
title: Polymorphic KIR3DL3 expression modulates tissue-resident and innate-like T cells

finding: The SNP rs111269305 was shown to completely ablate proximal promoter activity when mutated in the CREB site, thus demonstrating a substantial effect on KIR3DL3 expression regulation. It was further noted that this SNP possessed unique population genetic patterns, suggesting that it could lead to differential expression of KIR3DL3 among individuals.
title: Polymorphic KIR3DL3 expression modulates tissue-resident and innate-like T cells

finding: The SNP rs2307019 was indicated as producing multiple proteins with no sequence overlap in the RASIP1 gene, which could influence protein function due to its large minor allele frequency. Its high MAF and direct implications in IZUMO1 made it significant in discussions on genetic haplotypes.
title: Genetic Diversity in the IZUMO1-JUNO Protein-Receptor Pair Involved in Human Reproduction

finding: rs3865444 was identified in the 2013 GWAS as linked to a functional gene, signifying its relevance in the context of AD risk assessment.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with AD in at least nine independent GWAS studies, suggesting a strong link to the disease, warranting further investigation into its functional role.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: For the FARSA gene, the rs2238641 reQTL in the CA experiment was previously associated with hematocrit levels, confirming its relevance.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: SNP rs78073763 interrupted multiple binding sites of SPI1 in the hippocampus and RARA in the lateral temporal lobe, impacting transcriptional regulation associated with crucial AD phenotypes such as cognitive decline.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: SNP rs17643262 disrupts SPI1 regulation of DMPK in the hippocampus, which is associated with severe clinical features of Alzheimer's, and also affects APOC2 regulation in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, linking AD progression to cognitive impairment.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: SNP rs2041262 also affected SPI1 regulation of DMPK in the hippocampus similarly to rs17643262, linking this SNP to worsening Alzheimer's disease phenotypes.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: SNP rs62117780 influenced FOXC2 and POU2F2 regulation of KCNN4 in the hippocampus, linking its expression to Alzheimer's disease progression.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: SNP rs4802200 impacted E2F7 regulation of KCNN4 in the lateral temporal lobe, suggesting a role of KCNN4 in AD mechanisms.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: The rs429358 SNP, a missense variant in the APOE gene, was identified as significantly associated with lifespan in the FinnGen study, exhibiting a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 18.3% and a p-value of 1.01 x 10^-14. It was well-established as a risk factor for age-related diseases, including cardiovascular diseases, stroke, and Alzheimer's disease. The association was replicated in the UK Biobank (UKBB), with a p-value of 1.92 x 10^-5 and a meta-analysis p-value of 4.04 x 10^-17, highlighting its importance in longevity and health in old age.
title: An efficient and accurate frailty model approach for genome-wide survival association analysis controlling for population structure and relatedness in large-scale biobanks

finding: The rs157592 SNP, which was associated with the APOE locus, showed a significant association with lifespan in the UK Biobank, with a MAF of 18.7% and a p-value of 1.87 x 10^-8. This variant was in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the well-known rs429358 (r^2 = 0.7). However, it was located in an intergenic region and displayed no predicted functions based on in-silico analyses performed through the FAVOR annotation portal.
title: An efficient and accurate frailty model approach for genome-wide survival association analysis controlling for population structure and relatedness in large-scale biobanks

finding: The FUT6 coding variant rs17855739 was linked to alkaline phosphatase (ALP) levels, suggesting its relevance in serum biomarker variations within African ancestry individuals.
title: Analyses of Biomarker Traits in Diverse UK Biobank Participants Identify Associations Missed by European-centric Analysis Strategies

finding: The variant rs2599553 was identified as significantly associated with reading disability in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) utilizing longitudinal data on reading performance from the New Haven Lexinome Project. This SNP achieved a genome-wide significance threshold (P = 3.13 x 10^-8) and was linked to the gene GARRE1, showing a persistent negative impact on reading skills from Grade 1 to Grade 5 in children who carried at least one minor allele. Specifically, children with the minor allele underperformed by 0.33 to 0.5 standard deviations in standardized assessments of non-word decoding, and there was indication that age moderated the effect of this SNP on decoding performance with distinct impacts observed at various age quantiles.
title: Genome Wide Association Study in the New Haven Lexinome Project Identifies GARRE1 as a Novel Gene for Reading Performance

finding: The variant rs11371265, associated with either a full-length KIR2DL4 protein (allele 10A) or a truncated version (allele 9A), was reported at a frequency of 43.86% in Brazilian samples. The study highlighted that the truncated protein frequency increased among individuals with a higher European ancestry background.
title: KIR2DL4 genetic diversity in a Brazilian population sample: implications for transcription regulation and protein diversity in samples with different ancestry backgrounds

finding: This exonic variant was found in the *41 allele context, was assessed to be benign, and led to the assignment of a new subvariant, *41.004, with an allele frequency of about 0.1%.
title: Nanopore sequencing of the pharmacogene CYP2D6 allows simultaneous haplotyping and detection of duplications

finding: The rs641738 variant in the MBOAT7 locus was associated with reduced hepatic expression of MBOAT7, which altered phospholipid composition, promoting fat accumulation and thereby impacting the severity of NAFLD.
title: TM6SF2/PNPLA3/MBOAT7 loss-of-function genetic variants impact on NAFLD development and progression both in patients and in in vitro models

finding: The E167K TM6SF2 variant (rs58542926) caused retention of very low-density lipoproteins (VLDL) in the liver, increased intrahepatic triglyceride content, and was implicated in altering lipid metabolism but its direct role in hepatocellular injury remained less characterized.
title: TM6SF2/PNPLA3/MBOAT7 loss-of-function genetic variants impact on NAFLD development and progression both in patients and in in vitro models

finding: The SNP rs117385980 was associated with longevity and healthy aging in Finnish men, indicating a significant connection between this SIRT6 polymorphism and aging phenotypes. This finding underscored the potential role of SIRT6 in modulating factors related to aging, which was further explored in relation to intervertebral disc health.
title: SIRT6 loss causes intervertebral disc degeneration in mice by promoting senescence and SASP status

finding: The rs429358 SNP, which is associated with the APOE4 variant, showed that carriers exhibited increased survival in melanoma patients compared to APOE3 homozygotes. This finding was significant as it indicated a direct impact of the APOE genetic variant on melanoma progression and the survival outcomes of patients.
title: Germline genetic determination of cancer progression and survival

finding: The rs7412 SNP, linked to the APOE2 variant, was found to relate to shorter survival outcomes in melanoma relative to APOE3 homozygotes. This context highlighted the detrimental impact of the APOE2 variant on patient survival, reinforcing the role of genetic variation in cancer prognosis.
title: Germline genetic determination of cancer progression and survival

finding: The SNP rs429358 in the APOE gene was associated with various traits including those related to dietary habits, emphasizing the genetic relationship between diet and health.
title: Comprehensive genomic analysis of dietary habits in UK Biobank identifies hundreds of genetic loci and establishes causal relationships between educational attainment and healthy eating

finding: The SNP rs7249925 was linked to the induction of the NOSIP gene in the esophagus. The reference allele was A, and the alternative allele was G. Analysis with DeepG4 indicated that the G allele, which extended a GGGGGG stretch, was predicted to enhance G4 activity.
title: DeepG4 : A deep learning approach to predict active G-quadruplexes from DNA

finding: The SNP rs147110934 was identified as a significant rare variant affecting adult height, with a P-value of 1 × 10^-20 when analyzed using the gene-ε framework. Despite not being mapped to height in the GWAS catalog prior to this finding, the gene ZNF628 showed strong evidence of association with adult height. This highlighted the capability of gene-ε to detect rare and low-frequency variants which are often missed in traditional genome-wide association studies, emphasizing the importance of such variants in contributing to the variation of complex traits.
title: Estimation of Non-null SNP Effect Size Distributions Enables the Detection of Enriched Genes Underlying Complex Traits

finding: In the studied Peruvian population, the rs429358 SNP, associated with the ApoE ε4 allele, showed a significant association with Alzheimer disease (AD), yielding an odds ratio of 5.02 (95% CI: 2.3-12.5, p-value = 2e-4). This finding demonstrated that carriers of the ApoE ε4 allele had a considerably higher risk for AD in Peruvians compared to the observed effects in non-Hispanic White populations.
title: Dissecting the role of Amerindian genetic ancestry and ApoE ε4 allele on Alzheimer disease in an admixed Peruvian population

finding: The rs7412 SNP, which is another polymorphism defining the ApoE alleles, was implicated in the association with Alzheimer disease in the Peruvian population, reinforcing the findings of a strong risk for AD among ApoE ε4 carriers. The study's logistic regression indicated a notable genetic risk from the ApoE gene region, highlighting the contribution of local ancestry, particularly Amerindian ancestry, to this risk.
title: Dissecting the role of Amerindian genetic ancestry and ApoE ε4 allele on Alzheimer disease in an admixed Peruvian population

finding: rs67397200 was strongly associated with the risk of triple-negative (TN) disease, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.27 and a p-value of 1.07×10^-50. In extended case-case comparisons, it was associated with TN status.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: This SNP was connected to risk factors, but specific associations were not detailed in the case-case comparisons.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Considered in HR-negative studies indicating relevance in breast cancer susceptibility.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The variant rs7412 was an established causal variant for lipid levels, prioritised in a multi-trait fine-mapping approach for high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, despite not being identified in single-trait fine-mapping.
title: Improved genetic discovery and fine-mapping resolution through multivariate latent factor analysis of high-dimensional traits

finding: The variant rs1799815 in the INSR gene was associated with fasting insulin (FI) and exhibited strong evidence as the likely causal variant at this locus, influencing insulin receptor functioning based on its expression in adipose tissue.
title: The Trans-Ancestral Genomic Architecture of Glycaemic Traits

finding: The rs59508494 variant was confirmed to regulate the expression of the distal gene EPS15L, further supported by 4C-seq analyses showing long-distance interactions with its target, emphasizing the complexity of its regulatory function.
title: Endogenous fine-mapping of functional regulatory elements in complex genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs536121979 occurred in patient 109 and was associated with variations in the binding site of the transcription factor SP1 (potentially SP2, 3, or 4). This finding played a significant role in identifying mutational hotspots and understanding the genetic factors contributing to the immune dysregulation observed in CVID.
title: Decoding mutational hotspots in human disease through the gene modules governing thymic regulatory T cells

finding: The SNP rs429358, part of the APOE4 variant, demonstrated strong association with Alzheimer's Disease, yielding a p-value of 1e-91. This finding was particularly significant as it surpasses the findings of other methods studied and underscores the major role of the APOE4 variant in increasing the hazards of AD.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of age-at-onset traits using Cox mixed-effects models

finding: The variant rs34536443 in the TYK2 gene was identified as a loss-of-function variant associated with a lower risk of autoimmune diseases, including type 1 diabetes (T1D). This finding supported the notion that Tyk2 plays a role in the pathogenesis of autoimmune T1D, as established through the observed effects of Tyk2 deficiency in NOD mice.
title: Tyk2-mediated signaling promotes the development of autoreactive CD8+ CTLs and autoimmune type 1 diabetes

finding: The TGFB1 rs1800471 polymorphism was linked with chronic kidney disease and hypertension, indicating potential connections to metabolic pathways involved in GDM.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: Research indicated that the SNP rs1122608 exhibited a notable correlation not only with the risk of myocardial infarction (MI) but also with the timing of MI diagnosis, establishing its importance in clinical characteristics related to MI.
title: In-silico analysis of Myocardial Infarction-related missense SNPs to identify novel biomarkers to predict susceptibility

finding: Carriers of this variant had an earlier age at menopause by 0.20 standard deviations, and it was found to be correlated with a significant deletion overlapping NMRK2, the lead variant for that locus.
title: The sequences of 150,119 genomes in the UK biobank

finding: The variant rs1799782 was related to Lung Non-small Cell Carcinoma and was associated with an increased response rate of chemotherapy. It had a much higher minor allele frequency (MAF) of 30.50% in Hong Kong Cantonese (HKG) compared to the worldwide distribution of 9.46%, indicating a potential significance for drug effectiveness in this population.
title: HKG: An open genetic variant database of 205 Hong Kong Cantonese exomes

finding: The G allele of rs67397200 was identified as being associated with an increased risk of both breast and ovarian cancer. In addition, this variant was linked to higher expression of the ANKLE1 gene specifically in breast tissue, indicating that it not only correlates with cancer susceptibility but also with the expression of a gene that may be involved in tumor progression.
title: ANKLE1 cleaves mitochondrial DNA and contributes to cancer risk by driving the Warburg effect and apoptosis resistance

finding: The rs2288464-A allele was found to be associated with an increased level of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) in human blood, while it also correlated with lower expression of the ANKLE1 gene. This finding suggested an inverse relationship between ANKLE1 expression and mtDNA levels, thereby linking the variant in the chr19p13.1 locus to mitochondrial regulation within the context of cancer biology.
