title: ANKLE1 cleaves mitochondrial DNA and contributes to cancer risk by driving the Warburg effect and apoptosis resistance

finding: The study authored by Zhang et al. found an association between the KLK1 rs5516 G allele and both aortic aneurysm and atherosclerotic stenosis. This suggests that the presence of the G allele at this SNP may contribute to the development and progression of atherosclerosis.
title: Changes of urinary proteome in high-fat diet ApoE-/- mice

finding: The common rs641738 (C>T) SNP located near the MBOAT7 gene was originally linked to an increased risk of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and other liver diseases. Subsequent studies indicated that individuals possessing this variant exhibited a higher susceptibility to NAFLD progression, liver inflammation, and increased liver fat accumulation. Notably, experiments demonstrated that the loss of function of MBOAT7 due to this SNP was sufficient to drive NAFLD progression and exacerbated conditions like hepatic steatosis, hyperinsulinemia, and insulin resistance. In essence, the findings illustrated that this genetic variant had a critical role in the etiology of metabolic diseases related to liver dysfunction.
title: Membrane Bound O-Acyltransferase 7 (MBOAT7)-Driven Lysophosphatidylinositol (LPI) Acylation in Adipocytes Contributes to Systemic Glucose Homeostasis

finding: It served as a lead SNP for a novel locus found to be associated with cIMT, adding new insights into genetic factors influencing cardiovascular disease.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: This SNP was recognized as a lead SNP for an established locus associated with cIMT, solidifying its importance in cardiovascular genetics.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: This SNP, part of the apolipoprotein gene cluster, has been extensively linked to lipid levels and cardiovascular disease, affirming its role in genetic studies of cIMT.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: The polymorphism rs3746319 in the KRAB-ZNF gene ZNF224 was associated with both global Alzheimer's disease (AD) neuropathology and cognitive functions. This finding suggested that the SNP plays a significant role in influencing intermediate phenotypes during AD progression, potentially linking genetic variations in the KRAB-ZNF family to neural dysfunctions observed in neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Regulatory networks of KRAB zinc finger genes and transposable elements changed during human brain evolution and disease

finding: The APOE rs429358 variant was negatively associated with age and confirmed in both Ashkenazi Jew longevity analyses and GHS60K Age-ExWAS, passing Bonferroni adjustment in both studies. It was noted that this variant is part of the APOE e4 haplotype associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Exome-wide association studies in general and long-lived populations identify genetic variants related to human age

finding: The APOE rs6857 variant was identified as significantly associated with extreme ages in the Ashkenazi Jew cohort, contributing to the understanding of longevity within this group.
title: Exome-wide association studies in general and long-lived populations identify genetic variants related to human age

finding: The APOE rs2075650 variant was replicated in the age association analysis, contributing to the established link between APOE variants and age.
title: Exome-wide association studies in general and long-lived populations identify genetic variants related to human age

finding: The APOE rs4420638 variant was identified in the longevity analysis of Ashkenazi Jews, highlighting its significance in relation to aging.
title: Exome-wide association studies in general and long-lived populations identify genetic variants related to human age

finding: The APOE rs7412 variant was involved in the classification of haplotypes related to longevity, bolstering findings in the aging studies.
title: Exome-wide association studies in general and long-lived populations identify genetic variants related to human age

finding: The study highlighted the role of TM6SF2 rs58542926 in the pathogenesis of nonalcoholic pediatric fatty liver disease. This finding was part of a multiethnic analysis that underscored its potential significant impact on pediatric NAFLD.
title: Comparative Analysis of Global Hepatic Gene Expression in Adolescents and Adults with Non-alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease

finding: The study identified rs429358, located at position 45411941 on chromosome 19, as the most significant SNP associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD). It reached a genome-wide significance with a p-value of 1.66E-28. This SNP is known as the APOE E4 determinant and was part of a cluster that included significant findings related to the APOE, TOMM40, and APOC1 genes. The research highlighted that the maximum genotypic effects associated with this SNP on impairment status were observed between the ages of 70 to 80.
title: Detecting time-varying genetic effects in Alzheimer’s disease using a longitudinal GWAS model

finding: The SNP rs7412 was involved in determining the APOE genotypes (APOE ε2, ε3, and ε4) in the context of genetic risk factors for Alzheimer's Disease (AD). The research indicated that individuals positive for the APOE ε4 genotype exhibited a hub in the right paracentral lobule, which was notably absent in low-risk individuals, potentially suggesting its relevance as an early biomarker of AD.
title: Dementia risk factors modify hubs but leave other connectivity measures unchanged in asymptomatic individuals: a graph theoretical analysis

finding: SNP rs429358 was analyzed alongside rs7412 to identify APOE genotypes, particularly the presence of APOE ε4 associated with increased risk for Alzheimer's Disease. Similar to findings related to rs7412, individuals with the APOE ε4 genotype displayed a significant hub in the right paracentral lobule when compared to low-risk groups, hinting at its potential role in identifying early indicators of AD.
title: Dementia risk factors modify hubs but leave other connectivity measures unchanged in asymptomatic individuals: a graph theoretical analysis

finding: The rs405509 SNP was noted as an AD-related polymorphism located in the APOE promoter region, which influences transcriptional activity of the APOE gene. The interaction of this genotype with age highlighted modulations in cortical thickness and connectivity, with implications for understanding brain structure in the context of AD, thereby suggesting it could serve as an early biomarker linked to cognitive decline.
title: Dementia risk factors modify hubs but leave other connectivity measures unchanged in asymptomatic individuals: a graph theoretical analysis

finding: The SNP rs1108551, located near the FFAR2 (GPR43) gene, was shown to be associated with higher expression of GPR43, which correlated with a significantly lower prevalence of hypertension in participants from the UK Biobank. The data revealed that homozygous carriers of the C allele had a hypertension prevalence of 37.3%, compared to 38% in the rest of the cohort, indicating its protective role against hypertension.
title: GPR41/43 regulates blood pressure by improving gut epithelial barrier integrity to prevent TLR4 activation and renal inflammation

finding: The SNP rs2106448, situated near the FFAR3 (GPR41) gene, was linked to increased expression of GPR41. This association also contributed to a reduced prevalence of hypertension, corroborating the role of this SNP in the protective effect against hypertension observed in the UK Biobank participants, especially in conjunction with the findings from rs1108551.
title: GPR41/43 regulates blood pressure by improving gut epithelial barrier integrity to prevent TLR4 activation and renal inflammation

finding: The rs7412 SNP was part of the assessment for the Apolipoprotein E (APOE) ε4 allele, which was modeled to examine its impact on genetic risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD). The findings indicated that carriers of the ε4 allele showed a negative correlation with hippocampal volume, particularly highlighting that they had smaller hippocampi during development.
title: Genetic risk for Alzheimer’s disease predicts hippocampal volume through the lifespan

finding: The rs429358 SNP, which also contributes to the determination of the APOE ε4 allele, was analyzed similarly to rs7412. The findings reaffirmed that the presence of the ε4 allele, indicated by this SNP, was associated with reduced hippocampal volume, emphasizing its role in genetic risk for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genetic risk for Alzheimer’s disease predicts hippocampal volume through the lifespan

finding: The study tested and confirmed the status of the APOE ε4 allele using the SNP rs429358, which indicated increased genetic risk associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) pathology and its relation to hippocampal integrity.
title: Sleep Efficiency Relates to Hippocampal Integrity Decline in β-Amyloid Positive Adults

finding: The SNP rs7412 was utilized to estimate APOE ε4 counts alongside rs429358 to evaluate the influence of APOE genotypes on the observed decline in memory and hippocampal integrity in the context of sleep efficiency and Aβ accumulation.
title: Sleep Efficiency Relates to Hippocampal Integrity Decline in β-Amyloid Positive Adults

finding: The rs10415219 SNP in the ACTN4 locus exhibited a strong association with retinal venular tortuosity. In images activating in the A-allele direction, this tortuosity was clearly visible, suggesting its potential role as a risk marker for cardiovascular diseases. Furthermore, this SNP was noted to be in linkage disequilibrium with rs1808382, reinforcing the finding concerning retinal phenotypes.
title: transferGWAS: GWAS of images using deep transfer learning

finding: Linked with rs10415219 (R²=1), rs1808382 was previously noted to be associated with increased retinal venular tortuosity, further affirming the connection of this SNP with ocular traits as explored in the transferGWAS study.
title: transferGWAS: GWAS of images using deep transfer learning

finding: The SNP rs641738, associated with the MBOAT7 gene, was identified as a genetic variant that increases the risk of liver inflammation and transition to fibrosis in chronic hepatitis C. This finding was significant in understanding the role of MBOAT7 in liver pathology and its potential implications in conditions linked to lipid metabolism, which could be vital for researching aging processes in neural stem cells.
title: Lipidomic profiling reveals age-dependent changes in complex plasma membrane lipids that regulate neural stem cell aging

finding: A common missense variant (rs167479) in the RGL3 gene was associated with systolic blood pressure. The allele frequency was reported at 47%. This variant demonstrated a weaker correlation when conditioned on the low-frequency 1.1kb deletion in the same gene, which subsequently became the lead variant in association analyses, indicating a potential role in the blood pressure trait.
title: Hidden protein-altering variants influence diverse human phenotypes

finding: The intronic SNP rs55670943 in the RAB3D gene, located 76kb downstream of the RGL3 locus, was found to be a significant proxy for the 1.1kb deletion in RGL3. This SNP had a strong linkage (R2=0.66) to the deletion, suggesting it may effectively tag the associated variance related to hypertension risk.
title: Hidden protein-altering variants influence diverse human phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs429358, associated with the APOE gene, served as a positive control in examining the effects on lifespan. The analysis showed a highly significant effect on age, with a p-value of 1.2×10^-211, establishing a robust association with Alzheimer’s disease risk.
title: Human loss-of-function variants suggest that partial LRRK2 inhibition is a safe therapeutic strategy for Parkinson’s disease

finding: As a GWAS peak SNP linked to multiple sclerosis, rs2303759 was in high LD with rs10411630 and supported by evidence from TF binding studies implicating it in regulatory pathways of the disease.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: This lead SNP was identified as a missense mutation located 20kb downstream of DOCK6 in the African samples. As a result of employing the Tractor model, it was localized better than prior analyses had achieved. It was associated with triglyceride levels and closely linked to ANGPTL8, a candidate gene involved in blood lipid regulation. Its frequency was 18% in African populations and 4% in non-Finnish Europeans, demonstrating how leveraging multiple ancestry groups facilitated the identification of important risk variants.
title: Tractor: A framework allowing for improved inclusion of admixed individuals in large-scale association studies

finding: The IFI30 rs11554159 variant was found to be linked with the onset and severity of multiple sclerosis (MS) in Serbia.
title: Identification of candidate biomarkers and pathways associated with multiple sclerosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: Hepcidin rs10421768 was suggested to be potentially associated with the origin of multiple sclerosis (MS) according to a study published in 2022.
title: Identification of candidate biomarkers and pathways associated with multiple sclerosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The exonic variant rs5491 at the ICAM1 locus was noted as a fourth distinct signal in the analysis for IL-6 involvement, with implications for African ancestry populations.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The variant rs11575071 was identified as a distinct signal at the ICAM1 locus. It was associated with ICAM-1 levels, demonstrating the complex interactions of noncoding variants in this region.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The SNP rs139053442 was part of a significant gene-centric set of rare missense variants associated with ICAM-1, indicating its biologically relevant impact on inflammatory processes.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: As a conditionally distinct noncoding variant at the ICAM1 locus, rs28382777 underscored the complexity of genetic signals related to ICAM-1 and its expression.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Variant rs5030400 at the ICAM1 locus was associated with significant findings in previous studies and remained relevant in the current genetic analysis.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Common across populations, the rs429358 variant marked the APOE locus and was recognized for its associations with various phenotypes including Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The second distinct signal at the APOE locus, rs8106813, was associated with numerous traits, especially Alzheimer’s disease, reflecting the pleiotropic nature of this genetic element.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Finally, rs17855739 emerged among significant findings for acute inflammatory responses in diverse ancestry cohorts.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the APOE4 allele, which in the context of Tsimane forager-farmers, was linked to a 30% reduction in C-reactive protein levels. This SNP was found to correlate with higher total cholesterol and oxidized LDL levels, indicating a potential beneficial role in pathogen-driven immune responses without increasing cardiovascular risk.
title: APOE4 is associated with elevated blood lipids and lower levels of innate immune biomarkers in a tropical Amerindian subsistence population

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also associated with the APOE4 allele. It contributed to findings that as a carrier of the APOE4 genotype, individuals maintained higher levels of total and LDL cholesterol at low body mass indexes, suggesting that this allele provided an advantage in energy-limited conditions by buffering against immune activation costs during infections.
title: APOE4 is associated with elevated blood lipids and lower levels of innate immune biomarkers in a tropical Amerindian subsistence population

finding: The missense variant rs429358 in the APOE gene was consistently selected as a key feature across all folds and models in the context of Alzheimer's disease (AD). This variant's (C) allele exhibited an additive risk pattern. In AD individuals, the presence of the (C) allele was more than double compared to controls, suggesting a strong association with disease risk.
title: Machine learning methods applied to classify complex diseases using genomic data

finding: The study indicated that the missense variant rs35033974 was associated with TEX101 and was identified through proteomic measurement of human spermatozoa. The findings were significant in understanding the impacts of variations within this gene on protein functions and clinical relevance.
title: APPRIS principal isoforms and MANE Select transcripts in clinical variant interpretation

finding: The loss-of-function SNP rs34536443 in the TYK2 gene was reported to confer protection against several autoimmune diseases, including type 1 diabetes (T1D), in a large analysis of the Finnish population. This SNP dampened the signaling pathways involving IFN-ι, IL12, and IL23, which are critical contributors to T1D etiology. The study indicated a linkage of this SNP to a significant decrease in the incidence of T1D among 5,928 cases and 183,185 controls, achieving a p-value less than 1.16x10^-5, thus supporting its effect as a protective genetic variant.
title: The type 1 diabetes gene TYK2 regulates β-cell development and its responses to interferon-α

finding: The missense variant SNP rs4252548-T (p.Arg112His) was linked to reduced function of the IL11 protein and was associated with OA. The consistent and considerable upregulation of IL11 in both subchondral bone and cartilaginous tissues indicated a potential attempt by chondrocytes to enhance ECM integrity despite functional limitations. This SNP identified IL11 as a prospective therapeutic target for OA.
title: RNA sequencing reveals interacting key determinants of osteoarthritis acting in subchondral bone and articular cartilage

finding: This variant in SULT2A1 was linked to 5alpha-androstan-3beta, highlighting its role in steroid metabolism.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: This SNP within SUGP1 was linked to Cer 18:1;O2/24:0 levels, indicative of lipid metabolism.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: The variant rs879255211 was identified as a stop-gain variant in LDLR, exhibiting a dramatic risk for CAD development with an odds ratio of 4.97. This variant was also associated with significantly increased serum total cholesterol (TC) levels, indicating its potential impact on CAD.
title: Population-specific and transethnic genome-wide analyses reveal distinct and shared genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: This SNP near CYP2A6 was associated with smoking cessation and contributes to the complexity of nicotine metabolism.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association analyses leveraging alcohol use disorder findings identify novel loci for smoking behaviors in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs3814995 was linked to the NPHS1 gene, related to Nephrotic syndrome type 1. It was mapped to a small credible set with two variants and is projected to have implications for kidney phenotypes, reinforcing its significance in chronic kidney disease.
title: Discovery and prioritization of variants and genes for kidney function in >1.2 million individuals

finding: The rs2075650 SNP was found to have a significant impact on enhancer activity in the European/Japanese APOEε4 haplotype, particularly in fragments associated with the TOMM40 intronic region. It was predicted to affect a binding site for transcription factor SP1, which has been previously connected to dysregulation in Alzheimer's disease (AD). This finding contributes to the understanding of the differential AD risk linked to APOEε4 haplotypes.
title: Converging evidence for differential regulatory control of APOEε4 on African versus European haplotypes

finding: Similar to rs2075650, rs157581 also demonstrated significant differential activity between African and European/Japanese haplotypes in the intronic region of TOMM40. Its proximity to rs2075650 suggests a potential synergistic regulatory effect, enhancing understanding of risk variance for AD among different ancestral backgrounds.
title: Converging evidence for differential regulatory control of APOEε4 on African versus European haplotypes

finding: The rs59007384 variant was identified as part of the higher enhancer activity in the European haplotypes. This SNP was linked with differential regulation of APOE expression in microglia and astrocytes, contributing to the observed disparities in Alzheimer's risk associated with different APOEε4 haplotypes.
title: Converging evidence for differential regulatory control of APOEε4 on African versus European haplotypes

finding: The GIPR-Q354 variant, represented by SNP rs1800437, was associated with lower body mass index (BMI) and enhanced glucose tolerance. Meta-analyses indicated that homozygosity for this variant correlated with reduced C-peptide excursions and lower GIP and insulin concentrations following an oral glucose tolerance test, reflecting significant impacts on beta cell biology.
title: A common human variant of GIPR improves systemic glucose homeostasis in a sexual dimorphic manner

finding: SNP rs492602, located in the FUT2 gene, was independently associated with total AUDIT score and drinks per week, indicating its relevance to alcohol-related behaviors and traits in the context of PAU.
title: Meta-analysis of problematic alcohol use in 435,563 individuals identifies 29 risk variants and yields insights into biology, pleiotropy and causality

finding: The SNP rs12608932 (C/C) was associated with increased susceptibility to Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) and comorbid Frontotemporal Dementia (FTD) with ALS. This finding was linked to the inclusion of a cryptic exon (exon 20-21) in UNC13A and retention of a distant intron (intron 31) following TDP-43 knockdown, thus demonstrating a relevant functional impact of this SNP on gene expression.
title: Novel and known transcriptional targets of ALS/FTD protein TDP-43: Meta-analysis and interactive graphical databases

finding: The SNP rs12973192 was associated with increased risk of ALS. Similar to rs12608932, this SNP was shown to enhance susceptibility to exon 20-21 inclusion and intron 31 retention in the UNC13A gene upon TDP-43 knockdown. This suggests a critical role of this variant in the pathogenesis of ALS.
title: Novel and known transcriptional targets of ALS/FTD protein TDP-43: Meta-analysis and interactive graphical databases

finding: The SNP rs7412 was part of the genotyping process for <italic>APOE</italic> alleles, particularly focusing on distinguishing between carriers and non-carriers of the <italic>APOE</italic> ε4 allele. The findings indicated that among cognitively healthy adults, <italic>APOE</italic> ε4 carriers exhibited lower size/complexity in hippocampal subfields compared to non-carriers, particularly in the context of having a healthy Waist-Hip-Ratio.
title: Apolipoprotein ε4 modifies obesity-related atrophy in the hippocampal formation of cognitively healthy adults

finding: The SNP rs429358 was also analyzed for <italic>APOE</italic> genotyping and contributed to the classification of participants into carriers and non-carriers of the <italic>APOE</italic> ε4 allele. The results showed that <italic>APOE</italic> ε4 carriers had lower hippocampal size/complexity when compared to non-carriers, significantly impacted by obesity status, which provides an interactive effect between <italic>APOE</italic> genotype and central obesity.
title: Apolipoprotein ε4 modifies obesity-related atrophy in the hippocampal formation of cognitively healthy adults

finding: The rs641738 variant was shown to increase susceptibility to various liver diseases including non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), alcohol-associated liver disease (ALD), and hepatitis B and C virus-induced liver fibrosis. Specifically, the T-allele of rs641738 was found to correlate with impaired MBOAT7 expression and lower levels of its metabolic product PI 38:4 in cirrhotic patients, thereby linking genetic variation in MBOAT7 to liver disease progression.
title: Membrane Bound O-Acyltransferase 7 (MBOAT7) Shapes Lysosomal Lipid Homeostasis and Function to Control Alcohol-Associated Liver Injury

finding: The variant rs116843064 in the gene ANGPTL4 was associated with higher levels of HDL and triglycerides among 42,000 individuals of European ancestry. This association was further supported by a meta-analysis involving 50,000 individuals that linked this variant to fasting triglyceride levels. Additionally, earlier findings attributed rare inactivating mutations in ANGPTL4 to reduced fasting triglyceride levels and lower odds of coronary artery disease, and within the current study, 25 of 27 rare variants in ANGPTL4 were marginally associated with decreased triglyceride levels, indicating a positive finding.
title: An allelic series rare variant association test for candidate gene discovery

finding: The non-synonymous polymorphism rs10407022 (I49S), associated with raised follicular phase oestradiol, was positively correlated with AMH levels, showing a per allele difference in age-adjusted inverse normal AMH of 0.08 SD (95% CI [0.02, 0.14], P=2.8×10−3).
title: Genome-wide association study of anti-Müllerian hormone levels in pre-menopausal women of late reproductive age and relationship with genetic determinants of reproductive lifespan

finding: Variant rs10417628 (A515V), associated with premature ovarian insufficiency, was linked to lower AMH levels, exhibiting a per allele difference of -0.20 SD (95% CI [-0.35, -0.04], P=0.01).
title: Genome-wide association study of anti-Müllerian hormone levels in pre-menopausal women of late reproductive age and relationship with genetic determinants of reproductive lifespan

finding: The C allele of rs12608932 in UNC13A was found to be beneficial for patients receiving lithium carbonate in a genetic subgroup analysis. This subgroup consisted of ALS patients who were homozygous for the C allele, suggesting a genetic modulator of treatment response to lithium carbonate.
title: PP2A and GSK3 act as modifiers of FUS-ALS by modulating mitochondrial transport

finding: The rs1077667 SNP was found to be colocalized with the cis-mQTL effect for cg23071186 located within the TNFSF14 gene. This association indicated that the SNP impacts both MS susceptibility and the methylation of nearby CpGs.
title: Impact of genetic susceptibility to multiple sclerosis on the T cell epigenome: proximal and distal effects

finding: The SNP rs601338, a functional variant in the FUT2 gene leading to a stop-codon, was associated with reduced levels of Ruminococcus taxa when homozygous, indicating a connection between mucus glycan secretion and gut microbiome composition.
title: Genetics of human gut microbiome composition

finding: The rs12459419 SNP resulted in a C to T substitution, leading to the A14V mutation in CD33. This mutation promoted the expression of a shorter isoform (CD33<sup>Δ2</sup>) while decreasing the full-length CD33 surface expression (CD33<sup>FL</sup>). In pediatric AML patients, individuals with the CC genotype exhibited higher CD33 levels on AML blasts, posing a lower risk of relapse and enhanced survival compared to those with other genotypes.
title: Multiplex Base Editing to Protect from CD33-Directed Therapy: Implications for Immune and Gene Therapy

finding: The SNP rs559407214 was associated with triglyceride levels and VAT volume, signifying its role in body fat distribution and metabolic health.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: The rs2228603 variant at the NCAN gene locus was used as a proxy for TM6SF2 rs58542926, as it is in strong linkage disequilibrium with it. The study established that rs2228603 was significantly associated with hepatic fat content and NAFLD histology, reinforcing its relevance in the causal relationship between NAFLD and other metabolic traits.
title: Mendelian Randomization Analysis Dissects the Relationship between NAFLD, T2D, and Obesity and Provides Implications to Precision Medicine

finding: The rs7412 SNP was associated with body fatness independently of plasma lipids in a study focusing on middle-aged men. This finding suggested the influence of the Apolipoprotein E (APOE) polymorphism on metabolic traits, which could have implications for understanding its role in systemic metabolic changes observed in Alzheimer's disease pathways.
title: Predictive link between systemic metabolism and cytokine signatures in the brain of apolipoprotein E ε4 mice

finding:
The SNP rs429358 was associated with the apolipoprotein E (
APOE) gene, particularly regarding the presence of the ε4 allele. The study found that while ε3ε4 carriers did not exhibit fewer object location memory recalls or significantly reduced spatial precision in memory tasks compared to ε3ε3 carriers, prior literature indicated that these carriers often display deficits in spatial navigation. This suggests that while memory fidelity tasks might not effectively reveal deficits in individuals with the ε4 allele in their early to mid-60s, spatial navigation remains a pertinent marker for detecting early cognitive changes related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Memory precision of object-location binding is unimpaired in APOE ε4-carriers with spatial navigation deficits

finding: The SNP rs7412 is another critical polymorphism within the apolipoprotein E (APOE) gene, relevant to distinguishing between ε2, ε3, and ε4 alleles. Similar to the findings from rs429358, the memory fidelity tasks did not show a difference between ε3ε4 carriers and ε3ε3 carriers in recalling object locations or precision of memory in a sample cohort aged in their mid-60s. The evidence indicates that spatial navigation tasks may serve as a more sensitive measure of early cognitive impairment associated with Alzheimer's, beyond the capabilities of memory fidelity assessments for individuals with the ε4 allele.
title: Memory precision of object-location binding is unimpaired in APOE ε4-carriers with spatial navigation deficits

finding: Associated with the trans-eQTL gene TCEA1 located in an autosomal desert, indicating regulatory effects from Neandertal ancestry.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: rs2075650 was found to be significantly associated with HDL, with a p-value of 9.7e-26, indicating a strong genetic influence on this lipid trait.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: rs7254892 was significantly associated with LDL, demonstrating a p-value of 1.6e-320. This SNP was found in linkage disequilibrium with several other SNPs including rs3208856 and rs283813.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: rs7412 was significantly associated with TOTAL CHOLESTEROL, with a p-value of 1.6e-283. It showed a relationship with SNPs in linkage disequilibrium such as rs6859 and rs7254892.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: rs439401 was found to be significantly associated with TRIGS, showing a p-value of 1.4e-66. This SNP was also associated with other SNPs in linkage disequilibrium like rs75627662.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs10119 was identified as a risk variant for Alzheimer's disease, as it was regulated by multiple super-enhancers covering adjacent important genes, including APOE, TOMM40, and APOC1. Co-localization analysis revealed that rs10119 was highly ranked among causal variants, with significant binding observed in 9 out of the top-ranked 25 transcriptional regulators (TRs). Notably, REST was among the top TRs predicted, which had previously been validated for its protective role against neuronal stress and its involvement in Alzheimer's pathology. Furthermore, enhanced H3K27ac signals at rs10119 were detected in elderly and disease groups, indicating a potential epigenetic influence on Alzheimer's onset. The contextual research underscored the potential of epigenetic modifications as key factors in Alzheimer's disease mechanisms.
title: TRAPT: A multi-stage fused deep learning framework for transcriptional regulators prediction via integrating large-scale epigenomic data

finding: The SNP rs8100241 located within the ANKLE1 gene was replicated in both cohorts and was linked to multiple phenotypes in the PheWAS catalog, including associations with breast and ovarian cancer. Its allelic variants differentiated Prakriti types efficiently.
title: Genetic differences between extreme and composite constitution types from whole exome sequences reveal actionable variations

finding: The SNP rs11084300 associated with the NLRP12 gene was replicated in both cohorts and showed differences in immune response, particularly in comparisons between Vata and Pitta Prakriti types.
title: Genetic differences between extreme and composite constitution types from whole exome sequences reveal actionable variations

finding: The SNP rs2363956 was linked to PheWAS associations and was in strong linkage disequilibrium with the replicated GWAS SNP rs8100241, indicating its involvement in multiple phenotypic traits.
title: Genetic differences between extreme and composite constitution types from whole exome sequences reveal actionable variations

finding: The SNP rs769450 was significantly associated with Alzheimer's disease, showing an empirical p-value of 1.65 × 10^{-6} when analyzed using all 310 AD patients. In a clustering analysis, this SNP was found to be mapped to the second intron of the APOE gene, which corroborated prior reports regarding its critical role in Alzheimer's disease. Furthermore, within clustered modules of AD patients, the significance of rs769450 increased remarkably, demonstrating an improved p-value of 2.08 × 10^{-8}, which suggested a stronger association when patients were analyzed in clustered modules.
title: Module analysis using single-patient differential expression signatures improve the power of association study for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: rs2291668 (G/A) was identified as a candidate regulatory variant located within a protein-coding region of TNFSF14, highly linked with rs1077667 (C/T), a GWAS lead variant of multiple sclerosis. The variant increased the strength of ZNF449 binding and was associated with increased TNFSF14 expression, suggesting that it elevated risk for multiple sclerosis.
title: Functional variants in hematopoietic transcription factor footprints and their roles in the risk of immune system diseases

finding: The SNP rs2227376, resulting in a PAR4-P310L variant, was found to have significantly lower receptor reactivity. This was evidenced by reduced calcium signaling in response to PAR4-activation peptide and thrombin when analyzed in HEK293 cells. This hypo-reactive variant was hypothesized to diminish platelet responsiveness to thrombin stimulation, which was corroborated in mouse models showing reduced platelet reactivity and prolonged arterial thrombosis times.
title: A Mouse Model of the Protease Activated Receptor 4 (PAR4) Pro310Leu Variant has Reduced Platelet Reactivity

finding: The circadian gene RGL3 SNP rs167479 was pleiotropic with both systolic and diastolic blood pressure and cardiovascular disease. This underscores the role of circadian regulation in cardiovascular health.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: SNP rs73046792 in SNRNP70 was reported to be pleiotropic for smoking and systolic blood pressure, showing its involvement in behaviors that affect cardiovascular health.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: The SNP rs10411210 was significantly associated with osteoporosis (P<sub>GWAS</sub> = 1.6E-119) and showed a corresponding effect on the expression of the gene RHPN2 in a TWAS analysis (P<sub>TWAS</sub> = 4.4E-73), indicating a strong relationship between this variant and both the disease and gene expression.
title: Integrating genome-wide association and transcriptome predicted model identify novel target genes with osteoporosis

finding: The SNP rs11085226 was identified as having a negative effect on glucose-stimulated insulin secretion. This finding was based on research conducted by Heni et al. in 2012, which indicated that the polymorphism in the gene encoding polypyrimidine tract-binding protein 1 affected the insulin secretion process in response to glucose.
title: Insulin mRNA is stored in RNA granules in resting beta cells

finding: The SNP rs891204 was associated with reduced expression of OCEL1 and was identified as part of an SRS GWAS finding, indicating its relevance to the neutrophil magnifiers and the host response during sepsis. This highlights its importance in the regulatory networks associated with myeloid cell function in sepsis patients.
title: eQTLs identify regulatory networks and drivers of variation in the individual response to sepsis

finding: The rs12979860 SNP in the IFNL4 gene was the strongest predictor of minimum folding energy difference (MFED) values among individuals with hepatitis C virus (HCV). The study found that individuals with the TT genotype had significantly higher MFED values compared to those with the CC genotype, indicating greater RNA structural stability. This association was evident in both HCV genotypes 1 and 3, suggesting that the IFNL4 gene influences viral RNA structure formation, which in turn may affect the progression and response to treatment of HCV infections.
title: Impact of virus subtype and host IFNL4 genotype on large-scale RNA structure formation in the genome of hepatitis C virus

finding: The SNP rs10411210 was identified as significantly associated with colorectal cancer, indicating that it may play a role in the disease's etiology.
title: The timing of human adaptation from Neanderthal introgression

finding: Finding confirmed the presence of the APOE-\u03B5;4 genotype in clones TOB0002c1, TOB0064, and TOB0121 through Sanger sequencing, indicating that these lines were associated with an increased risk of developing Alzheimer's disease. This allele was directly related to the studies involving cerebral organoids which were utilized to investigate Alzheimer's pathology.
title: Investigating the role of APOE: limitations of human pluripotent stem cell-derived cerebral organoids

finding: Sanger sequencing revealed the APOE-\u03B5;4 genotype in TOB0002c1, TOB0064, and TOB0121 and the APOE-\u03B5;3/3 genotype in MBE2968 c1 and c2. This SNP was important to establish the genetic background of the studied cell lines, particularly in relation to their relevance to Alzheimer's disease pathology in the organoid models.
title: Investigating the role of APOE: limitations of human pluripotent stem cell-derived cerebral organoids

finding: The variant rs117316645 was identified as the most significant AD risk SNP within the ATAC peak region located on chromosome 19 at the bin chr19:44,950,000-44,960,000. This SNP held a p-value of less than 4.8×10−24 and resided within a chromatin interaction that connected it to the APOE gene locus, which is recognized as a major genetic driver for amyloid pathology associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD). The findings indicated that this chromatin loop reflects potential disruptions in astrocyte function regarding amyloid-β clearance.
title: Efficient pre-processing of Single-cell ATAC-seq data

finding: The rs339392 variant was located within the C3 promoter and was associated with chromatin activity at the C3 locus. It impacted the expression levels of C3 and TNFSF14 in LCLs, while also acting as an eQTL, confirming its role in gene regulation.
title: Non-coding variants impact cis-regulatory coordination in a cell type-specific manner

finding: The rs7247241 SNP was found to significantly impact SPINT2 gene expression in the 22Rv1 cell line, displaying multiome significance and corroborating its established role in influencing proximal genome methylation from previous studies.
title: Identify Regulatory eQTLs by Multiome Sequencing in Prostate Single Cells

finding: The finding related to rs11672691 indicated that this SNP contributed to oncogenic regulatory circuits associated with prostate cancer aggressiveness. The study highlighted that variations at this locus were implicated in the modulation of cancer-related pathways, enhancing the understanding of the genetic factors influencing the severity of prostate cancer.
title: A live cell protein complementation assay for ORFeome-wide probing of human HOX interactomes

finding: The SNP rs58542926 was associated with hepatic complications in context with diabetes, establishing its relevance in metabolic disorders.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The lead SNP rs138596065 on chromosome 19 was linked to the vertical component of brain asymmetry as well. This SNP had an additive effect of -5.50 for increasing GC alleles, with a p-value of 3.74e-08 and a minor allele frequency of 8.28%.
title: Handedness and Other Variables Associated with Human Brain Asymmetrical Skew

finding: The variant rs429358 was found to contribute to genetic risk factors for Alzheimer's disease (AD), specifically influencing brain aging markers in cognitively unimpaired participants across various age ranges. This association suggested that individuals with certain genotypes at this locus showed accelerated functional brain aging, which is relevant in the context of pre-symptomatic AD.
title: Functional brain age prediction suggests accelerated aging in preclinical familial Alzheimer’s disease, irrespective of fibrillar amyloid-beta pathology

finding: The rs7412 SNP was identified as another important genetic determinant linked to Alzheimer's disease risk. Similar to rs429358, this SNP was associated with accelerated brain aging phenomena, reinforcing its relevance in the predictive model concerning genetic influences on brain aging and amyloid pathology in the context of pre-symptomatic Alzheimer's disease.
title: Functional brain age prediction suggests accelerated aging in preclinical familial Alzheimer’s disease, irrespective of fibrillar amyloid-beta pathology

finding: The rs429358 SNP, a missense mutation in the APOE gene, was identified as a significant locus associated with the participation phenotype in the Mental Health Questionnaire (MHQ). The C allele of rs429358 served as a marker for the APOE-ε4 genotype, which was found to negatively impact the likelihood of participation in the MHQ. Specifically, for each additional ε4 copy, the odds ratio was 1.029 ± 0.0057 SE, indicating that individuals with more copies of the APOE-ε4 allele were less likely to engage in follow-up surveys related to mental health. This finding linked the genetic variant to reduced participation in mental health studies and provided insights into its role alongside other related cognitive and mental health phenotypes.
title: Factors associated with sharing email information and mental health survey participation in large population cohorts

finding: The SNP rs581623 was recognized as a regulatory variant within the KIR region, affecting the expression of multiple genes in a trans regulatory network, thereby implicating it in NK cell activity and immune regulation.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: Neighboring the TOMM40 gene, rs34404554 was found to influence amplitude traits significantly, consistent with its role in dementia-related phenotypes.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: Located in the TOMM40 region, rs157582 was associated with amplitude traits, linking it to dementia and cognitive decline.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: The SNP rs157592 in the APOC1 gene was involved in significant associations with amplitude traits in networks crucial for cognitive functions.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: The SNP rs492602 was found to be an eQTL for the gene FUT2 and was highlighted as a GWAS hit related to psoriasis. The identification of this SNP as an eQTL emphasized its role in psoriasis, supporting its relevance in disease mechanisms.
title: BaseQTL: a Bayesian method to detect eQTLs from RNA-seq data with or without genotypes

finding: The SNP rs429358, located within the codon for amino acid 112 in the apolipoprotein E gene, differed between ApoE4 and ApoE3 where it coded for arginine in E4 and cysteine in E3. The study successfully utilized CRISPR technology, specifically cytosine base editing, to edit ApoE4 to ApoE3 in vitro, evidencing the potential to mitigate neurotoxic effects associated with the E4 allele. Further, functional editing was noted as the in vivo experiment demonstrated the presence of E3 mRNA in both brain and liver five days after treatment, indicating the successful editing of rs429358.
title: Successful Gene Editing of Apolipoprotein E4 to E3 in Brain of Alzheimer Model Mice After a Single IV Dose of Synthetic Exosome-Delivered CRISPR

finding: The SNP rs36259 at locus 19p13.2, located within the CERS4 gene, was nearing genome-wide significance and may influence sphingolipid biosynthesis linked to MacTel.
title: Genetic Disruption of Serine Biosynthesis is a Key Driver of Macular Telangiectasia Type 2 Etiology and Progression

finding: The intergenic SNP rs4804075 at locus 19p13.2 showed nominal significance and was implicated in the genetic predisposition to MacTel, although lacking significant eQTL effects.
title: Genetic Disruption of Serine Biosynthesis is a Key Driver of Macular Telangiectasia Type 2 Etiology and Progression

finding: The variant rs12973192 was found to lie 16 base pairs inside a cryptic exon (CE) of UNC13A. It was specifically linked to an increase in cryptic exon inclusion upon TDP-43 knockdown in cultured cells and patient brains. The significant association of this SNP with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) and frontotemporal dementia (FTD) was demonstrated through assessments of UNC13A CE levels in genotyped cases.
title: Common ALS/FTD risk variants in UNC13A exacerbate its cryptic splicing and loss upon TDP-43 mislocalization

finding: The intronic SNP rs12608932 was positioned 534 base pairs downstream of the donor splice site of the CE in UNC13A. This SNP similarly contributed to enhanced CE splicing in homozygous risk variant cases. The study showed that both rs12608932 and the CE variant rs12973192 increased the sensitivity of UNC13A's cryptic exon to TDP-43 depletion, providing a genetic basis for their role in ALS/FTD.
title: Common ALS/FTD risk variants in UNC13A exacerbate its cryptic splicing and loss upon TDP-43 mislocalization

finding: Evidence indicated that rs3865444 was associated with the ASE of CD33, particularly affecting the second exon in monocytes (p=4.52E-12), which corroborated previous findings linking this variant to splicing events.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: The APOE ε4 variant (rs429358-C) was found to reduce APOE expression across all examined brain regions, even in healthy control samples, demonstrating a consistent negative regulatory effect irrespective of AD status.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: The association revealed that this exonic variant measured the ASE of APOE, indicating it has a role in regulating APOE expression differently across its transcripts.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: Identified as an eQTL of CD33, this SNP contributed to the understanding of splicing events related to the gene in AD pathophysiology.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: The rs12720270 variant, located in intron 7 of TYK2, was found to be associated with protection from systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) in UK families and the Finnish population. This association suggests that this variant is not neutral but may have a significant impact on autoimmune disease susceptibility.
title: Two common disease-associated TYK2 variants impact exon splicing and TYK2 dosage

finding: The rs2304256 variant, a non-synonymous mutation causing a valine to phenylalanine substitution in exon 8 of TYK2, was shown to enhance exon 8 inclusion in splicing. This variant was associated with protection from several autoimmune diseases, including SLE and psoriasis, indicating its relevance in disease susceptibility.
title: Two common disease-associated TYK2 variants impact exon splicing and TYK2 dosage

finding: The rs12720356 variant (I684S) was previously reported to be protective for certain autoimmune diseases, suggesting a complex role in modulating disease risk, although its specific contributions to signaling and disease mechanisms require further investigation.
title: Two common disease-associated TYK2 variants impact exon splicing and TYK2 dosage

finding: The rs34536443 variant (P1104A) has been identified as a hypomorphic allele that confers risk for mycobacterial infections and reduced signaling in immune cells, linking it to a predisposition for tuberculosis and other inflammatory conditions.
title: Two common disease-associated TYK2 variants impact exon splicing and TYK2 dosage

finding: The minor allele of SNP rs11668344 was associated with earlier age at menopause and increased age acceleration, according to a study by Levine and colleagues that analyzed data from the Women’s Health Initiative (WHI). This finding connected the SNP to biological aging indicators.
title: Markers, Mechanisms and Metrics of Biological Aging: A Scoping Review

finding: The SNP rs641738 in the MBOAT7 gene was found to be associated with increased severity of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and progression to nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH). This C>T variant was characterized as a loss-of-function mutation leading to decreased MBOAT7 expression. Previous studies indicated that individuals carrying this variant displayed greater hepatic steatosis and fibrosis, and it is widely recognized as a genetic risk allele for NASH.
title: Enhancing Hepatic MBOAT7 Expression Does Not Improve Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis in Mice

finding: The rs58542926 C>T variant in TM6SF2 also played a critical role demonstrating similar detrimental effects on mitochondrial function and physiology in individuals with the TT genotype. Analysis showed these carriers had significantly lower mitochondrial complex activities and increased oxidative stress, reflecting similar patterns found in the PNPLA3 variant carriers.
title: Serum mitochondrial bioenergetics as fingerprint of the hepatic one: how to monitor genetic MASLD

finding: The rs641738 C>T variant in MBOAT7 was shown to increase the severity of MASLD, particularly in those with the TT genotype. This variant was associated with marked reductions in mitochondrial functionality, evidencing an exacerbated decline in OCR and heightened cellular stress responses, paralleling observations made for the other identified risk variants.
title: Serum mitochondrial bioenergetics as fingerprint of the hepatic one: how to monitor genetic MASLD

finding: A major Alzheimer's disease locus that correlated with numerous health factors in the UK Biobank, including cholesterol levels and cognitive decline.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: Individuals with the G allele of rs8103990 within ZNF729 exhibited higher liking scores for potato chips than those with the other allele, also with a p-value less than 1x10^-5. This provided further evidence of genetic factors affecting dietary fat preference.
title: Studies of human twins reveal genetic variation that affects dietary fat perception

finding: The PTPRS rs10415488 variant C was identified as a neuroprotective factor against early tau pathology and synaptic degeneration in Alzheimer's disease (AD). Carriers of this variant demonstrated a significant correlation with lower P-tau181 levels and higher PTPRS transcript abundance in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). Additionally, it was found that male carriers of the C allele had a delay of approximately ten months in the onset of AD. The variant was associated with increased cortical volumes in the entorhinal cortex, indicating a potential protective effect early in the disease progression.
title: PTPRS is a novel marker for early tau pathology and synaptic integrity in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs1064395, located in the NCAN gene, was identified as a genetic risk factor for bipolar disorder, particularly linked to the manic phenotype and schizophrenia. The association was supported by genome-wide association studies (GWAS). Furthermore, post mortem eQTL analyses indicated that this polymorphism might correlate with slightly increased levels of Ncan in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, which aligns with data suggesting that variations in Ncan levels may influence neuronal activity and behaviors associated with these psychiatric disorders.
title: Neurocan regulates axon initial segment organization and neuronal activity in cultured cortical neurons

finding: The analysis indicated that the presence of the rs429358 SNP was associated with significant negative performance in hippocampal CA1 down-regulation during the neurofeedback task. This finding highlighted the impact of APOE-ε4 alleles on neurofeedback performance related to hippocampal self-regulation, thereby linking a genetic risk factor to alterations in cognitive function in individuals at risk for Alzheimer's disease.
title: The effect of APOE genotype and streamline density volume, on hippocampal CA1 down-regulation: a real-time fMRI virtual reality neurofeedback study

finding: The findings revealed that the rs7412 SNP also contributed to the genetic risk factor associated with hippocampal performance in neurofeedback tasks. This SNP was found to correlate with decreased hippocampal streamline density volume, which negatively affected down-regulation performance. Thus, it demonstrated a relationship between the genetic profile of participants and hippocampal function in the context of cognitive tasks pertinent to preclinical Alzheimer's disease.
title: The effect of APOE genotype and streamline density volume, on hippocampal CA1 down-regulation: a real-time fMRI virtual reality neurofeedback study

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as a significant variant defining the apolipoprotein E (APOE) ε4 allele. This allele is linked to increased risk of cognitive decline and early Alzheimer's disease pathology, including neurofibrillary tau tangle deposition in the entorhinal cortex. Such findings indicate the potential of rs429358 as a biomarker for early cognitive impairment.
title: Alteration of perivascular spaces in early cognitive decline

finding: The SNP rs7412, which also defines the apolipoprotein E (APOE) ε alleles, was genotyped alongside rs429358. Variants at this locus were correlated with the presence of the ε2 and ε3 alleles, which have been suggested to offer protective effects against cognitive decline compared to the ε4 allele. This position emphasizes the role of the APOE genotype in modulating cognitive resilience and vulnerability in aging individuals.
title: Alteration of perivascular spaces in early cognitive decline

finding: The rs641738 variant of MBOAT7 was reported to increase inflammation and fibrosis in chronic hepatitis B, as evidenced by findings from Thabet et al. in 2017. This SNP was also associated with an increased risk of liver inflammation and transition to fibrosis in chronic hepatitis C according to another study by Thabet et al. in 2016. Moreover, Mancina et al. (2016) found that the same variant increased the risk of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease in individuals of European descent. Additionally, Luukkonen et al. (2016) demonstrated that the rs641738 variant altered hepatic phosphatidylinositols and increased the severity of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease in humans. Lastly, Donati et al. (2017) studied the rs641738 variant in the context of hepatocellular carcinoma in non-cirrhotic individuals, linking the SNP to cancer risk.
title: The structure, catalytic mechanism, and inhibitor identification of phosphatidylinositol remodeling MBOAT7

finding: The SNP rs117385980 was associated with longevity and healthy aging in a study focusing on Finnish men. This finding suggested a potential role of SIRT6 polymorphism in promoting longer life spans and well-being during aging, which ties into the broader context of genetics and aging research.
title: The accumulation of lncRNAs in hybrid with DNA in patients with psoriasis reveals a decrease in the levels of RNase HII transcripts in the skin

finding: The SNP rs6511720 was linked to LDL (low-density lipoprotein) and was discovered by various previous studies, highlighting its relevance in the context of lipid traits.
title: Leveraging allelic heterogeneity to increase power of association testing

finding: The SNP rs2288911 demonstrated a novel microglia-specific eQTL effect that was associated with increased expression of APOE in microglia. This variant was linked to greater cerebral amyloid angiopathy (CAA) while showing no association with Alzheimer's disease pathology, indicating a distinct mechanism of action compared to the well-established APOE epsilon 4 risk haplotype.
title: Cell-subtype specific effects of genetic variation in the aging and Alzheimer cortex

finding: The SNP rs429358 was a positive original finding in relation to Alzheimer’s disease (AD) risk factors and white matter (WM) microstructure. In the context of APOE4 genotype, participants with the E4 allele exhibited a distinct risk pattern that was linked to cognitive performance, particularly in immediate memory. This indicated that the presence of the E4 allele affected the negative impact of certain cardiometabolic risk factors on WM integrity.
title: Sex and APOE4-specific links between cardiometabolic risk factors and white matter alterations in individuals with a family history of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also identified as a positive original finding associated with Alzheimer’s disease risk factors and white matter (WM) alterations. Similar to rs429358, it was part of the analysis that linked APOE genotype to different response patterns to cardiometabolic risks, influencing cognitive decline measures. The study highlighted the role of this SNP in the broader context of AD and its impact on cognitive performance.
title: Sex and APOE4-specific links between cardiometabolic risk factors and white matter alterations in individuals with a family history of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The study introduced the rs7412 SNP (R158C) into the apolipoprotein E (APOE) transcript, aiming to transfer the non-preferred ε3 allele, which is common among approximately 78% of Caucasian carriers, into the protective ε2 allele. The protective ε2 allele was shown to significantly reduce the risk for atherosclerosis. Despite the efforts, the editing yield achieved was only 14% due to the high GC content surrounding the target sequence. However, this yield still clearly outperformed the Cas13 tool used for comparison.
title: Precise and efficient C-to-U RNA Base Editing with SNAP-CDAR-S

finding: The rs7412 SNP at the APOE locus showed a strong association with biological age (ΔAge), with a p-value of 4.4×10^-33. This SNP is recognized as a risk factor for Alzheimer's disease and coronary heart disease, signifying its importance in the context of aging and age-related diseases.
title: A mathematical model that predicts human biological age from physiological traits identifies environmental and genetic factors that influence aging

finding: The rs492602 variant, which confers monogenic resistance to infections with norovirus and respiratory viruses, was linked with an increase in IBD risk.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The TYK2 variant (rs34536443) was identified as one of the negatively selected variants impacting immune system functions.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The study presented the cell lines generated from the iPSC line BIONi010-C, involving deliberate editing of SNP rs429358 in Exon 4 to create isogenic lines with genotypes APOE-ε4/ε4 (rs429358 C/C) and APOE-ε3/ε3 (rs429358 T/T). The editing was examined to study its role in Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk, as the C allele was associated with increased risk for sporadic AD.
title: Verification of CRISPR editing by Xdrop™ Indirect Sequence Capture followed by short- and long- read sequencing

finding: SNP rs7412 was also edited in Exon 4 along with rs429358 to produce cell lines for investigating the impact of APOE haplotypes on AD. The edited alleles created the APOE genotype variations, where the C allele at rs7412 was associated with a higher risk for AD, underscoring the significance of both rs7412 and rs429358 in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Verification of CRISPR editing by Xdrop™ Indirect Sequence Capture followed by short- and long- read sequencing

finding: The SNP rs139412173 on chromosome 19 also colocalized with retinal edQTLs and was implicated in MacTel. The associated editing change affected a gene related to ceramide synthesis pathways.
title: The retinal RNA editome is concentrated in photoreceptor-specific genes and genetically linked to vision loss

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with Alzheimer’s disease risk estimation, where 23andMe and Gencove indicated higher genetic risks with one minor allele present. However, AncestryDNA reported two reference alleles suggesting no elevated risk.
title: Genotype Concordance and Polygenic Risk Score Estimation across Consumer Genetic Testing Data

finding: For SNP rs7412, both 23andMe and Gencove provided the genotype of two reference alleles, indicating the subject as likely being APOE ε3/ε4. AncestryDNA, however, reported a missing genotype, leading to discordance in estimating the APOE genotype.
title: Genotype Concordance and Polygenic Risk Score Estimation across Consumer Genetic Testing Data

finding: The SNP rs58542926, located on chromosome 19, was identified in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) related to liver fat, with an extremely significant p-value of 8.8×10^-113. It was linked to inflammatory processes and cancer, with prior associations made with liver disease—specifically, hepatic fibrosis progression in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
title: The role of liver fat in cardiometabolic diseases is highlighted by genome-wide association study of MRI-derived measures of body composition

finding: The SNP rs2304205 was highlighted as the most plausible causal variant in a credible set associated with schizophrenia (SCZ). It had high MetaChrom scores across almost all cell types examined, particularly in both fetal and adult stages. The SNP is located in the UTR regions of the genes IRF3 and BCL2L12, with IRF3 identified as the likely target gene in brain expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) data. IRF3 is acknowledged as a key regulator in the innate immune system and is proposed as a risk gene for SCZ due to its role in neuronal progenitor cell development.
title: Predicting Epigenomic Functions of Genetic Variants in the Context of Neurodevelopment via Deep Transfer Learning

finding: The SNP rs641738 was identified as a variant in the MBOAT7-TMC4 gene that increased the risk of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) in individuals of European descent. This finding was part of a broader analysis of transcriptomic data in patients with metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD), providing insight into genetic factors influencing liver disease progression.
title: MegaMASLD: An interactive platform for exploring stratified transcriptomic signatures in MASLD progression

finding: The analysis demonstrated that polymorphisms in the APOE gene, specifically haplotypes associated with this SNP, had significant correlations with chronic pain phenotypes. The allele combinations for this SNP were shown to provide insights into the risk of developing chronic pain, with significant p-values reported for pain states such as back pain and knee pain particularly for the ε4 haplotype.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing reveals time- and sex-specific responses of spinal cord microglia to peripheral nerve injury and links ApoE to neuropathic pain

finding: Similar to rs429358, this SNP was associated with haplotypes linked to chronic pain phenotypes. The findings supported its relevance in pain sensation and the development of persistent pain states, especially when analyzed in conjunction with overall haplotypic effects on various pain conditions. The significant associations with chronic pain states were also replicated in neuropathic pain conditions.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing reveals time- and sex-specific responses of spinal cord microglia to peripheral nerve injury and links ApoE to neuropathic pain

finding: The variant rs111362352 exhibited a significant association with low-grade prostate cancer but not with high-grade disease, relating to its earlier findings at KLK3.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: Located within the PTGER1 gene on 19p13.12, rs74956940 was associated with the regulation of urine osmotic pressure, thus playing a role in nephrolithiasis.
title: GWAS identifies nine nephrolithiasis susceptibility loci related with metabolic metabolic and crystallization pathways

finding: The SNP rs4897946 was identified as an instrumental variable (IV) SNP for the family Barnesiellaceae, associated with trunk fat mass (TFM) at a nominal significance level during the discovery phase of the study. This SNP is located in the intron region of the MIER2 gene on chromosome 19, and it was reported with a beta coefficient of -3.81×10⁻⁴ and a p-value of 1.96×10⁻³.
title: Mendelian randomization analysis revealed causal effects from gut microbiota to abdominal obesity

finding: The rs429358 SNP was associated with CpG island regulatory evidence for the APOE gene, which is a known risk factor for Alzheimer's disease (AD). This SNP was identified as a key contributor to the increased risk of AD.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs7412 SNP had a similar association with the APOE gene as rs429358, reinforcing its role in the regulatory evidence of AD risk.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was linked to histone modification regulatory evidence for APOE, supporting its involvement in Alzheimer's disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs769449 SNP was shown to contribute to the promoter regulatory elements in APOE, highlighting its importance in Alzheimer's disease mechanisms.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP provided regulatory evidence linked to the promoter flanking regions of the APOE gene, suggesting a specific role in Alzheimer’s disease risk.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs28469095 SNP was linked to regulatory evidence involving a CpG island for the MARK4 gene, underscoring its potential role in AD pathology.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was associated with CTCF binding sites for MARK4, indicating its relevance in Alzheimer’s disease risk.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs536518226 SNP was identified as an enhancer element for MARK4, linking it to genetic risk factors associated with AD.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was linked to eQTLs for MARK4, showing its connection to gene expression alterations relevant to Alzheimer’s disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs9653111 SNP was associated with histone modification evidence for MARK4, reinforcing its potential role in Alzheimer's disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was connected to histone modifications and promoter flanking regions of MARK4, emphasizing its potential involvement in AD.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs138137383 SNP was associated with open chromatin and promoter flanking regions for MARK4, highlighting its relevance in Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs4420638 showed significant associations in European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American ancestry cohorts, indicating its relevance in the context of C-reactive protein levels.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: This SNP led to a missense variant that changed glutamic acid (E) to lysine (K) in the FUT6 gene, resulting in an inactive enzyme. It was significant in the study of transferrin glycosylation.
title: Same role but different actors: genetic regulation of post-translational modification of two distinct proteins

finding: The missense variant rs7412 in the APOE gene was identified as associated with low-density lipoprotein (LDL) levels with a p-value of 2.86 x 10^-14 in the Korea4K dataset. Its association with cholesterol levels had been well-established prior, which underscores its role in lipid metabolism and cardiovascular risk.
title: Korea4K: whole genome sequences of 4,157 Koreans with 107 phenotypes derived from extensive health check-ups

finding: The G allele of rs11540855 was shown to be preferentially bound by hsa-miR-4707-3p in the MCF116 breast cancer cell line, which led to decreased luciferase activity and reduced ABHD8 protein levels. This was corroborated by predictions from TargetScan.
title: Allele-specific miRNA-binding analysis identifies candidate target genes for breast cancer risk

finding: The reference C allele of rs4808616 was predicted to promote hsa-miR-7705 binding, supporting the hypothesis that altered expression of ABHD8 could contribute to breast cancer risk.
title: Allele-specific miRNA-binding analysis identifies candidate target genes for breast cancer risk

finding: rs2385088 showed preferential binding to hsa-miR-6842-5p but was in concordance with higher expression of the G allele, which is associated with risk through modulation of ISYNA1.
title: Allele-specific miRNA-binding analysis identifies candidate target genes for breast cancer risk

finding: The SNP rs12608932 was associated with increased risk of sporadic ALS and FTLD-TDP pathology, particularly the Type B subtype linked to FTD-ALS. It was also shown to correlate with shorter survival times in ALS patients. Genetic analysis indicated that this SNP, alongside rs12973192, was located in the intron harboring a cryptic exon in the UNC13A mRNA, influencing splicing events under conditions of TDP-43 depletion.
title: TDP-43 represses cryptic exon inclusion in FTD/ALS gene UNC13A

finding: The SNP rs12973192 was found to be significantly associated with susceptibility to ALS and FTD, particularly influencing cryptic exon inclusion in UNC13A mRNA. The analysis demonstrated that patients who were homozygous or heterozygous for the risk allele (C/G or G/G) exhibited higher rates of cryptic exon inclusion compared to those homozygous for the reference allele (C/C). This SNP was located within the cryptic exon itself and its variants increased splicing upon TDP-43 dysfunction.
title: TDP-43 represses cryptic exon inclusion in FTD/ALS gene UNC13A

finding: The study identified the influence of the missense variant rs35033974 on the protein associations in human spermatozoa. This variant was determined to be homozygous in the analyzed samples, which allowed for connections to be made between TEX101-associated proteins and their functional roles. The findings suggested that this SNP might play a significant role in fertility-related phenotypes due to its impact on spermatozoa protein composition.
title: The proteomic toolbox for identification, quantification, and characterization of polyclonal antibodies

finding: The A allele at rs12462018 increased the dexamethasone suppressive effect on the expression of the IRF3 gene in B cells treated with PHA+DEX. IRF3 is a transcription factor that regulates type I IFN genes and is implicated in systemic lupus erythematosus.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: CD33-rs3865444 was confirmed to have a genome-wide significant association with LOAD with an odds ratio of 0.92 and a p-value of 3.61 x 10^-8, highlighting its relevance in AD research.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: APOE-rs429358 was the only SNP to achieve genome-wide significance in the GR@ACE study, with a strong association to AD (OR = 2.27) and a p-value of 1.25 x 10^-62, thereby reinforcing its critical role as a genetic risk factor.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: The SNP rs7412 had positive findings with a 90% concordance rate between Gencall and imputed genotypes and an 85% concordance rate between Gencall and WGS genotypes. This SNP is associated with the APOE E2 allele and indicates a reliable genotype prediction at this location.
title: Cluster Buster: A Machine Learning Algorithm for Genotyping SNPs from Raw Data

finding: The SNP rs429358 exhibited low rates of concordance, specifically 78.9% with imputed genotypes and 68.8% with WGS genotypes. Despite its association with the APOE E4 allele, it demonstrated significant discrepancies in genotype clustering, indicating challenges in reliable prediction and potential issues with imputation.
title: Cluster Buster: A Machine Learning Algorithm for Genotyping SNPs from Raw Data

finding: The study described a single nucleic acid difference at rs429358, which involved a thymine to cytosine change resulting in an amino acid change from cysteine at position 130 to arginine in the APOE protein. This SNP is critical as it differentiates between the APOEε3 and APOEε4 alleles, with APOEε4 identified as a major genetic risk factor for Late Onset Alzheimer’s Disease (LOAD) and vascular dementia.
title: APOEε3/ε4 and APOEε4/ε4 genotypes drive unique gene signatures in the cortex of young mice

finding: The study highlighted that rs7412 defined the presence of arginine at amino acid position 176 in the APOE protein, which is consistent with the genotype for APOEε4. This SNP's presence contributes to the assessment of genetic risk, as APOEε4 carriers are at a significantly increased risk for developing LOAD.
title: APOEε3/ε4 and APOEε4/ε4 genotypes drive unique gene signatures in the cortex of young mice

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the APOE genotyping process, distinguishing between the APOE alleles epsilon 2, epsilon 3, and epsilon 4. This context was relevant as APOE genotypes have been implicated in the risk and progression of Alzheimer's Disease (AD), but the specific findings did not confirm a direct correlation between HSV infection and altered APOE-related pathology in AD.
title: No evidence for aberrant expression of amyloid β and phosphorylated tau proteins in herpes simplex virus-infected human neurons in vivo
