finding: The SNP rs7412 was part of the APOE genotyping performed, which helped identify the expression of APOE alleles epsilon 2, epsilon 3, and epsilon 4. Similar to rs429358, while this SNP is significant in the context of Alzheimer's Disease risk, the study findings indicated no direct association between HSV infection and changes in Aβ or pTau protein expression linked with this SNP.
title: No evidence for aberrant expression of amyloid β and phosphorylated tau proteins in herpes simplex virus-infected human neurons in vivo

finding: Located approximately 300bp upstream of GIPC1, the rs3760702 SNP was linked to the regulation of CaSR-mediated endocytosis, implicating it in kidney stone formation.
title: Genetic variants of calcium and vitamin D metabolism in kidney stone disease

finding: The SNP rs35033974 was associated with the identification of TEX101-associated proteins in a study that explored the proteomic measurement of human spermatozoa. The research was significant as it utilized homozygous spermatozoa for the missense variant, thereby linking this genetic variation to specific protein interactions essential for understanding male fertility and the molecular pathways involved.
title: Mapping Isoform Abundance and Interactome of the Endogenous TMPRSS2-ERG Fusion Protein with Orthogonal Immunoprecipitation-Mass Spectrometry Assays

finding: The SNP rs17766692 was part of the 13 novel SNPs and was highly correlated with other lipid associations present in the GWAS Catalog. Its functional implications or direct associations with specific lipid traits were not explicitly stated.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: The variant rs641738 in MBOAT7 was positively associated with all-cause cirrhosis, showing that it likely plays a role in the genetic predisposition to liver diseases.
title: A missense variant in Mitochondrial Amidoxime Reducing Component 1 gene and protection against liver disease

finding: This SNP was confirmed to regulate the expression of MAP1S, a gene associated with coronary artery disease (CAD). It was identified through CRISPRi experiments, demonstrating a 1.5-2-fold reduction in gene expression when targeted.
title: Comprehensive identification of coronary artery disease-associated variants regulating vascular smooth muscle cell gene expression

finding: The missense variant rs4760 affected the level of TNFRSF10C, residing on chromosome 19 with a MAF of 0.18 and a highly significant P-value of 4.60 × 10^-56.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: An intronic variant, rs56075200, was associated with IL27 protein levels, displaying a MAF of 0.32 and a P-value of 8.62 × 10^-35.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: The missense variant rs7412 had trans associations related to LDLR protein levels, significantly affecting various metabolic traits.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: The variant rs10415777 was the most implicated in histone modifications, serving as a cis-pQTL for OSCAR.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: rs7246757 demonstrated colocalization with SNRPD2 in CD14+ monocytes of acute COVID-19 patients, which had been implicated in protein-protein interaction networks related to SARS-CoV-2 infection, indicating its significance in clinical severity.
title: Widespread gene-environment interactions shape the immune response to SARS-CoV-2 infection in hospitalized COVID-19 patients

finding: The SNP rs8100847 was associated with studies that utilized ordinary digital cameras in place of near-infrared sensors to derive vegetation indices linked to phenology in high arctic vegetation. This finding indicated that the use of alternative imaging technologies can yield similar insights into vegetation characteristics as traditional methods.
title: Pixel walking along the boreal forest–Arctic tundra ecotone: Large scale ground-truthing of satellite-derived greenness (NDVI)

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with Alzheimer’s disease. The longevity beneficial allele T was linked to an increased risk for type 2 diabetes, while the alternative allele C was associated with an increased risk of AD.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: This SNP, located in the APOC1 gene, was strongly associated with Alzheimer’s disease and was found in strong linkage equilibrium with rs429358.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: In ZFP82, the SNP rs190169579, also predicted to negatively affect pseudoexon splicing, was shown to result in a greater proportion of canonical ZFP82 transcript upon treatment with branaplam in LCLs carrying the minor allele.
title: PMS1 as a target for splice modulation to prevent somatic CAG repeat expansion in Huntington’s disease

finding: The SNP rs8108632 encompassed by lncRNA 37844.7 located in the TGFB1 gene was implicated as likely regulatory, associated with the TGFbeta trait which plays a role in pro-differentiation mechanisms relevant to CAD.
title: LncRNA de novo discovery reveals noncoding RNAs as major molecular mechanism associating coronary artery disease GWAS variants with causal genes to confer disease risk

finding: The IFNL4 SNP rs12979860 was associated with clearance of hepatitis C virus and other RNA viruses targeting the upper respiratory system, with the T allele being overexpressed in COVID-19 patients, marking it as a potential risk factor for the disease.
title: Semantic and population analysis of the genetic targets related to COVID-19 and its association with genes and diseases

finding: A 55-bp duplication at 19q13.11 was identified to be in strong LD with rs66528626 and was associated with serum albumin levels (P=4.00×10−9). This provided evidence of a structural variant impacting serum albumin concentrations.
title: Structural variation across 138,134 samples in the TOPMed consortium

finding: Identified as the SNP with the smallest SCAMPI p-value, rs445925 located on ApoC1 was involved in the analysis of four lipid-related traits, highlighting its potential association with lipid metabolism.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: Detected exclusively through correlation analysis, rs2228603 in NCAN showed a significant effect on the relationship between BMI and triglycerides, although not on their variances, and has previous associations with triglycerides.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: This SNP in TM6SF2 was similarly identified through correlation effects between BMI and triglycerides and has also been implicated in hepatic steatosis, fibrosis, and serum lipids.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: rs10415849 was associated with an interaction effect with biological sex influencing BMI, and it was identified via correlations between BMI and triglycerides.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: rs519113 in the BCL3-PVRL2-TOMM40 gene region indicated potential gene-gene and gene-environment interactions on dyslipidemia, reflecting significant findings in previous studies.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: Another SNP in BCL3-PVRL2-TOMM40, rs6859, also implied interactions on dyslipidemia and has been noted in literature for its roles in lipid metabolism.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: Well-known as a predictor in Alzheimer's disease, rs3852860 showed indications of HDL changes associated with Alzheimer's, although not having direct associations with HDL itself documented.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: Found within the APOE gene, rs440446 was retained as significant after adjusting for APOE genotypes, indicating an independent association with lipid traits.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: This SNP in the APOE gene region was significant even after conditioning on other APOE SNPs, highlighting its impact on lipid traits.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: Like the others in the APOE region, rs769450 maintained significance after adjustment, implying its relevance in the study of lipid metabolism.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: This well-known SNP in APOE remained significant after adjusting for the main and variance effects of other APOE SNPs, reinforcing its importance in lipid trait associations.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: Included in significant associations after adjusting for other SNPs in the APOE region, rs7412 continues to be a critical SNP in research on lipid traits.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: After adjusting for the effects of APOE SNPs, rs55791371 located near LDLR emerged with a low SCAMPI p-value, indicating its importance in the context of lipid trait analysis.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: This SNP was associated with lower circulating GDF15 levels in the non-pregnant state, with a standardized beta estimate of -0.34. It was part of a study that analyzed GDF15 levels in 18,184 participants from the Generation Scotland Study, showing a strong correlation with the risk of Hyperemesis Gravidarum (HG).
title: Fetally-encoded GDF15 and maternal GDF15 sensitivity are major determinants of nausea and vomiting in human pregnancy

finding: Similar to rs1054221, this SNP was found to have a standardized beta estimate of -0.34 for its association with lower circulating GDF15 levels in the non-pregnant state. Alongside other variants, it contributed to the understanding of HG's genetic underpinnings as part of a larger analysis involving 18,184 participants.
title: Fetally-encoded GDF15 and maternal GDF15 sensitivity are major determinants of nausea and vomiting in human pregnancy

finding: This SNP was identified as one of the two signals that colocalized with HG risk and reduced levels of GDF15 in the non-pregnant state, indicating its potential role in contributing to variations in HG susceptibility.
title: Fetally-encoded GDF15 and maternal GDF15 sensitivity are major determinants of nausea and vomiting in human pregnancy

finding: The C211G rare variant was found to markedly impair GDF15 secretion, leading to low circulating levels of GDF15 in non-pregnant individuals. It was associated with a strong predisposition to Hyperemesis Gravidarum, especially when the fetus was wild-type.
title: Fetally-encoded GDF15 and maternal GDF15 sensitivity are major determinants of nausea and vomiting in human pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the presence of the APOE ε4 allele, which had a frequency of 17.6% in the studied cohort. This finding was consistent with prior results in the Spanish population, indicating its relevance in predicting cognitive decline.
title: Predicting the future development of mild cognitive impairment in the cognitively healthy elderly

finding: Similar to rs429358, the SNP rs7412 was also linked to the APOE polymorphism. Both SNPs were analyzed together, revealing a consistent presence of the APOE ε4 allele in the cohort, thereby supporting the notion of its role in cognitive impairment, especially in the context of MCI development.
title: Predicting the future development of mild cognitive impairment in the cognitively healthy elderly

finding: The BBC3 rs2032809 polymorphism was found to be associated with breast cancer risk and outcomes.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The TM6SF2 rs58542926 polymorphism was analyzed in association with liver health, particularly in conjunction with PNPLA3 findings.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The study described rs147400515 as a novel SNP linked to hsCRP levels, contributing to the understanding of its genetic underpinnings.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: This novel SNP was noted for its association with hsCRP levels, highlighting potential genetic risks for inflammation-related diseases.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The novel SNP rs4599021 was recognized for its link to hsCRP levels, underscoring its significance in chronic inflammation studies.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: Also identified as significant for hsCRP levels, rs429358 was recorded for its strong association in the study, linked with chronic disease risks.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The variant rs601338 was found to introduce a premature stop codon in the FUT2 gene. FUT2 was previously associated with various complex phenotypes, influencing vitamin B12 and folate pathways, as well as having links to inflammation, cognitive decline, and lipid levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association meta-analysis of dietary intake identifies new loci and genetic and functional links with metabolic traits

finding: The missense variant rs429358, located in the APOE gene, was associated with a faster decay rate of the hippocampus in carriers of the Alzheimer's disease risk variant, affirming its significant role in neurodegeneration and structure changes across the lifespan.
title: Age-dependent genetic variants associated with longitudinal changes in brain structure across the lifespan

finding: The rs10423769 A allele was positively identified as a protective factor against Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) for individuals carrying at least one APOE ε4 allele. Specifically, it was found to reduce the AD risk effect in APOE ε4 homozygotes by approximately 75% across various populations of African ancestry, including African Americans and individuals from Nigeria and Puerto Rico. Its protective nature was attributed to its location within a unique haplotype in a segmentally duplicated region of chromosome 19, lying 2Mb upstream of the APOE gene.
title: African origin haplotype protective for Alzheimer’s disease in APOEε4 carriers: exploring potential mechanisms

finding: The variant rs429358 in Apolipoprotein E (APOE) has been previously associated with simvastatin efficacy. This study found that carriers of this variant were more likely to be prescribed atorvastatin and higher doses of it. The evidence supported a significant association with statin response, showing an increase in LDL-c levels but a relative decrease in LDL-c levels in response to statin therapy.
title: LPA and APOE are associated with statin selection in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as part of the APOE genotype analysis in relation to the lipid metabolism and white matter integrity among older individuals. It was noted that APOE4 carriers, who could possess this SNP, experienced a decrease in white matter integrity associated with increased concentrations of LDL and VLDL metabolites.
title: APOE4 poses opposite effects of plasma LDL on white matter integrity in older adults

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also part of the genotype analysis for APOE. Similar to rs429358, this SNP contributed to the determination of APOE4 carrier status, which was linked to adverse effects on white matter integrity based on significant changes in metabolite concentrations.
title: APOE4 poses opposite effects of plasma LDL on white matter integrity in older adults

finding: The study provided evidence that the rs429358 SNP, which is associated with the APOE ε4 allele, increased the risk of developing Alzheimer’s disease (AD) phenotype among patients with mild traumatic brain injury (mTBI). Specifically, APOE ε4 carriers exhibited greater atrophy in the left superior temporal gyrus and middle temporal gyrus compared to healthy controls. Additionally, the atrophy in these regions was correlated with changes in language fluency performance in mTBI patients in this group.
title: Apolipoprotein E genotype modulates longitudinal atrophy at the temporal lobe after mild traumatic brain injury

finding: The presence of the rs7412 SNP, another genetic marker for the APOE ε4 allele, was linked to an increased risk of language dysfunction related to Alzheimer’s disease (AD) in conjunction with moderate or severe traumatic brain injury (TBI). In mTBI patients carrying the ε4 allele, there was significant gray matter atrophy that predicted performance changes in neuropsychological tests, emphasizing the role of genetic factors in the interplay between brain injuries and neurodegenerative processes.
title: Apolipoprotein E genotype modulates longitudinal atrophy at the temporal lobe after mild traumatic brain injury

finding: The MS SNP rs1465697 was identified as an eQTL for several genes including CD37, DKKL1, TEAD2, and SLC6A16. In the context of the KO of KLF2, TNFAIP3, and ZNF217, it was observed that there was a significant decrease in chromatin accessibility at the enhancer hosting rs1465697, which correlated with decreased expression of CD37. This suggested that rs1465697 might disrupt transcription factor binding within the enhancer, leading to altered CD37 expression.
title: Systematic discovery and perturbation of regulatory genes in human T cells reveals the architecture of immune networks

finding: The allele rs429358, associated with the APOE gene, was found to show a higher frequency in mixed DLB+AD cases compared to pure DLB cases. This was linked to a shorter disease duration of 6 ± 3 years in the mixed cases, compared to 8 ± 3 years in the pure DLB cases, indicating its potential role in disease progression.
title: Alzheimer’s disease copathology in dementia with Lewy bodies is associated with astroglial α-synucleinopathy

finding: The allele rs7412, also part of the APOE gene, was similarly found to have a higher frequency in mixed DLB+AD cases. This allele was involved in the observed correlation with a shorter disease duration among patients, reinforcing its association with accelerated clinical decline in the context of DLB pathology.
title: Alzheimer’s disease copathology in dementia with Lewy bodies is associated with astroglial α-synucleinopathy

finding: The rs601338 SNP in the FUT2 gene was associated with certain blood protein levels and known for its role in conferring resistance to infections, showing a positive selection signal.
title: Common homozygosity for predicted loss-of-function variants reveals both redundant and advantageous effects of dispensable human genes

finding: The GG genotype in SNP rs387976 was exclusively found in the outlier set. However, not all individuals categorized as outliers possessed the GG genotype, indicating that multiple patterns of genetic variance contributed to outlier status.
title: Generalization of the minimum covariance determinant algorithm for categorical and mixed data types

finding: The outlier set contained individuals who exhibited both the GG genotype for rs157580 and TT genotype for rs439401, which pointed to the presence of rare genotype combinations associated with outlier characteristics.
title: Generalization of the minimum covariance determinant algorithm for categorical and mixed data types

finding: Individuals who belonged to the outlier set often had the TT genotype at SNP rs439401 in conjunction with the rare GG genotype at rs157580, aligning with patterns that were atypical when compared to the inlier group.
title: Generalization of the minimum covariance determinant algorithm for categorical and mixed data types

finding: The SNP rs12608912 tagged a risk variant for prostate cancer and impacted the gene PPP1R14A, demonstrating responsiveness to the cell cycle G1/S transition. This variant was significant within the context of eQTL responsive to various cellular states.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing of differentiating iPS cells reveals dynamic genetic effects on gene expression

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with LDL, with an extremely low p-value of 3.85e-262, indicating a strong linkage between this SNP and the LDL phenotype.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with TRIGS, evidenced by a p-value of 9.702e-70, suggesting a robust connection to the triglyceride trait.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: Significant association was noted for this SNP with TRIGS, as indicated by a p-value of 3.441e-09, demonstrating its relevance to triglyceride levels.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: The SNP was identified as associated not only with Total Cholesterol but also with HDL at base pair position 54 Mb, indicating its role in lipid metabolism.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: The study reported a significant correlation between the CYP4F2 variant rs2108622 and susceptibility to ischemic stroke, in conjunction with the CYP4A11 variant rs9333025. This finding suggested that both SNPs were involved in the modulation of 20-hydroxyeicosatetraenoic acid (20-HETE) levels, which is important in cerebral blood flow (CBF) regulation.
title: 20-HETE-promoted cerebral blow flow autoregulation is associated with enhanced α-smooth muscle actin positive cerebrovascular pericyte contractility

finding: The rs2233678 polymorphism in the promoter region of the PIN1 gene was found to reduce cancer risk, as demonstrated in a meta-analysis published by Li et al. in 2013. This finding suggested a protective role of the SNP in relation to cancer susceptibility, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors influencing oncogenesis.
title: Sulfopin, a selective covalent inhibitor of Pin1, blocks Myc-driven tumor initiation and growth in vivo

finding: The missense variant ABCA7 p.Ala1527Gly (rs3752246) was identified as a moderate-risk genetic variant for Alzheimer's disease (AD), associated with an increased odds ratio of 1.15, indicating its contribution to AD risk was statistically significant. The study examined transcriptomic effects in excitatory neurons from carriers of this variant, with findings suggesting that carriers might exhibit perturbations similar to those observed in ABCA7 loss-of-function (LoF) carriers, thereby extending the implications of lipid metabolism disruptions in the context of AD pathology.
title: Single-cell atlas of ABCA7 loss-of-function reveals impaired neuronal respiration via choline-dependent lipid imbalances

finding: The finding regarding rs3865444 indicated that the AD-associated risk allele, specifically rs3865444(C), led to the inclusion of exon 2 in the CD33 gene, resulting in the production of full-length CD33 protein. In contrast, the protective allele, rs3865444(A), resulted in the skipping of exon 2, leading to the production of the Δe2 CD33 isoform. This differential splicing impacts the functionality of the CD33 protein in microglia, with full-length CD33 having an inhibitory effect on microglial activity, particularly concerning cytokine production and phagocytosis related to Alzheimer's disease, while the Δe2 variant does not possess these inhibitory effects.
title: Novel TREM2 splicing isoform that lacks the V-set immunoglobulin domain is abundant in the human brain

finding: The SNP rs12985827, located in the intron of the APC2 gene, displayed a strong preference for the C allele in SuRE assays, corresponding to an allelic imbalance consistent with DNase sensitivity data.
title: Systematic identification of human SNPs affecting regulatory element activity

finding: The study identified rs34536443 as a missense variant located in the gene TYK2, which was part of the original 95% credible sets.
title: Improving the coverage of credible sets in Bayesian genetic fine-mapping

finding: The rs10417143 variant was found to alter ZNF257 mRNA levels significantly, with an adjusted P-value of 2.8×10^-70. It was associated with 5mC levels at 16 remote CpG sites, which were enriched in binding sites for the ZNF534 transcription factor. This finding highlighted the role of genetic variants in regulating DNA methylation through transcription factor interactions.
title: Factors Driving DNA Methylation Variation in Human Blood

finding: As the top SNP for the haplotype 19AM3, this variant caused a potentially damaging missense change in LIG1 and was associated with a significant delay in onset of HD.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: This SNP served as the top SNP in haplotype 19AM1 and was associated with delayed onset of HD.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: The frameshift variant rs12979860 led to a complete ablation of IFNλ4 production. This SNP was notably associated with protection from chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection in humans, highlighting its significant impact on the immune response.
title: Conserved induction of distinct antiviral signalling kinetics by primate interferon lambda 4 proteins

finding: The non-synonymous variant rs117648444, which resulted in a proline to serine mutation at position 70, reduced the potency of interferon-stimulated gene (ISG) induction by IFNλ4. This variant was also implicated in conferring protection against chronic HCV infection, suggesting its role in modulating patient outcomes.
title: Conserved induction of distinct antiviral signalling kinetics by primate interferon lambda 4 proteins

finding: The SNV rs1555729452 (Cys222Tyr) was identified within the NOTCH3 gene, which is known to be causative for cerebral autosomal dominant arteriopathy with subcortical infarcts and leukoencephalopathy (CADASIL; MIM 125310). This variant was classified as pathogenic based on the American College of Medical Genetics and Genomics (ACMG) guidelines and was directly related to the patient's clinical presentation. The case demonstrated Exo-C's ability to effectively identify clinically relevant pathogenic SNVs, comparable to traditional exome sequencing methods.
title: A novel approach for simultaneous detection of structural and single-nucleotide variants based on a combination of chromosome conformation capture and exome sequencing

finding: The rs838133 A allele was associated with higher liking of sweet foods and lower levels of FGF21, aligning with previous studies indicating a preference shift from sweet to savory foods. This SNP's association illustrated a complex relationship where it influenced food preferences beyond simple likes, implicating it in broader dietary patterns.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of food liking reveals genetic determinants and genetic correlations with distinct neurophysiological traits

finding: The TM6SF2 rs58542926 (C>T; p.Glu167Lys) variant was associated with an increased prevalence of Metabolic Dysfunction-Associated Steatotic Liver Disease (MASLD), indicated by its role in lipid metabolism. This finding was evidenced by gene editing studies which showed that hepatocytes derived from iPSCs carrying the TM6SF2 E167K mutation recapitulated health conditions seen in human patients, including increased intracellular lipid droplets and signs of cellular stress. Further studies confirmed that individuals with this variant were at greater risk for liver diseases including advanced fibrosis, and the gene variant's effects were observed to correlate with increased levels of serum cholesterol and liver fat accumulation.
title: Human Induced Pluripotent Stem Cell based Hepatic-Modeling of Lipid metabolism associated TM6SF2 E167K variant

finding: The C3 R102G polymorphism (rs2230199) was associated with worse chronic lung allograft dysfunction (CLAD)-free survival in lung transplant recipients. Recipients carrying this SNP had increased risk of CLAD or death, especially when donor-specific antibodies (DSA) were present. Analysis in both the Washington University/Barnes-Jewish Hospital (BJH) and University of California-San Francisco (UCSF) cohorts demonstrated that those with the minor alleles CC/GC faced significantly worse outcomes, specifically showing a threefold increased risk for CLAD or death compared to those who had the wild-type genotype (GG), highlighting the SNP's role in complement activation and immune response post-transplant.
title: Impaired complement regulation drives chronic lung allograft dysfunction after lung transplantation

finding: The SNP rs641738 was linked to changes in platelet count and was part of the eQTLs associated with MBOAT7, highlighting a relationship between liver function and NAFLD.
title: Deciphering the genetic links between NAFLD and co-occurring conditions using a liver gene regulatory network

finding: The SNP rs2576452 was associated with blood metabolite ratios and influenced the expression of MBOAT7, which is connected to the multimorbid nature of NAFLD traits.
title: Deciphering the genetic links between NAFLD and co-occurring conditions using a liver gene regulatory network

finding: The rs449647 SNP was significantly associated with Alzheimer's disease, particularly noted in several studies that identified it as a risk allele. The genetic analysis confirmed that the A-allele of this SNP correlated with lower APOE expression in brain tissues including the hippocampus. Furthermore, association studies indicated its effect on plasma APOE levels, contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors influencing Alzheimer's disease.
title: A transcriptional mechanism involving R-loop, m6A modification and RNA abasic sites regulates an enhancer RNA of APOE

finding: The rs405509 SNP also demonstrated significant association with Alzheimer's disease, as identified in multiple studies grouped within the GWAS Catalog. Similar to rs449647, this SNP was involved in the regulation of APOE expression, further implicating its role in Alzheimer's disease susceptibility through influence on genetic expression in brain tissue.
title: A transcriptional mechanism involving R-loop, m6A modification and RNA abasic sites regulates an enhancer RNA of APOE

finding: The IFI30 rs11554159 SNP was linked to the onset and severity of multiple sclerosis, marking its importance in neuroinflammatory conditions.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: SNP rs2304204 in IRF3 was determined to be a functional SNP that influences antiviral responses and eQTL activity in various tissues. The prevalence of its genotypes (Memphis: 40% GG, 40% AG, 20% AA; Nicaragua: 11% GG, 45% AG, 44% AA) demonstrated substantial impact on gene expression connected with immune responses.
title: Integrated Drivers of Basal and Acute Immunity in Diverse Human Populations

finding: The rs527221 SNP located in exon 10 of the DMPK gene was utilized to differentiate mutant CUG expanded RNA from wild-type DMPK RNA. In individuals with DM1 who carried the heterozygous rs527221 SNP, the guanine (G) allele was linked to the CTG expansion allele, while the cytosine (C) allele was associated with the normal allele. Using Nanoplate Digital PCR (dPCR), researchers quantified the two types of DMPK transcripts, highlighting the mutation's impact in individuals affected by DM1.
title: Regulation of Toxic RNA Foci and Mutant DMPK Transcripts: Role of MBNL Proteins and RNA Decay Pathways

finding: The short deletion SNP rs5827412 was crucial in reducing PU.1 motif score and was tied to lower expression levels of <LRRC25> in monocytes. This finding also associated significantly with monocyte percentage and neutrophil count changes.
title: Colocalization of blood cell traits GWAS associations and variation in PU.1 genomic occupancy prioritizes causal noncoding regulatory variants

finding: The study identified significant allele-specific expression (ASE) for CFH rs2230199 in both the normal and intermediate AMD macular RPE/choroid, demonstrating its relevance to AMD pathophysiology.
title: Patterns of gene expression and allele-specific expression vary among macular tissues and clinical stages of Age-related Macular Degeneration

finding: The in-frame deletion of hcp1 in V. parahaemolyticus, corresponding to the SNP rs15290, was constructed in strain 12-297/B as described previously, impacting the pathogenicity of the bacterium.
title: Engineering a customizable antibacterial T6SS-based platform in Vibrio natriegens

finding: The SNP rs34536443 in TYK2 was highlighted as a rare variant with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.04 in the general population. The significance of this variant was reinforced by its role as a credible genetic risk factor for Type 1 Diabetes (T1D), with implications for the understanding of the mechanisms by which T1D risk is influenced by genetic factors.
title: Use of Induced Pluripotent Stem Cells to Build Isogenic Systems and Investigate Type 1 Diabetes

finding: The SNP rs1801714 (C>T) was associated with ICAM-1 expression, which was pivotal in the NKp44-mediated immune synapse and crucial for NK cell-mediated destruction of HCT-116 tumor cells, thereby highlighting its importance in regulatory pathways of NK cell activity.
title: Genome-wide CRISPR/Cas9 screen reveals factors that influence the susceptibility of tumor cells to NK cell-mediated killing

finding: The SNP rs5498 (A>G) was also connected to the regulation of ICAM-1 levels, enhancing NK cell-mediated cytotoxicity in the context of tumor cell resistance, signifying its role in influencing NK cell interactions with tumor cells.
title: Genome-wide CRISPR/Cas9 screen reveals factors that influence the susceptibility of tumor cells to NK cell-mediated killing

finding: The rs115550680 SNP in the ABCA7 locus was associated with a significant OR of 1.79 in African Americans, marking it as a strong risk variant in this population.
title: How understudied populations have contributed to our understanding of Alzheimer’s disease genetics

finding: The SNP rs429358, which is associated with the apolipoprotein E (APOE) genotype, was analyzed in the context of plasma lipid levels and white blood cell counts. Though the study did not find a direct causal relationship between lipids and leukogenesis, the existence of this SNP was important for determining genotype related to lipid metabolism.
title: The association of plasma lipids with white blood cell counts: Results from the Multi-Ethnic Study of Atherosclerosis

finding: The SNP rs7412 is also linked to the APOE genotype and was investigated alongside rs429358 in the study regarding plasma lipids and white blood cell counts. Similar to rs429358, it played a role in understanding the genetic factors influencing lipid levels, but the study concluded that there wasn't strong evidence supporting a direct impact on white blood cell counts from lipid levels in relation to APOE genotypes.
title: The association of plasma lipids with white blood cell counts: Results from the Multi-Ethnic Study of Atherosclerosis

finding: The SNP rs41290120, located intronically in the gene PVRL2 and in linkage disequilibrium with rs7412, demonstrated significant meQTL associations with various CpGs. Similar to rs7412, it was involved in the methylation regulation of genes related to lipid homeostasis within the APOE locus.
title: Assessment of DNA methylation differences between carriers of APOE ε4 and APOE ε2

finding: The G allele of rs3810154 was shown to promote SLC44A2 expression by enhancing chromatin accessibility, indicating its potential involvement as an effector gene in OA risk.
title: Comprehensive profiling of transcriptional regulation in cartilage reveals pathogenesis of osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs3764650, a common high-penetrant risk SNP for Alzheimer's disease, was found to overlap with multiple insertions within dark loci in the ABCA7 gene, which is implicated in cholesterol metabolism and phagocytosis in the brain. These insertions varied in length from 300 bp to 7 kbp, linking the structural variants directly to the genetic risk for Alzheimer's.
title: Nanopore-based DNA long-read sequencing analysis of the aged human brain

finding: The study reported that the risk SNP rs115550680 overlapped with a polymorphic AluYa8 element. This connection emphasizes the potential involvement of complex variants in Alzheimer's disease pathogenesis, suggesting that SNPs linked with retrotransposons may play a role in genetic predisposition.
title: Nanopore-based DNA long-read sequencing analysis of the aged human brain

finding: The SNP rs11671106 was located at the BHMG1 locus, associated with asthma and predicted to be a damaging missense variant as assessed by PolyPhen.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The SNP rs4420638 was validated as a locus for HFpEF among women in the WHI, JHS, and FHS populations, with a false discovery rate (FDR)-adjusted q value of less than 0.05. This locus was adjacent to the APOE and APOC genes.
title: Biological Pathways and Gene Networks Link Inflammation and Vascular Remodeling to Both Heart Failure with Preserved and Reduced Ejection Fraction in Women across Ethnicities

finding: This SNP was identified as a cholesterol-associated eQTL linked to expression levels of the genes APOE, BCAM, RYRI, and RERE. These genes were supported by literature demonstrating their relevance to cholesterol metabolism.
title: Reconstructing the blood metabolome and genotype using long-range chromatin interactions

finding: The SNP rs8103622 was identified as a candidate functional variant in breast cancer and blood. It changed the binding affinity of a CTCF motif, resulting in a significant allelic imbalance between alleles C and T in MCF-7 cell lines. Furthermore, it was in strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) with SNPs rs4808801 and rs7258465, which were associated with breast cancer risk.
title: funMotifs: Tissue-specific transcription factor motifs

finding: The rs2228671 SNP in the low density lipoprotein receptor (LDLR) gene was investigated in relation to coronary heart disease. The meta-analysis conducted by Ye et al. (2014) indicated that this polymorphism significantly affected LDLR function and correlated with an increased risk of coronary heart disease. This finding contributed valuable insight into the genetic factors influencing lipid metabolism and cardiovascular health.
title: A Genome-wide CRISPR-Cas9 Screen Identifies Host Factors Essential for Optimal Plasmodium Liver Stage Development

finding: The MBOAT7 rs641738 variant was associated with metabolic dysfunction, which impacts cardiovascular risk, supporting its relevance to heart health.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs12979860, associated with the interferon-lambda gene, was analyzed in the context of liver fibrosis in both viral and non-viral chronic liver diseases. The findings indicated that the presence of this genotype had significant implications for the severity of liver fibrosis, suggesting a role of genetic factors in the progression of chronic liver conditions, including those relevant to non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). This elucidated the influence of genetic variability on disease outcomes.
title: A systematic analysis of rodent models implicates adipogenesis and innate immunity in pathogenesis of fatty liver disease

finding: The minor allele of rs56069439 was associated with reduced mitochondrial DNA copy number and was identified as an eQTL for ANKLE1. It showed a direct relationship linking lower mitochondrial DNA levels with higher ANKLE1 expression, reinforcing the connection between ANKLE1 and mitochondrial function in cancer biology.
title: ANKLE1 cleaves mitochondrial DNA and contributes to cancer risk by promoting apoptosis resistance and metabolic dysregulation

finding: The SNP rs1862513 correlated with susceptibility to nonalcoholic fatty liver disease, demonstrating its genetic impact in this condition.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: The SNP rs7412 was significant for LDL cholesterol in the study, exhibiting heterogeneity due to both environmental factors and ancestry.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs138294113 demonstrated heterogeneity due to ancestry alone, contributing to the understanding of genetic variation in LDL cholesterol.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs2075650, associated with the minor allele of the TOMM40 gene, was reported to have increased risk for Alzheimer’s disease (AD). The TOMM40 gene is crucial as it encodes the outer mitochondrial membrane pore subunit, which is necessary for oxidative phosphorylation and facilitates protein transport into mitochondria. This suggests a significant role of mitochondrial function in the pathophysiology of AD.
title: Selective vulnerability and resilience to Alzheimer’s disease tauopathy as a function of genes and the connectome

finding: The rs2288904 variant, associated with the distinction between HNA-3a and HNA-3b antigens, displayed allele frequencies of 96.7% in Africans, 85.2% in Americans, 71.0% in East Asians, 76.4% in Europeans, and 75.5% in South Asians for HNA-3a. In contrast, the frequencies for HNA-3b were 3.3%, 14.8%, 29.0%, 23.6%, and 24.5% respectively.
title: Genetic epidemiology of human neutrophil antigen variants suggest significant global variability

finding: The rs147820753 mutation was found to impair the HNA-3a epitope, with a frequency ranging from 0 to 0.4% across global populations. This variant induced a Leu151Phe amino acid change and was recognized as impairing agglutination.
title: Genetic epidemiology of human neutrophil antigen variants suggest significant global variability

finding: The study found significant associations between the ApoE SNP rs7412 and fractional anisotropy (FA) in white matter (WM) regions linked to neurodegenerative diseases. This association was evident even in healthy individuals and highlighted regional age-by-genotype interactions, indicating that the E2 allele of ApoE had protective effects on WM microstructure across the lifespan.
title: Lifespan reference curves for harmonizing multi-site regional brain white matter metrics from diffusion MRI

finding: For the ApoE SNP rs429358, significant associations were also found with FA in WM regions associated with neurodegenerative diseases. Similar to rs7412, this SNP demonstrated regional age-by-genotype interactions, with the E4 allele being linked to reductions in WM microstructure integrity in healthy individuals throughout their lifespan.
title: Lifespan reference curves for harmonizing multi-site regional brain white matter metrics from diffusion MRI

finding: The SNP rs204468 was associated with a novel read-through isoform at the TOMM40-APOE locus, which is significant for Alzheimer's disease. The disease risk allele for rs204468 was found to increase the ratio of the read-through isoform in non-stimulated monocytes, suggesting its role in the pathogenesis of Alzheimer's.
title: Immune Isoform Atlas: Landscape of alternative splicing in human immune cells

finding: The C allele of rs429358 was significantly associated with decreased neuronal proportion, meaning that this SNP could contribute to the effects seen in AD. It is known to codetermine the APOE ε4 isoform, which has the largest impact on AD risk.
title: The TMEM106B rs1990621 protective variant is also associated with increased neuronal proportion

finding: This synonymous variant in GPR108 was found associated with reaction time, confirming its genetic linkage to cognitive processing.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The intronic variant rs77285514 in GPR108 was detected to be significantly associated with reaction time, further establishing links between genetic variability and cognitive function.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The variant rs1064725 in APOC1 was significant for cognitive traits when interacting with APOE, suggesting its involvement in cognitive mechanisms.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The rs10421768 SNP was assessed for its link with iron metabolism-related sleep disorders in a study by Skonieczna-Żydecka et al. in 2020.
title: Comprehensive analysis of next-generation sequencing data in COVID-19 and its secondary complications

finding: The MBOAT7 rs641738 C>T variant was associated with a notable increase in mitochondrial biomass in individuals carrying the variant as compared to noncarriers. Specifically, T allele carriers showed elevated nuclear PGC-1α positivity which indicates enhanced mitochondrial biogenesis, supporting the notion that this variant significantly influences mitochondrial dynamics in MASLD patients.
title: Artificial intelligence as a ploy to delve into the intricate relationship between genetics and mitochondria in MASLD patients

finding: The TM6SF2 E167K variant demonstrated a significant association with increased mitochondrial biomass comparable to the MBOAT7 variant. Individuals carrying this SNP exhibited enhanced expression of circulating D-loop and ccf-COXIII, indicating a potential role in the modulation of mitochondrial function and dynamics in MASLD, consistent with findings from patients with the MBOAT7 and PNPLA3 variants.
title: Artificial intelligence as a ploy to delve into the intricate relationship between genetics and mitochondria in MASLD patients

finding: The SNP rs123698 in Ptbp1 was correlated with levels of C-reactive protein (CRP), a significant marker for systemic inflammatory responses. This correlation suggested a potential involvement of Ptbp1 in atherosclerosis, as higher levels of Ptbp1 were linked to more severe plaque formation and were associated with activity markers of the TNFα-NFκB signaling pathway in human arteries. The study indicated that understanding the relationship between this SNP and inflammatory processes might enhance insights into inflammatory risks associated with atherosclerosis and similar conditions.
title: Splice Factor Polypyrimidine tract-binding protein 1 (Ptbp1) is Required for Immune Priming of the Endothelium in Atherogenic Disturbed Flow Conditions

finding: The C allele of rs429358, a tagging variant for the APOE E4 allele, was associated with lower Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) scores (Beta -0.20 [-0.33, -0.07], P-value = 2.8E-3) and lower MoCA scores (Beta -0.52 [-0.86, -0.17], P-value = 3.4E-3), indicating a correlation with cognitive deficits in Parkinson's disease.
title: Genome-wide association study of Parkinson’s disease progression biomarkers in 12 longitudinal patients’ cohorts

finding: The variant rs1800469 was identified as a proxy for the pQTL rs2241714, both of which were associated with colorectal cancer. This SNP affected multiple serum proteins, including B3GNT2 and TGFB1, which have prior implications in colorectal cancer.
title: Human serum proteome profoundly overlaps with genetic signatures of disease

finding: The SNP rs2241714, a proxy for rs1800469, regulated serum levels of proteins B3GNT2, B3GNT8, and TGFB1 in both cis and trans, and was linked with colorectal cancer risk.
title: Human serum proteome profoundly overlaps with genetic signatures of disease

finding: In the study, the single nucleotide polymorphism rs1001281 was identified within the AP2A1 gene and was significantly associated with 'MaxDrinks', a heritable trait linked to the risk of developing alcohol use disorder (AUD). Experimental tests illustrated that higher AP2A1 expression correlated with increased voluntary alcohol drinking among control and alcohol-dependent BXD recombinant inbred mouse strains. Notably, BXD strains inheriting the C57BL/6J allele at the Ap2a1 interval displayed significantly higher alcohol consumption compared to those with the DBA/2J allele. Thus, rs1001281 was highlighted as an important genetic factor influencing alcohol consumption behavior across species.
title: Adaptor protein complex 2 in the orbitofrontal cortex predicts alcohol use disorder

finding: The rs429358:C allele linked to Alzheimer’s disease showed a distribution that correlated with WHG/EHG ancestry, with positive selection starting around 7,000 years ago.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: Like rs429358, the rs7412:C allele associated with Alzheimer's disease also displayed evidence of adaptive selection starting approximately 7,000 years ago and plateauing around 2,500 years ago.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The SNP rs429358 was recognized as a missense variant within APOE that altered the amino acid at position 130. It significantly increased the risk of Alzheimer's disease and was further associated with biomarkers linked to Alzheimer's, including tau and amyloid-β levels, as well as being related to age-related cognitive decline and verbal memory.
title: Shared and distinct genetic influences between cognitive domains and psychiatric disorder risk based on genome-wide data

finding: Located near ZNF257, this variant was identified as tagging an inversion linked to T2D susceptibility in East Asian populations.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: The SNP rs2241712 located in the promoter region of the TGFB1 gene was significantly associated with COPD among smokers in a case-control study, emphasizing the role of this genetic variant in the presence of environmental factors.
title: Test Gene-Environment Interactions for Multiple Traits in Sequencing Association Studies

finding: Similar to rs2241712, the SNP rs1800469 in the TGFB1 gene was also found to have a significant association with COPD among smokers, further reinforcing the connection between genetic predisposition and lifestyle factors.
title: Test Gene-Environment Interactions for Multiple Traits in Sequencing Association Studies

finding: The SNP rs12974850 was associated with lincRNA RP11-290F20.3 in FCGR3A+ monocytes, suggesting a genetic influence on immune response-related gene expression.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The rs429358 SNP in the apolipoprotein E (APOE) gene was associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk. This SNP was part of the genotyping process that linked genetic variants to alterations in immune response related to AD, suggesting its involvement in the inflammatory profiles of individuals with the disease.
title: Peripheral sTREM2-related inflammatory activity alterations in early stage Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs7412 SNP associated with the APOE gene was analyzed for its role in Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk. This SNP was part of the same genotyping approach, establishing a connection between genetic predisposition and the inflammatory changes observed in AD patients.
title: Peripheral sTREM2-related inflammatory activity alterations in early stage Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs2075650 was identified as being consistently associated with Alzheimer’s disease (AD). It is located in the TOMM40 gene, which is implicated in mitochondrial metabolic changes observed in AD patients. The connection between rs2075650 and AD has also been supported by findings from the eMERGE network.
title: Deep Learning-based Feature Extraction with MRI Data in Neuroimaging Genetics for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Variant rs3892630 was also predicted to increase binding affinity and this was successfully validated through EMSA, revealing a 2.3-fold change in binding affinity. This indicated that rs3892630 significantly contributes to the differential binding of NKX2-5.
title: Disease-Associated Non-Coding Variants Alter NKX2-5 DNA-Binding Affinity

finding: The study found that allele variations at rs429358, associated with the APOE gene, were linked to reduced signal complexity and EEG slowing, indicating alterations in brain function that may precede Alzheimer's Disease (AD).
title: Alzheimer’s disease-like features in resting state EEG/fMRI of cognitively intact and healthy middle-aged APOE/PICALM risk carriers

finding: The findings related to rs7412 suggested that this APOE allele variant was also associated with changes in brain integrity and function, further supporting its involvement in increased risk for late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD).
title: Alzheimer’s disease-like features in resting state EEG/fMRI of cognitively intact and healthy middle-aged APOE/PICALM risk carriers

finding: The SNP rs7247241 was associated with allele-specific methylation in the 22Rv1 genome. Specifically, the T allele showed hypermethylation compared to the C allele within a 162-bp co-methylated region. This SNP was also linked to increased expression of the oncogene PPP1R14A, as demonstrated by ATAC-seq results indicating that the hypomethylated C allele was more accessible than the hypermethylated T allele.
title: Fine Mapping Regulatory Variants by Characterizing Native CpG Methylation with Nanopore Long-Read Sequencing

finding: The SNP rs4807179 showed enhancer marks in relevant tissues, indicating potential importance for obesity-related traits.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: There was a missense mutation in LONP1 (rs11085147) that was associated with methylation levels at mt-tRNA-G (position 9999) and mt-tRNA-H (position 12146). LONP1 is a mitochondrial matrix protein involved in degrading damaged polypeptides and maturing mitochondrial proteins, showing a clear functional link to RNA modification.
title: Nuclear genetic regulation of human mitochondrial RNA modification

finding: The rare missense variant in the GIP receptor gene (GIPR), known as rs143430880, was associated with lower bone mineral density (BMD) in humans. This finding was significant as it suggested a genetic influence on bone density related to GIPR signaling, although it did not affect the overall risk of bone fractures. This knowledge supports the understanding of the genetic factors influencing osteoporosis and bone health.
title: GIP receptor reduces osteoclast activity and improves osteoblast survival by activating multiple signaling pathways

finding: The rs7412 variant was associated with increased risk of Alzheimer’s disease and cardiovascular conditions, defined through the interactions of major APOE structural isoforms.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The rs429358 variant contributed to the risk assessment of Alzheimer's disease and cardiovascular traits, through its association with different APOE isoforms.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The rs34536443_G>C variant was significantly associated with multiple immune-related diseases, including psoriasis and RA, confirming previous associations in GWAS.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The rs12720356_A>C variant was linked to ulcerative colitis and several autoimmune diseases, supporting its implications in immune-mediated conditions.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The study demonstrated that mothers carrying CA/CC genotypes of rs8109886 had a 4.5 times reduced risk of having children with Congenital Zika Syndrome (CZS), with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.22 and a confidence interval (CI) of 0.05-0.91. Furthermore, the combination of CA/CC from rs8109886 and CC from rs12979860 resulted in 93% of mothers delivering healthy newborns, indicating strong protective effects against CZS.
title: Congenital Zika Syndrome is associated with maternal genetic background

finding: The analysis showed that the combination of genotypes C at rs8109886 and C at rs12979860 significantly reduced the risk of abnormal CZS by 14.3 times (OR = 0.07; CI=0.01-0.5). This evidence highlighted rs12979860 as a relevant polymorphism that, when arranged with rs8109886, complemented the protective effect from CZS.
title: Congenital Zika Syndrome is associated with maternal genetic background

finding: The SNP rs429358 in the APOE gene was associated with Alzheimer Disease (AD) and was identified as a significant risk factor for developing the condition. This finding highlights the critical role of the APOE allele in the pathogenesis of AD.
title: Open Science Datasets from PREVENT-AD, a Longitudinal Cohort of Pre-symptomatic Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs7412, also located in the APOE gene, was linked to Alzheimer's Disease as well. This SNP, along with rs429358, contributed to the established genetic predisposition for the disorder, emphasizing the importance of APOE genotype in AD risk.
title: Open Science Datasets from PREVENT-AD, a Longitudinal Cohort of Pre-symptomatic Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs612529T/C was associated with expression levels of SIRL-1 on monocytes, indicating that the C allele correlated with decreased SIRL-1 expression on these immune cells. This investigation was part of a study examining soluble SIRL-1 (sSIRL-1) protein levels in samples from healthy individuals, and the results suggested that while sSIRL-1 was present in the plasma of healthy individuals, the presence tended to be lower in those with the C allele. However, these differences did not reach statistical significance.
title: Soluble signal inhibitory receptor on leukocytes-1 is released from activated neutrophils by proteinase 3 cleavage

finding: The SNP rs16985478 exhibited a significant departure from Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium expectations (HWE), with a p-value of 0.0118. This finding indicated that this variant was relevant in the Brazilian population sample studied.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: The rs1061679 variant was associated with positive selection according to FUBAR analysis and was identified as affecting LILRB1 protein folding. It contributed to a haplotype that demonstrated notable binding with HLA molecules.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: The rs1061680 SNP was under positive selection and influenced the binding of LILRB1 to HLA-G. It was recognized as a part of the major haplotype that conferred strength in binding affinity.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: The variant rs1061681 was identified as a positively selected SNP that potentially affects protein stability, contributing to structural changes relevant to immune responses.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: The rs7247025 SNP was noted for not following Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium expectations with a p-value of 0.0247, indicating a significant deviation and suggesting its potential relevance.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: This SNP was identified with a deviation from HWE expectations (p-value = 0.0429), indicating its potential importance in the genetic diversity studied.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: The SNP rs10404685 was associated with a decline in alignment with HWE, exhibiting a p-value of 0.0267, marking its significance in the population.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: The rs383369 variant was associated with lower LILRB2 expression levels and was noted to be part of haplogroup showing positive selection, highlighting its functional relevance in immune regulation.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: The SNP was identified as positively selected with stabilizing mutations identified by FoldX4 analysis, contributing to structural integrity in LILRB2.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: The rs1128646 SNP was highlighted as positively selected according to FUBAR analysis, indicating its significance in the population and potential impact on protein function.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: Contributions to positive selection were noted for this SNP, alongside its involvement in defining haplogroup variations, underscoring its role in LILRB2 diversity.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: The SNP showed extremely high heterozygosity in the European population, suggesting an unusual genetic structure as highlighted in the context.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: The SNP rs7412, which defines the \'E2 allele\', was part of the analysis that confirmed the strong association of the APOE region with diagnostic outcomes for Alzheimer's disease (AD). It was mentioned in the context of comparing genotypes and validating local genotypes in the EMIF-AD MBD dataset.
title: Genome-wide association study of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarkers in the EMIF-AD Multimodal Biomarker Discovery dataset

finding: The SNP rs429358, defining the \'E4 allele\', showed a significant association with AD diagnosis, with a P-value of 2.68E-07 and an odds ratio (OR) of 2.26, solidifying its status as a major risk factor for AD. Additionally, it was associated with amyloid classification with a P-value of 1.95E-25 and an OR of 5.66, confirming its role in AD-related biomarker variability.
title: Genome-wide association study of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarkers in the EMIF-AD Multimodal Biomarker Discovery dataset

finding: The rs7412 SNP was part of the APOE genotype assessment in various cohorts, which played a crucial role in investigating the interactions between APOE alleles and the Haptoglobin (HP) polymorphism regarding the risk and age of onset of Alzheimer's Disease (AD). It was essential for establishing the significant association of AD risk mediated by HP variants.
title: A Haptoglobin (HP) Structural Variant Alters the Effect of APOE Alleles on Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Similar to rs7412, the rs429358 SNP was used to define the APOE genotype across multiple cohorts. It contributed to understanding how the APOE genotype interacts with the HP polymorphism to affect the risk and onset of Alzheimer's Disease, highlighting its role in modifying the effects of both protective and detrimental APOE alleles on AD.
title: A Haptoglobin (HP) Structural Variant Alters the Effect of APOE Alleles on Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This study associated the resistin rs3745367 SNP with the risk of type 2 diabetes mellitus in an Indian population, contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors for diabetes.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs4420638 was identified as suggesting <cis-naGI> effects specifically related to the <APOE> locus. This SNP was implicated in pairwise genetic interactions that affected lipid traits, contributing to the overall non-additive genetic interactions observed between loci.
title: Pairwise genetic interactions modulate lipid plasma levels and cellular uptake

finding: This variant significantly increased the expression of DCAF15 in artery-aorta, artery-tibial, and heart-atrial appendage tissues, backed by low p-values, indicating a notable association.
title: Unveiling the role of Tdark genes in genetic diseases and phenotypes through bioinformatics-based functional enrichment and network analyses

finding: The Olink-specific variant rs4905 was associated with IL-27 and demonstrated strong linkage with missense variants that could impact the protein's function.
title: Cross-platform proteomics to advance genetic prioritisation strategies

finding: The pQTL rs281379 was linked to glycosyltransferase activity affecting protein target accessibility, stressing its biological relevance.
title: Cross-platform proteomics to advance genetic prioritisation strategies

finding: The SNP rs7412 was related to the determination of APOE genotypes, specifically the presence of the ε4 allele which is a significant genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease. Individuals with a positive family history of dementia showed a higher frequency of the ε4 allele.
title: Genetic risk of dementia modifies the impact of obesity on limbic white matter and spatial navigation behavior in cognitively healthy adults

finding: The SNP rs429358 was similarly involved in genotyping the APOE alleles. It indicated a notable association between the APOE ε4 allele and the increased genetic risk of developing Alzheimer's disease, particularly in participants with a family history of dementia. This SNP also showed that individuals with the ε4 allele were more prevalent among those reporting a first-grade relative affected by Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genetic risk of dementia modifies the impact of obesity on limbic white matter and spatial navigation behavior in cognitively healthy adults

finding: Related to lower odds of MHQ participation, this missense mutation in the APOE gene linked the C-allele with the APOE-ε4 genotype, a major Alzheimer's risk factor.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: Identified as contributing to participation in various measures, indicating broad influence on participation-related traits.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs429358 was crucial in determining the APOE ɛ4 allele status, which involved a combination of this variant with rs7412(C). This finding was particularly relevant in understanding structural patterns in the hippocampus and default network regions, which were associated with Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias (ADRD) risk.
title: APOE ɛ2 vs APOE ɛ4 dosage shows sex-specific links to hippocampus-default network subregion co-variation

finding: The SNP rs7412, alongside rs429358, defined the APOE ɛ2 allele status through a combination with rs429358(T). This variant was significant in the study, as it interacted with different brain structures in relation to ADRD, revealing important co-variation patterns related to family history of dementia.
title: APOE ɛ2 vs APOE ɛ4 dosage shows sex-specific links to hippocampus-default network subregion co-variation

finding: The SNP rs12720356, located in the TYK2 gene, was associated with Crohn's disease and psoriasis. The study explored its pleiotropic relationships using expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) data from the GTEx database and identified several genes (FDX1L, ICAM1, ICAM5, KRI1, MRPL4, GRAP2, TMED1, TYK2, ZGLP6) whose expression levels were linked to this SNP. Additionally, query results from EpiGraphDB provided connections to biological pathways and protein-protein interactions, indicating the potential complex roles of this SNP in various biological processes.
title: EpiGraphDB: A database and data mining platform for health data science

finding: The lead variant rs117960796 was associated with sICAM-1 levels. In conditioned analyses, another significant association (rs74428614) was found, indicating multiple independent variants contributing to sICAM-1 variability in the locus.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies seven novel loci associating with circulating cytokines and cell adhesion molecules in Finns

finding: The SNP rs74428614 showed significant association with sICAM-1 levels when analyzed alongside rs117960796 and highlighted the complexity of genetic contributions to ICAM-1 level variation.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies seven novel loci associating with circulating cytokines and cell adhesion molecules in Finns

finding: The rs12979860 polymorphism was associated with an increased risk of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) in patients from Japan, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.28 (95% CI: 1.07-1.52, P=0.0058). This association was significant in HCV-infected individuals both with and without cirrhosis, emphasizing its importance in HCC risk despite a modestly lower incidence of liver cirrhosis.
title: IFN-λ4 may contribute to HCV persistence by increasing ER stress and enhancing IRF1 signaling

finding: The SNP rs58542926 located in the TM6SF2 gene was found to influence hepatic fibrosis progression specifically in patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease. This finding was reported in a study published in Nature Communications, indicating that individuals carrying this variant may exhibit altered disease progression related to liver fibrosis.
title: Sample size calculation for a NanoString GeoMx spatial transcriptomics experiment to study predictors of fibrosis progression in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease

finding: The MBOAT7-TMC4 variant rs641738 was identified as increasing the risk of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease in individuals of European descent. This correlation was documented in a study published in Gastroenterology, highlighting its significance in the broader context of genetic predisposition to liver diseases.
title: Sample size calculation for a NanoString GeoMx spatial transcriptomics experiment to study predictors of fibrosis progression in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease

finding: The SNP rs11546996 was associated with the gene PNKP. Although previous GWAS identified this SNP as related to primary biliary cirrhosis with the gene SPIB indicating a different causal pathway, our findings suggested a new association with PNKP, possibly indicating novel insights into the genetic understanding of the disease, specifically concerning its role in hepatocyte function.
title: Incorporation of DNA methylation into eQTL mapping in African Americans

finding: The SNP rs350845 was associated with living beyond 100 years among Ashkenazi Jewish centenarians. It was indicated as a cis-eQTL for SIRT6 upregulation and demonstrated a nominal significance with a p-value of 0.049.
title: A rare human centenarian variant of SIRT6 enhances genome stability and interaction with Lamin A

finding: The study utilized polymerase chain reaction (PCR) to determine the ApoEε4 carriership, with imputed genotype values from the Haplotype Reference Consortium (HRC) for rs7412 being essential in defining this risk factor. The ApoEε4 allele is known to significantly impact dementia susceptibility.
title: Grey Matter Age Prediction as a Biomarker for Risk of Dementia: A Population-based Study

finding: Similarly, rs429358 provided crucial imputed genotype values through PCR and HRC data to assess ApoEε4 carriership. This SNP is established as an important genetic marker for evaluating dementia risk in the studied population.
title: Grey Matter Age Prediction as a Biomarker for Risk of Dementia: A Population-based Study

finding: The variant rs111444407 was identified as a GWAS-associated variant linked to bipolar disorder. It was located within the MAU2 locus and demonstrated a significant trans-interchromosomal eQTL with the REC8 gene, indicating a spatial-regulatory connection that reflects the regulation of cohesin-related genes. This relationship suggests a coordinated regulation that is crucial for maintaining genetic expression levels, particularly within the context of the cohesinopathy disorders.
title: Low tolerance for transcriptional variation at cohesin genes is accompanied by functional links to disease-relevant pathways

finding: The SNP rs2305809 was associated with cervical cancer, as demonstrated in a case-control study conducted by da Rocha Boeira et al. in 2018. This finding indicated that this specific polymorphism located in the upstream region of the RPS19 gene may play a role in the development of cervical cancer, contributing to the understanding of genetic susceptibility in this disease.
title: Deciphering the protein dynamics and molecular determinants of iPSC-derived neurons

finding: The ABCA7*A1527G variant was identified as the most common of multiple predicted loss-of-function variants associated with increased LOAD risk at the ABCA7 locus. This finding highlighted its relevance to late-onset Alzheimer's disease.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The SHC2*V433M variant was identified through ADSP exomes and was linked to neurodegeneration and neuron loss, indicating its potential involvement in Alzheimer's disease.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: This SNP was identified in the pooled analysis as a rare variant connected to American ancestry.
title: Cloud gazing: demonstrating paths for unlocking the value of cloud genomics through cross-cohort analysis

finding: This SNP was recognized as a significant rare variant in the context of American ancestry within the pooled analysis.
title: Cloud gazing: demonstrating paths for unlocking the value of cloud genomics through cross-cohort analysis
